verses.sanskrit: अबोध्य अग्निः समिधा जनानाम परति धेनुम इवायतीम उषासम यह्वा इव पर वयाम उज्जिहानाः पर भानवः सिस्रते नाकम अछ |||
verses.transliteration: abodhy aghniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣāsam yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam acha

translations.griffith: Agni is wakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who cometh like a milch-cow.  Like young trees shooting up on high their branches, his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अबोधि होता यजथाय देवान ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमनाः परातर अस्थात समिद्धस्य रुशद अदर्शि पाजो महान देवस तमसो निर अमोचि |||
verses.transliteration: abodhi hotā yajathāya devān ūrdhvo aghniḥ sumanāḥ prātar asthāt samiddhasya ruśad adarśi pājo mahān devas tamaso nir amoci

translations.griffith: For worship of the Gods the Priest was wakened: at morning gracious Agni hath arisen.  Kindled, his radiant might is made apparent, and the great Deity set free from darkness.

verses.sanskrit: यद ईं गणस्य रशनाम अजीगः शुचिर अङकते शुचिभिर गोभिर अग्निः आद दक्षिणा युज्यते वाजयन्त्य उत्तानाम ऊर्ध्वो अधयज जुहूभिः |||
verses.transliteration: yad īṃ ghaṇasya raśanām ajīghaḥ śucir aṅkte śucibhir ghobhir aghniḥ ād dakṣiṇā yujyate vājayanty uttānām ūrdhvo adhayaj juhūbhiḥ

translations.griffith: When he hath stirred the line of his attendants, with the pure milk pure Agni is anointed.  The strength-bestowing gift is then made ready, which spread in front, with tongues, erect, he drinketh.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निम अछा देवयताम मनांसि चक्षूंषीव सूर्ये सं चरन्ति यद ईं सुवाते उषसा विरूपे शवेतो वाजी जायते अग्रे अह्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnim achā devayatām manāṃsi cakṣūṃṣīva sūrye saṃ caranti yad īṃ suvāte uṣasā virūpe śveto vājī jāyate aghre ahnām

translations.griffith: The spirits of the pious turn together to Agni, as the eyes of all to Sūrya.  He, when both Dawns of different hues have borne him, springs up at daybreak as a strong white charger.

verses.sanskrit: जनिष्ट हि जेन्यो अग्रे अह्नां हितो हितेष्व अरुषो वनेषु दमे-दमे सप्त रत्ना दधानो ऽगनिर होता नि षसादा यजीयान |||
verses.transliteration: janiṣṭa hi jenyo aghre ahnāṃ hito hiteṣv aruṣo vaneṣu dame-dame sapta ratnā dadhāno 'ghnir hotā ni ṣasādā yajīyān

translations.griffith: The noble One was born at days' beginning, laid red in colour mid the well-laid fuel.  Yielding in every house his seven rich treasures, Agni is seated, Priest most skilled in worship.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर होता नय असीदद यजीयान उपस्थे मातुः सुरभा उलोके युवा कविः पुरुनिष्ठ रतावा धर्ता कर्ष्टीनाम उत मध्य इद्धः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir hotā ny asīdad yajīyān upasthe mātuḥ surabhā uloke yuvā kaviḥ puruniṣṭha ṛtāvā dhartā kṛṣṭīnām uta madhya iddhaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni hath sat him down, a Priest most skilful, on a sweet-smelling place, his Mother's bosom.  Young, faithful, sage, preeminent o’er many, kindled among the folk whom he sustaineth.

verses.sanskrit: पर णु तयं विप्रम अध्वरेषु साधुम अग्निं होतारम ईळते नमोभिः आ यस ततान रोदसी रतेन नित्यम मर्जन्ति वाजिनं घर्तेन |||
verses.transliteration: pra ṇu tyaṃ vipram adhvareṣu sādhum aghniṃ hotāram īḷate namobhiḥ ā yas tatāna rodasī ṛtena nityam mṛjanti vājinaṃ ghṛtena

translations.griffith: This Singer excellent at sacrifices, Agni the Priest, they glorify with homage.  Him who spread out both worlds by Law Eternal they balm with oil, strong Steed who never faileth.

verses.sanskrit: मार्जाल्यो मर्ज्यते सवे दमूनाः कविप्रशस्तो अतिथिः शिवो नः सहस्रश्र्ङगो वर्षभस तदोजा विश्वां अग्ने सहसा परास्य अन्यान |||
verses.transliteration: mārjālyo mṛjyate sve damūnāḥ kavipraśasto atithiḥ śivo naḥ sahasraśṛṅgho vṛṣabhas tadojā viśvāṃ aghne sahasā prāsy anyān

translations.griffith: He, worshipful House-Friend, in his home is worshipped, our own auspicious guest, lauded by sages.  That strength the Bull with thousand horns possesses. In might, O Agni, thou excellest others.

verses.sanskrit: पर सद्यो अग्ने अत्य एष्य अन्यान आविर यस्मै चारुतमो बभूथ ईळेन्यो वपुष्यो विभावा परियो विशाम अतिथिर मानुषीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra sadyo aghne aty eṣy anyān āvir yasmai cārutamo babhūtha īḷenyo vapuṣyo vibhāvā priyo viśām atithir mānuṣīṇām

translations.griffith: Thou quickly passest by all others, Agni, for him to whom thou hast appeared most lovely,  Wondrously fair, adorable, effulgent, the guest of men, the darling of the people.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्यम भरन्ति कषितयो यविष्ठ बलिम अग्ने अन्तित ओत दूरात आ भन्दिष्ठस्य सुमतिं चिकिद्धि बर्हत ते अग्ने महि शर्म भद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyam bharanti kṣitayo yaviṣṭha balim aghne antita ota dūrāt ā bhandiṣṭhasya sumatiṃ cikiddhi bṛhat te aghne mahi śarma bhadram

translations.griffith: To thee, Most Youthful God! to thee, O Agni from near and far the people bring their tribute.  Mark well the prayer of him who best extols thee. Great, high, auspicious, Agni, is thy shelter.

verses.sanskrit: आद्य रथम भानुमो भानुमन्तम अग्ने तिष्ठ यजतेभिः समन्तम विद्वान पथीनाम उर्व अन्तरिक्षम एह देवान हविरद्याय वक्षि |||
verses.transliteration: ādya ratham bhānumo bhānumantam aghne tiṣṭha yajatebhiḥ samantam vidvān pathīnām urv antarikṣam eha devān haviradyāya vakṣi

translations.griffith: Ascend to-day thy splendid car, O Agni, in splendour, with the Holy Ones around it.  Knowing the paths by mid-air's spacious region bring hither Gods to feast on our oblation.

verses.sanskrit: अवोचाम कवये मेध्याय वचो वन्दारु वर्षभाय वर्ष्णे गविष्ठिरो नमसा सतोमम अग्नौ दिव्ञ्व रुक्मम उरुव्यञ्चम अश्रेत |||
verses.transliteration: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vaco vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe ghaviṣṭhiro namasā stomam aghnau divñva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret

translations.griffith: To him adorable, sage, strong and mighty we have sung forth our song of praise and homage.  Gavisthira hath raised with prayer to Agni this laud far-reaching, like gold light to heaven.

verses.sanskrit: कुमारम माता युवतिः समुब्धं गुहा बिभर्ति न ददाति पित्रे अनीकम अस्य न मिनज जनासः पुरः पश्यन्ति निहितम अरतौ |||
verses.transliteration: kumāram mātā yuvatiḥ samubdhaṃ ghuhā bibharti na dadāti pitre anīkam asya na minaj janāsaḥ puraḥ paśyanti nihitam aratau

translations.griffith: THE youthful Mother keeps the Boy in secret pressed to her close, nor yields him to the Father.  But, when he lies upon the arm, the people see his unfading countenance before them.

verses.sanskrit: कम एतं तवं युवते कुमारम पेषी बिभर्षि महिषी जजान पूर्वीर हि गर्भः शरदो ववर्धापश्यं जातं यद असूत माता |||
verses.transliteration: kam etaṃ tvaṃ yuvate kumāram peṣī bibharṣi mahiṣī jajāna pūrvīr hi gharbhaḥ śarado vavardhāpaśyaṃ jātaṃ yad asūta mātā

translations.griffith: What child is this thou carriest as handmaid, O Youthful One? The Consort-Queen hath borne him.  The Babe unborn increased through many autumns. I saw him born what time his Mother bare him.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यदन्तं शुचिवर्णम आरात कषेत्राद अपश्यम आयुधा मिमानम ददानो अस्मा अम्र्तं विप्र्क्वत किम माम अनिन्द्राः कर्णवन्न अनुक्थाः |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyadantaṃ śucivarṇam ārāt kṣetrād apaśyam āyudhā mimānam dadāno asmā amṛtaṃ vipṛkvat kim mām anindrāḥ kṛṇavann anukthāḥ

translations.griffith: I saw him from afar gold-toothed, bright-coloured, hurling his weapons from his habitation,  What time I gave him Amṛta free from mixture. How can the Indraless, the hymnless harm me?

verses.sanskrit: कषेत्राद अपश्यं सनुतश चरन्तं सुमद यूथं न पुरु शोभमानम न ता अग्र्भ्रन्न अजनिष्ट हि षः पलिक्नीर इद युवतयो भवन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: kṣetrād apaśyaṃ sanutaś carantaṃ sumad yūthaṃ na puru śobhamānam na tā aghṛbhrann ajaniṣṭa hi ṣaḥ paliknīr id yuvatayo bhavanti

translations.griffith: I saw him moving from the place he dwells in, even as with a herd, brilliantly shining.  These seized him not: he had been born already. They who were grey with age again grow youthful.

verses.sanskrit: के मे मर्यकं वि यवन्त गोभिर न येषां गोपा अरणश चिद आस य ईं जग्र्भुर अव ते सर्जन्त्व आजाति पश्व उप नश चिकित्वान |||
verses.transliteration: ke me maryakaṃ vi yavanta ghobhir na yeṣāṃ ghopā araṇaś cid āsa ya īṃ jaghṛbhur ava te sṛjantv ājāti paśva upa naś cikitvān

translations.griffith: Who separate my young bull from the cattle, they whose protector was in truth no stranger?  Let those whose hands have seized upon them free them. May he, observant, drive the herd to us-ward.

verses.sanskrit: वसां राजानं वसतिं जनानाम अरातयो नि दधुर मर्त्येषु बरह्माण्य अत्रेर अव तं सर्जन्तु निन्दितारो निन्द्यासो भवन्तु |||
verses.transliteration: vasāṃ rājānaṃ vasatiṃ janānām arātayo ni dadhur martyeṣu brahmāṇy atrer ava taṃ sṛjantu ninditāro nindyāso bhavantu

translations.griffith: Mid mortal men godless have secreted the King of all who live, home of the people.  So may the prayers of Atri give him freedom. Reproached in turn be those who now reproach him.

verses.sanskrit: शुनश चिच छेपं निदितं सहस्राद यूपाद अमुञ्चो अशमिष्ट हि षः एवास्मद अग्ने वि मुमुग्धि पाशान होतश चिकित्व इह तू निषद्य |||
verses.transliteration: śunaś cic chepaṃ niditaṃ sahasrād yūpād amuñco aśamiṣṭa hi ṣaḥ evāsmad aghne vi mumughdhi pāśān hotaś cikitva iha tū niṣadya

translations.griffith: Thou from the stake didst loose e’en Śunaḥśepa bound for a thousand; for he prayed with fervour.  So, Agni, loose from us the bonds that bind us, when thou art seated here, O Priest who knowest.

verses.sanskrit: हर्णीयमानो अप हि मद ऐयेः पर मे देवानां वरतपा उवाच इन्द्रो विद्वां अनु हि तवा चचक्ष तेनाहम अग्ने अनुशिष्ट आगाम |||
verses.transliteration: hṛṇīyamāno apa hi mad aiyeḥ pra me devānāṃ vratapā uvāca indro vidvāṃ anu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāham aghne anuśiṣṭa āghām

translations.griffith: Thou hast sped from me, Agni, in thine anger: this the protector of Gods’ Laws hath told me.  Indra who knoweth bent his eye upon thee: by him instructed am I come, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit: वि जयोतिषा बर्हता भात्य अग्निर आविर विश्वानि कर्णुते महित्वा परादेवीर मायाः सहते दुरेवाः शिशीते शर्ङगे रक्षसे विनिक्षे |||
verses.transliteration: vi jyotiṣā bṛhatā bhāty aghnir āvir viśvāni kṛṇute mahitvā prādevīr māyāḥ sahate durevāḥ śiśīte śṛṅghe rakṣase vinikṣe

translations.griffith: Agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour, and by his greatness makes all things apparent.  He conquers godless and malign enchantments, and sharpens both his horns to gore the Rakṣas.

verses.sanskrit: उत सवानासो दिवि षन्त्व अग्नेस तिग्मायुधा रक्षसे हन्तवा उ मदे चिद अस्य पर रुजन्ति भामा न वरन्ते परिबाधो अदेवीः |||
verses.transliteration: uta svānāso divi ṣantv aghnes tighmāyudhā rakṣase hantavā u made cid asya pra rujanti bhāmā na varante paribādho adevīḥ

translations.griffith: Loud in the heaven above be Agni's roarings with keen-edged weapons to destroy the demons.  Forth burst his splendours in the Soma's rapture. The godless bands press round but cannot stay him.

verses.sanskrit: एतं ते सतोमं तुविजात विप्रो रथं न धीरः सवपा अतक्षम यदीद अग्ने परति तवं देव हर्याः सवर्वतीर अप एना जयेम |||
verses.transliteration: etaṃ te stomaṃ tuvijāta vipro rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam yadīd aghne prati tvaṃ deva haryāḥ svarvatīr apa enā jayema

translations.griffith: As a skilled craftsman makes a car, a singer I, Mighty One! this hymn for thee have fashioned.  If thou, O Agni, God, accept it gladly, may we obtain thereby the heavenly Waters.

verses.sanskrit: तुविग्रीवो वर्षभो वाव्र्धानो ऽशत्र्व अर्यः सम अजाति वेदः इतीमम अग्निम अम्र्ता अवोचन बर्हिष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसद धविष्मते मनवे शर्म यंसत |||
verses.transliteration: tuvighrīvo vṛṣabho vāvṛdhāno 'śatrv aryaḥ sam ajāti vedaḥ itīmam aghnim amṛtā avocan barhiṣmate manave śarma yaṃsad dhaviṣmate manave śarma yaṃsat

translations.griffith: May he, the strong-necked Steer, waxing in vigour, gather the foeman's wealth with none to check him.  Thus to this Agni have the Immortals spoken. To man who spreads the grass may he grant shelter, grant shelter to the man who brings oblation.

verses.sanskrit: तवम अग्ने वरुणो जायसे यत तवम मित्रो भवसि यत समिद्धः तवे विश्वे सहसस पुत्र देवास तवम इन्द्रो दाशुषे मर्त्याय |||
verses.transliteration: tvam aghne varuṇo jāyase yat tvam mitro bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ tve viśve sahasas putra devās tvam indro dāśuṣe martyāya

translations.griffith: THOU at thy birth art Varuṇa, O Agni; when thou art kindled thou becomest Mitra.  In thee, O Son of Strength, all Gods are centred. Indra art thou to man who brings oblation.

verses.sanskrit: तवम अर्यमा भवसि यत कनीनां नाम सवधावन गुह्यम बिभर्षि अञ्जन्ति मित्रं सुधितं न गोभिर यद दम्पती समनसा कर्णोषि |||
verses.transliteration: tvam aryamā bhavasi yat kanīnāṃ nāma svadhāvan ghuhyam bibharṣi añjanti mitraṃ sudhitaṃ na ghobhir yad dampatī samanasā kṛṇoṣi

translations.griffith: Aryaman art thou as regardeth maidens mysterious, is thy name, O Self-sustainer.  As a kind friend with streams of milk they balm thee what time thou makest wife and lord one-minded.

verses.sanskrit: तव शरिये मरुतो मर्जयन्त रुद्र यत ते जनिम चारु चित्रम पदं यद विष्णोर उपमं निधायि तेन पासि गुह्यं नाम गोनाम |||
verses.transliteration: tava śriye maruto marjayanta rudra yat te janima cāru citram padaṃ yad viṣṇor upamaṃ nidhāyi tena pāsi ghuhyaṃ nāma ghonām

translations.griffith: The Maruts deck their beauty for thy glory, yea, Rudra! for thy birth fair, brightly-coloured.  That which was fixed as Viṣṇu's loftiest station—therewith the secret of the Cows thou guardest.

verses.sanskrit: तव शरिया सुद्र्शो देव देवाः पुरू दधाना अम्र्तं सपन्त होतारम अग्निम मनुषो नि षेदुर दशस्यन्त उशिजः शंसम आयोः |||
verses.transliteration: tava śriyā sudṛśo deva devāḥ purū dadhānā amṛtaṃ sapanta hotāram aghnim manuṣo ni ṣedur daśasyanta uśijaḥ śaṃsam āyoḥ

translations.griffith: Gods through thy glory, God who art so lovely! granting abundant gifts gained life immortal.  As their own Priest have men established Agni; and serve him fain for praise from him who liveth.

verses.sanskrit: न तवद धोता पूर्वो अग्ने यजीयान न काव्यैः परो अस्ति सवधावः विशश च यस्या अतिथिर भवासि स यज्ञेन वनवद देव मर्तान |||
verses.transliteration: na tvad dhotā pūrvo aghne yajīyān na kāvyaiḥ paro asti svadhāvaḥ viśaś ca yasyā atithir bhavāsi sa yajñena vanavad deva martān

translations.griffith: There is no priest more skilled than thou in worship; none Self-sustainer pass thee in wisdom.  The man within whose house as guest thou dwellest, O God, by sacrifice shall conquer mortals.

verses.sanskrit: वयम अग्ने वनुयाम तवोता वसूयवो हविषा बुध्यमानाः वयं समर्ये विदथेष्व अह्नां वयं राया सहसस पुत्र मर्तान |||
verses.transliteration: vayam aghne vanuyāma tvotā vasūyavo haviṣā budhyamānāḥ vayaṃ samarye vidatheṣv ahnāṃ vayaṃ rāyā sahasas putra martān

translations.griffith: Aided by thee, O Agni may we conquer through our oblation, fain for wealth, awakened:  May we in battle, in the days’ assemblies, O Son of Strength, by riches conquer mortals.

verses.sanskrit: यो न आगो अभ्य एनो भरात्य अधीद अघम अघशंसे दधात जही चिकित्वो अभिशस्तिम एताम अग्ने यो नो मर्चयति दवयेन |||
verses.transliteration: yo na āgho abhy eno bharāty adhīd agham aghaśaṃse dadhāta jahī cikitvo abhiśastim etām aghne yo no marcayati dvayena

translations.griffith: He shall bring evil on the evil-plotter whoever turns against us sin and outrage.  Destroy this calumny of him, O Agni, whoever injures us with double-dealing.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अस्या वयुषि देव पूर्वे दूतं कर्ण्वाना अयजन्त हव्यैः संस्थे यद अग्न ईयसे रयीणां देवो मर्तैर वसुभिर इध्यमानः |||
verses.transliteration: tvām asyā vyuṣi deva pūrve dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajanta havyaiḥ saṃsthe yad aghna īyase rayīṇāṃ devo martair vasubhir idhyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: At this dawn's flushing, God! our ancient fathers served thee with offerings, making thee their envoy,  When, Agni, to the store of wealth thou goest, a God enkindled with good things by mortals.

verses.sanskrit: अव सप्र्धि पितरं योधि विद्वान पुत्रो यस ते सहसः सून ऊहे कदा चिकित्वो अभि चक्षसे नो ऽगने कदां रतचिद यातयासे |||
verses.transliteration: ava spṛdhi pitaraṃ yodhi vidvān putro yas te sahasaḥ sūna ūhe kadā cikitvo abhi cakṣase no 'ghne kadāṃ ṛtacid yātayāse

translations.griffith: Save, thou who knowest, draw thy father near thee, who counts as thine own son, O Child of Power.  O sapient Agni, when wilt thou regard us? When, skilled in holy Law, wilt thou direct us?

verses.sanskrit: भूरि नाम वन्दमानो दधाति पिता वसो यदि तज जोषयासे कुविद देवस्य सहसा चकानः सुम्नम अग्निर वनते वाव्र्धानः |||
verses.transliteration: bhūri nāma vandamāno dadhāti pitā vaso yadi taj joṣayāse kuvid devasya sahasā cakānaḥ sumnam aghnir vanate vāvṛdhānaḥ

translations.griffith: Adoring thee he gives thee many a title, when thou, Good Lord! acceptest this as Father.  And doth not Agni, glad in strength of Godhead, gain splendid bliss when he hath waxen mighty?

verses.sanskrit: तवम अङग जरितारं यविष्ठ विश्वान्य अग्ने दुरिताति पर्षि सतेना अद्र्श्रन रिपवो जनासो ऽजञातकेता वर्जिना अभूवन |||
verses.transliteration: tvam aṅgha jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭha viśvāny aghne duritāti parṣi stenā adṛśran ripavo janāso 'jñātaketā vṛjinā abhūvan

translations.griffith: Most Youthful Agni, verily thou bearest thy praiser safely over all his troubles.  Thieves have been seen by us and open foemen: unknown have been the plottings of the wicked.

verses.sanskrit: इमे यामासस तवद्रिग अभूवन वसवे वा तद इद आगो अवाचि नाहायम अग्निर अभिशस्तये नो न रीषते वाव्र्धानः परा दात |||
verses.transliteration: ime yāmāsas tvadrigh abhūvan vasave vā tad id āgho avāci nāhāyam aghnir abhiśastaye no na rīṣate vāvṛdhānaḥ parā dāt

translations.griffith: To thee these eulogies have been directed: or to the Vasu hath this sin been spoken.  But this our Agni, flaming high, shall never yield us to calumny, to him who wrongs us.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने वसुपतिं वसूनाम अभि पर मन्दे अध्वरेषु राजन तवया वाजं वाजयन्तो जयेमाभि षयाम पर्त्सुतीर मर्त्यानाम |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne vasupatiṃ vasūnām abhi pra mande adhvareṣu rājan tvayā vājaṃ vājayanto jayemābhi ṣyāma pṛtsutīr martyānām

translations.griffith: O AGNI, King and Lord of wealth and treasures, in thee is my delight at sacrifices.  Through thee may we obtain the strength we long for, and overcome the fierce attacks of mortals.

verses.sanskrit: हव्यवाळ अग्निर अजरः पिता नो विभुर विभावा सुद्र्शीको अस्मे सुगार्हपत्याः सम इषो दिदीह्य अस्मद्र्यक सम मिमीहि शरवांसि |||
verses.transliteration: havyavāḷ aghnir ajaraḥ pitā no vibhur vibhāvā sudṛśīko asme sughārhapatyāḥ sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi

translations.griffith: Agni, Eternal Father, offering-bearer, fair to behold, far-reaching, far-refulgent,  From well-kept household fire beam food to feed us, and measure out to us abundant glory.

verses.sanskrit: विशां कविं विश्पतिम मानुषीणां शुचिम पावकं घर्तप्र्ष्ठम अग्निम नि होतारं विश्वविदं दधिध्वे स देवेषु वनते वार्याणि |||
verses.transliteration: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatim mānuṣīṇāṃ śucim pāvakaṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭham aghnim ni hotāraṃ viśvavidaṃ dadhidhve sa deveṣu vanate vāryāṇi

translations.griffith: The Sage of men, the Lord of human races, pure, purifying Agni, balmed with butter,  Him the Omniscient as your Priest ye stablish: he wins among the Gods things worth the choosing.

verses.sanskrit: जुषस्वाग्न इळया सजोषा यतमानो रश्मिभिः सूर्यस्य जुषस्व नः समिधं जातवेद आ च देवान हविरद्याय वक्षि |||
verses.transliteration: juṣasvāghna iḷayā sajoṣā yatamāno raśmibhiḥ sūryasya juṣasva naḥ samidhaṃ jātaveda ā ca devān haviradyāya vakṣi

translations.griffith: Agni, enjoy, of one accord with Iḷā, striving in rivalry with beams of Sūrya,  Enjoy, O Jātavedas, this our fuel, and bring the Gods to us to taste oblations.

verses.sanskrit: जुष्टो दमूना अतिथिर दुरोण इमं नो यज्ञम उप याहि विद्वान विश्वा अग्ने अभियुजो विहत्या शत्रूयताम आ भरा भोजनानि |||
verses.transliteration: juṣṭo damūnā atithir duroṇa imaṃ no yajñam upa yāhi vidvān viśvā aghne abhiyujo vihatyā śatrūyatām ā bharā bhojanāni

translations.griffith: As dear House-Friend, guest welcome in the dwelling, to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest.  And, Agni, having scattered all assailants, bring to us the possessions of our foemen.

verses.sanskrit: वधेन दस्युम पर हि चातयस्व वयः कर्ण्वानस तन्वे सवायै पिपर्षि यत सहसस पुत्र देवान्त सो अग्ने पाहि नर्तम वाजे अस्मान |||
verses.transliteration: vadhena dasyum pra hi cātayasva vayaḥ kṛṇvānas tanve svāyai piparṣi yat sahasas putra devānt so aghne pāhi nṛtama vāje asmān

translations.griffith: Drive thou away the Dasyu with thy weapon. As, gaining vital power for thine own body,  O Son of Strength, the Gods thou satisfiest, so in fight save us, most heroic Agni.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते अग्न उक्थैर विधेम वयं हव्यैः पावक भद्रशोचे अस्मे रयिं विश्ववारं सम इन्वास्मे विश्वानि दरविणानि धेहि |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te aghna ukthair vidhema vayaṃ havyaiḥ pāvaka bhadraśoce asme rayiṃ viśvavāraṃ sam invāsme viśvāni draviṇāni dhehi

translations.griffith: May we, O Agni, with our lauds adore thee, and with our gifts, fair-beaming Purifier!  Send to us wealth containing all things precious: bestow upon us every sort of riches.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकम अग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व सहसः सूनो तरिषधस्थ हव्यम वयं देवेषु सुक्र्तः सयाम शर्मणा नस तरिवरूथेन पाहि |||
verses.transliteration: asmākam aghne adhvaraṃ juṣasva sahasaḥ sūno triṣadhastha havyam vayaṃ deveṣu sukṛtaḥ syāma śarmaṇā nas trivarūthena pāhi

translations.griffith: Son of Strength, Agni, dweller in three regions, accept our sacrifice and our oblation.  Among the Gods may we be counted pious: protect us with a triply-guarding shelter.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वानि नो दुर्गहा जातवेदः सिन्धुं न नावा दुरिताति पर्षि अग्ने अत्रिवन नमसा गर्णानो ऽसमाकम बोध्य अविता तनूनाम |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāni no durghahā jātavedaḥ sindhuṃ na nāvā duritāti parṣi aghne atrivan namasā ghṛṇāno 'smākam bodhy avitā tanūnām

translations.griffith: Over all woes and dangers, Jātavedas, bear us as in a boat across a river.  Praised with our homage even as Atri praised thee, O Agni, be the guardian of our bodies.

verses.sanskrit: यस तवा हर्दा कीरिणा मन्यमानो ऽमर्त्यम मर्त्यो जोहवीमि जातवेदो यशो अस्मासु धेहि परजाभिर अग्ने अम्र्तत्वम अश्याम |||
verses.transliteration: yas tvā hṛdā kīriṇā manyamāno 'martyam martyo johavīmi jātavedo yaśo asmāsu dhehi prajābhir aghne amṛtatvam aśyām

translations.griffith: As I, remembering thee with grateful spirit, a mortal, call with might on thee Immortal,  Vouchsafe us high renown, O Jātavedas, and may I be immortal by my children.

verses.sanskrit: यस्मै तवं सुक्र्ते जातवेद उलोकम अग्ने कर्णवः सयोनम अश्विनं स पुत्र्णं वीरवन्तं गोमन्तं रयिं नशते सवस्ति |||
verses.transliteration: yasmai tvaṃ sukṛte jātaveda ulokam aghne kṛṇavaḥ syonam aśvinaṃ sa putṛṇaṃ vīravantaṃ ghomantaṃ rayiṃ naśate svasti

translations.griffith: The pious man, O Jātavedas Agni, to whom thou grantest ample room and pleasure,  Gaineth abundant wealth with sons and horses, with heroes and with kine for his well-being.

verses.sanskrit: सुसमिद्धाय शोचिषे घर्तं तीव्रं जुहोतन अग्नये जातवेदसे |||
verses.transliteration: susamiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtaṃ tīvraṃ juhotana aghnaye jātavedase

translations.griffith: To Agni, Jātavedas, to the flame, the well-enkindled God,  Offer thick sacrificial oil.

verses.sanskrit: नराशंसः सुषूदतीमं यज्ञम अदाभ्यः कविर हि मधुहस्त्यः |||
verses.transliteration: narāśaṃsaḥ suṣūdatīmaṃ yajñam adābhyaḥ kavir hi madhuhastyaḥ

translations.griffith: He, Narāśaṁsa, ne’er beguiled, inspiriteth this sacrifice:  For sage is he, with sweets in hand.

verses.sanskrit: ईळितो अग्न आ वहेन्द्रं चित्रम इह परियम सुखै रथेभिर ऊतये |||
verses.transliteration: īḷito aghna ā vahendraṃ citram iha priyam sukhai rathebhir ūtaye

translations.griffith: Adored, O Agni, hither bring Indra the Wonderful, the Friend,  On lightly-rolling car to aid.

verses.sanskrit: ऊर्णम्रदा वि परथस्वाभ्य अर्का अनूषत भवा नः शुभ्र सातये |||
verses.transliteration: ūrṇamradā vi prathasvābhy arkā anūṣata bhavā naḥ śubhra sātaye

translations.griffith: Spread thyself out, thou soft as wool The holy hymns have sung to thee.  Bring gain to us, O beautiful!

verses.sanskrit: देवीर दवारो वि शरयध्वं सुप्रायणा न ऊतये पर-पर यज्ञम पर्णीतन |||
verses.transliteration: devīr dvāro vi śrayadhvaṃ suprāyaṇā na ūtaye pra-pra yajñam pṛṇītana

translations.griffith: Open yourselves, ye Doors Divine, easy of access for our aid:  Fill, more and more, the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: सुप्रतीके वयोव्र्धा यह्वी रतस्य मातरा दोषाम उषासम ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: supratīke vayovṛdhā yahvī ṛtasya mātarā doṣām uṣāsam īmahe

translations.griffith: Fair strengtheners of vital power, young Mothers of eternal Law,  Morning and Night we supplicate.

verses.sanskrit: वातस्य पत्मन्न ईळिता दैव्या होतारा मनुषः इमं नो यज्ञम आ गतम |||
verses.transliteration: vātasya patmann īḷitā daivyā hotārā manuṣaḥ imaṃ no yajñam ā ghatam

translations.griffith: On the wind's flight come, glorified, ye two celestial Priests of man  Come ye to this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इळा सरस्वती मही तिस्रो देवीर मयोभुवः बर्हिः सीदन्त्व अस्रिधः |||
verses.transliteration: iḷā sarasvatī mahī tisro devīr mayobhuvaḥ barhiḥ sīdantv asridhaḥ

translations.griffith: Iḷā, Sarasvatī, Mahī, three Goddesses who bring us weal,  Be seated harmless on the grass.

verses.sanskrit: शिवस तवष्टर इहा गहि विभुः पोष उत तमना यज्ञे-यज्ञे न उद अव |||
verses.transliteration: śivas tvaṣṭar ihā ghahi vibhuḥ poṣa uta tmanā yajñe-yajñe na ud ava

translations.griffith: Rich in all plenty, Tvaṣṭar, come auspicious of thine own accord  Help us in every sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र वेत्थ वनस्पते देवानां गुह्या नामानि तत्र हव्यानि गामय |||
verses.transliteration: yatra vettha vanaspate devānāṃ ghuhyā nāmāni tatra havyāni ghāmaya

translations.griffith: Vanaspati, wherever thou knowest the Gods’ mysterious names,  Send our oblations thitherward.

verses.sanskrit: सवाहाग्नये वरुणाय सवाहेन्द्राय मरुद्भ्यः सवाहा देवेभ्यो हविः स्वाहा देवेभ्यो हविः |||
verses.transliteration: svāhāghnaye varuṇāya svāhendrāya marudbhyaḥ svāhā devebhyo haviḥ svāhā devebhyo haviḥ

translations.griffith: To Agni and to Varuṇa, Indra, the Maruts, and the Gods,  With Svāhā be oblation brought.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं तम मन्ये यो वसुर अस्तं यं यन्ति धेनवः अस्तम अर्वन्त आशवो ऽसतं नित्यासो वाजिन इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ tam manye yo vasur astaṃ yaṃ yanti dhenavaḥ astam arvanta āśavo 'staṃ nityāso vājina iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: I VALUE Agni that good Lord, the home to which the kine return:  Whom fleet-foot coursers seek as home, and strong enduring steeds as home. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: सो अग्निर यो वसुर गर्णे सं यम आयन्ति धेनवः सम अर्वन्तो रघुद्रुवः सं सुजातासः सूरय इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: so aghnir yo vasur ghṛṇe saṃ yam āyanti dhenavaḥ sam arvanto raghudruvaḥ saṃ sujātāsaḥ sūraya iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: ’Tis Agni whom we laud as good, to whom the milch-kine come in herds,  To whom the chargers swift of foot, to whom our well-born princes come. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर हि वाजिनं विशे ददाति विश्वचर्षणिः अग्नी राये सवाभुवं स परीतो याति वार्यम इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir hi vājinaṃ viśe dadāti viśvacarṣaṇiḥ aghnī rāye svābhuvaṃ sa prīto yāti vāryam iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: Agni the God of all mankind, gives, verily, a steed to man.  Agni gives precious gear for wealth, treasure he gives when he is pleased. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते अग्न इधीमहि दयुमन्तं देवाजरम यद ध सया ते पनीयसी समिद दीदयति दयवीषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: ā te aghna idhīmahi dyumantaṃ devājaram yad dha syā te panīyasī samid dīdayati dyavīṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: God, Agni, we will kindle thee, rich in thy splendour, fading not,  So that this glorious fuel may send forth by day its light for thee. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते अग्न रचा हविः शुक्रस्य शोचिषस पते सुश्चन्द्र दस्म विश्पते हव्यवाट तुभ्यं हूयत इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: ā te aghna ṛcā haviḥ śukrasya śociṣas pate suścandra dasma viśpate havyavāṭ tubhyaṃ hūyata iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: To thee the splendid, Lord of flame, bright, wondrous, Prince of men, is brought.  Oblation with the holy verse, O Agni, bearer of our gifts.  Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: परो तये अग्नयो ऽगनिषु विश्वम पुष्यन्ति वार्यम ते हिन्विरे त इन्विरे त इषण्यन्त्य आनुषग इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: pro tye aghnayo 'ghniṣu viśvam puṣyanti vāryam te hinvire ta invire ta iṣaṇyanty ānuṣagh iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: These Agnis in the seats of the fire nourish each thing most excellent.  They give delight, they spread abroad, they move themselves continually. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: तव तये अग्ने अर्चयो महि वराधन्त वाजिनः ये पत्वभिः शफानां वरजा भुरन्त गोनाम इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: tava tye aghne arcayo mahi vrādhanta vājinaḥ ye patvabhiḥ śaphānāṃ vrajā bhuranta ghonām iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: Agni, these brilliant flames of thine wax like strong chargers mightily,  Who with the treadings of their hoofs go swiftly to the stalls of kine. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: नवा नो अग्न आ भर सतोत्र्भ्यः सुक्षितीर इषः ते सयाम य आन्र्चुस तवादूतासो दमे-दम इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: navā no aghna ā bhara stotṛbhyaḥ sukṣitīr iṣaḥ te syāma ya ānṛcus tvādūtāso dame-dama iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: To us who laud thee, Agni, bring fresh food and safe and happy homes.  May we who have sung hymns to thee have thee for envoy in each house. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: उभे सुश्चन्द्र सर्पिषो दर्वी शरीणीष आसनि उतो न उत पुपूर्या उक्थेषु शवसस पत इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: ubhe suścandra sarpiṣo darvī śrīṇīṣa āsani uto na ut pupūryā uktheṣu śavasas pata iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: Thou, brilliant God, within thy mouth warmest both ladles of the oil.  So fill us also, in our hymns, abundantly, O Lord of Strength. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: एवां अग्निम अजुर्यमुर गीर्भिर यज्ञेभिर आनुषक दधद अस्मे सुवीर्यम उत तयद आश्वश्व्यम इषं सतोत्र्भ्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: evāṃ aghnim ajuryamur ghīrbhir yajñebhir ānuṣak dadhad asme suvīryam uta tyad āśvaśvyam iṣaṃ stotṛbhya ā bhara

translations.griffith: Thus Agni have we duly served with sacrifices and with hymns.  So may he give us what we crave, store of brave sons and fleet-foot steeds. Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit: सखायः सं वः सम्यञ्चम इषं सतोमं चाग्नये वर्षिष्ठाय कषितीनाम ऊर्जो नप्त्रे सहस्वते |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāyaḥ saṃ vaḥ samyañcam iṣaṃ stomaṃ cāghnaye varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjo naptre sahasvate

translations.griffith: OFFER to Agni, O my friends, your seemly food, your seemly praise;  To him supremest o’er the folk, the Son of Strength, the mighty Lord:

verses.sanskrit: कुत्रा चिद यस्य सम्र्तौ रण्वा नरो नर्षदने अर्हन्तश चिद यम इन्धते संजनयन्ति जन्तवः |||
verses.transliteration: kutrā cid yasya samṛtau raṇvā naro nṛṣadane arhantaś cid yam indhate saṃjanayanti jantavaḥ

translations.griffith: Him in whose presence, when they meet in full assembly, men rejoice;  Even him whom worthy ones inflame, and living creatures bring to life.

verses.sanskrit: सं यद इषो वनामहे सं हव्या मानुषाणाम उत दयुम्नस्य शवस रतस्य रश्मिम आ ददे |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yad iṣo vanāmahe saṃ havyā mānuṣāṇām uta dyumnasya śavasa ṛtasya raśmim ā dade

translations.griffith: When we present to him the food and sacrificial gifts of men,  He by the might of splendour grasps the holy Ordinance's rein.

verses.sanskrit: स समा कर्णोति केतुम आ नक्तं चिद दूर आ सते पावको यद वनस्पतीन पर समा मिनात्य अजरः |||
verses.transliteration: sa smā kṛṇoti ketum ā naktaṃ cid dūra ā sate pāvako yad vanaspatīn pra smā mināty ajaraḥ

translations.griffith: He gives a signal in the night even to him who is afar,  When he, the Bright, unchanged by eld, consumes the sovrans of the wood.

verses.sanskrit: अव सम यस्य वेषणे सवेदम पथिषु जुह्वति अभीम अह सवजेन्यम भूमा पर्ष्ठेव रुरुहुः |||
verses.transliteration: ava sma yasya veṣaṇe svedam pathiṣu juhvati abhīm aha svajenyam bhūmā pṛṣṭheva ruruhuḥ

translations.griffith: He in whose service on the ways they offer up their drops of sweat,  On him is their high kin have they mounted, as ridges on the earth.

verses.sanskrit: यम मर्त्यः पुरुस्प्र्हं विदद विश्वस्य धायसे पर सवादनम पितूनाम अस्ततातिं चिद आयवे |||
verses.transliteration: yam martyaḥ puruspṛhaṃ vidad viśvasya dhāyase pra svādanam pitūnām astatātiṃ cid āyave

translations.griffith: Whom, sought of many, mortal man hath found to be the Stay of all;  He who gives flavour to our food, the home of every man that lives.

verses.sanskrit: स हि षमा धन्वाक्षितं दाता न दात्य आ पशुः हिरिश्मश्रुः शुचिदन्न रभुर अनिभ्र्ष्टतविषिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi ṣmā dhanvākṣitaṃ dātā na dāty ā paśuḥ hiriśmaśruḥ śucidann ṛbhur anibhṛṣṭataviṣiḥ

translations.griffith: Even as a herd that crops the grass he shears the field and wilderness,  With flashing teeth and beard of gold, deft with his unabated might.

verses.sanskrit: शुचिः षमा यस्मा अत्रिवत पर सवधितीव रीयते सुषूर असूत माता कराणा यद आनशे भगम |||
verses.transliteration: śuciḥ ṣmā yasmā atrivat pra svadhitīva rīyate suṣūr asūta mātā krāṇā yad ānaśe bhagham

translations.griffith: For him, to whom, bright as an axe he, as to Atri, hath flashed forth,  Hath the well-bearing Mother borne, producing when her time is come.

verses.sanskrit: आ यस ते सर्पिरासुते ऽगने शम अस्ति धायसे ऐषु दयुम्नम उत शरव आ चित्तम मर्त्येषु धाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yas te sarpirāsute 'ghne śam asti dhāyase aiṣu dyumnam uta śrava ā cittam martyeṣu dhāḥ

translations.griffith: Agni to whom the oil is shed by him thou lovest to support,  Bestow upon these mortals fame and splendour and intelligence.

verses.sanskrit: इति चिन मन्युम अध्रिजस तवादातम आ पशुं ददे आद अग्ने अप्र्णतो ऽतरिः सासह्याद दस्यून इषः सासह्यान नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: iti cin manyum adhrijas tvādātam ā paśuṃ dade ād aghne apṛṇato 'triḥ sāsahyād dasyūn iṣaḥ sāsahyān nṝn

translations.griffith: Such zeal hath he, resistless one: he gained the cattle given by thee.  Agni, may Atri overcome the Dasyus who bestow no gifts, subdue the men who give no food.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्न रतायवः सम ईधिरे परत्नम परत्नास ऊतये सहस्क्र्त पुरुश्चन्द्रं यजतं विश्वधायसं दमूनसं गर्हपतिं वरेण्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghna ṛtāyavaḥ sam īdhire pratnam pratnāsa ūtaye sahaskṛta puruścandraṃ yajataṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ damūnasaṃ ghṛhapatiṃ vareṇyam

translations.griffith: O AGNI urged to strength, the men of old who loved the Law enkindled thee,  the Ancient, for their aid,  Thee very bright, and holy, nourisher of all, most excellent, the Friend and Master of the home.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने अतिथिम पूर्व्यं विशः शोचिष्केशं गर्हपतिं नि षेदिरे बर्हत्केतुम पुरुरूपं धनस्प्र्तं सुशर्माणं सववसं जरद्विषम |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne atithim pūrvyaṃ viśaḥ śociṣkeśaṃ ghṛhapatiṃ ni ṣedire bṛhatketum pururūpaṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ suśarmāṇaṃ svavasaṃ jaradviṣam

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, men have stablished as their guest of old, as Master of the household, thee, with hair of flame;  High-bannered, multiform, distributor of wealth, kind helper, good protector, drier of the floods.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने मानुषीर ईळते विशो होत्राविदं विविचिं रत्नधातमम गुहा सन्तं सुभग विश्वदर्शतं तुविष्वणसं सुयजं घर्तश्रियम |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne mānuṣīr īḷate viśo hotrāvidaṃ viviciṃ ratnadhātamam ghuhā santaṃ subhagha viśvadarśataṃ tuviṣvaṇasaṃ suyajaṃ ghṛtaśriyam

translations.griffith: The tribes of men praise thee, Agni, who knowest well burnt offerings, the Discerner, lavishest of wealth,  Dwelling in secret, Blest One! visible to all, loud-roaring, skilled in worship, glorified with oil.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने धर्णसिं विश्वधा वयं गीर्भिर गर्णन्तो नमसोप सेदिम स नो जुषस्व समिधानो अङगिरो देवो मर्तस्य यशसा सुदीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne dharṇasiṃ viśvadhā vayaṃ ghīrbhir ghṛṇanto namasopa sedima sa no juṣasva samidhāno aṅghiro devo martasya yaśasā sudītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Ever to thee, O Agni, as exceeding strong have we drawn nigh with songs and reverence singing hymns.  So be thou pleased with us, Aṅgiras! as a God enkindled by the noble with man's goodly light.

verses.sanskrit: तवम अग्ने पुरुरूपो विशे-विशे वयो दधासि परत्नथा पुरुष्टुत पुरूण्य अन्ना सहसा वि राजसि तविषिः सा ते तित्विषाणस्य नाध्र्षे |||
verses.transliteration: tvam aghne pururūpo viśe-viśe vayo dadhāsi pratnathā puruṣṭuta purūṇy annā sahasā vi rājasi tviṣiḥ sā te titviṣāṇasya nādhṛṣe

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni! multiform, God who art lauded much! givest in every house subsistence as of old.  Thou rulest by thy might o’er food of many a sort: that light of thine when blazing may not be opposed.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने समिधानं यविष्ठ्य देवा दूतं चक्रिरे हव्यवाहनम उरुज्रयसं घर्तयोनिम आहुतं तवेषं चक्षुर दधिरे चोदयन्मति |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne samidhānaṃ yaviṣṭhya devā dūtaṃ cakrire havyavāhanam urujrayasaṃ ghṛtayonim āhutaṃ tveṣaṃ cakṣur dadhire codayanmati

translations.griffith: The Gods, Most Youthful Agni, have made thee, inflamed, the bearer of oblations and the messenger.  Thee, widely-reaching, homed in sacred oil, invoked, effulgent, have they made the Eye that stirs the thought.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने परदिव आहुतं घर्तैः सुम्नायवः सुषमिधा सम ईधिरे स वाव्र्धान ओषधीभिर उक्षितो ऽभि जरयांसि पार्थिवा वि तिष्ठसे |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne pradiva āhutaṃ ghṛtaiḥ sumnāyavaḥ suṣamidhā sam īdhire sa vāvṛdhāna oṣadhībhir ukṣito 'bhi jrayāṃsi pārthivā vi tiṣṭhase

translations.griffith: Men seeking joy have lit thee worshipped from of old, O Agni, with good fuel and with sacred oil.  So thou, bedewed and waxing mighty by the plants, spreadest thyself abroad over the realms of earth.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने हविष्मन्तो देवम मर्तास ईळते मन्ये तवा जातवेदसं स हव्या वक्ष्य आनुषक |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne haviṣmanto devam martāsa īḷate manye tvā jātavedasaṃ sa havyā vakṣy ānuṣak

translations.griffith: BEARING; oblations mortal men, O Agni, worship thee the God.  I deem thee Jātavedas: bear our offerings, thou, unceasingly.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर होता दास्वतः कषयस्य वर्क्तबर्हिषः सं यज्ञासश चरन्ति यं सं वाजासः शरवस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir hotā dāsvataḥ kṣayasya vṛktabarhiṣaḥ saṃ yajñāsaś caranti yaṃ saṃ vājāsaḥ śravasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: In the man's home who offers gifts, where grass is trimmed, Agni is Priest,  To whom all sacrifices come and strengthenings that win renown.

verses.sanskrit: उत सम यं शिशुं यथा नवं जनिष्टारणी धर्तारम मानुषीणां विशाम अग्निं सवध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: uta sma yaṃ śiśuṃ yathā navaṃ janiṣṭāraṇī dhartāram mānuṣīṇāṃ viśām aghniṃ svadhvaram

translations.griffith: Whom, as an infant newly-born, the kindling-sticks have brought to life,  Sustainer of the tribes of men, skilled in well-ordered sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: उत सम दुर्ग्र्भीयसे पुत्रो न हवार्याणाम पुरू यो दग्धासि वनाग्ने पशुर न यवसे |||
verses.transliteration: uta sma durghṛbhīyase putro na hvāryāṇām purū yo daghdhāsi vanāghne paśur na yavase

translations.griffith: Yea, very hard art thou to grasp, like offspring of the wriggling snakes,  When thou consumest many woods like an ox, Agni, in the mead.

verses.sanskrit: अध सम यस्यार्चयः सम्यक संयन्ति धूमिनः यद ईम अह तरितो दिव्य उप धमातेव धमति शिशीते धमातरी यथा |||
verses.transliteration: adha sma yasyārcayaḥ samyak saṃyanti dhūminaḥ yad īm aha trito divy upa dhmāteva dhamati śiśīte dhmātarī yathā

translations.griffith: Whose flames, when thou art sending forth the smoke, completely reach the mark,  When Tṛta in the height of heaven, like as a smelter fanneth thee, e’en as a smelter sharpeneth thee.

verses.sanskrit: तवाहम अग्न ऊतिभिर मित्रस्य च परशस्तिभिः दवेषोयुतो न दुरिता तुर्याम मर्त्यानाम |||
verses.transliteration: tavāham aghna ūtibhir mitrasya ca praśastibhiḥ dveṣoyuto na duritā turyāma martyānām

translations.griffith: O Agni, by thy succour and by Mitra's friendly furtherance,  May we, averting hate,  subdue  the wickedness of mortal men.

verses.sanskrit: तं नो अग्ने अभी नरो रयिं सहस्व आ भर स कषेपयत स पोषयद भुवद वाजस्य सातय उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ no aghne abhī naro rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara sa kṣepayat sa poṣayad bhuvad vājasya sātaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe

translations.griffith: O Agni, to our heroes bring such riches, thou victorious God.  May he protect and nourish us, and help in gaining strength: be thou near us in fight for our success.

verses.sanskrit: अग्न ओजिष्ठम आ भर दयुम्नम अस्मभ्यम अध्रिगो पर नो राया परीणसा रत्सि वाजाय पन्थाम |||
verses.transliteration: aghna ojiṣṭham ā bhara dyumnam asmabhyam adhrigho pra no rāyā parīṇasā ratsi vājāya panthām

translations.griffith: BRING us most mighty splendour thou, Agni, resistless on thy way.  With overflowing store of wealth mark out for us a path to strength.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने अद्भुत करत्वा दक्षस्य मंहना तवे असुर्यम आरुहत कराणा मित्रो न यज्ञियः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne adbhuta kratvā dakṣasya maṃhanā tve asuryam āruhat krāṇā mitro na yajñiyaḥ

translations.griffith: Ours art thou, wondrous Agni, by wisdom and bounteousness of power.  The might of Asuras rests on thee, like Mitra worshipful in act.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्न एषां गयम पुष्टिं च वर्धय ये सतोमेभिः पर सूरयो नरो मघान्य आनशुः |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghna eṣāṃ ghayam puṣṭiṃ ca vardhaya ye stomebhiḥ pra sūrayo naro maghāny ānaśuḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, increase our means of life, increase the house and home of these,  The men, the princes who have won great riches through our hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit: ये अग्ने चन्द्र ते गिरः शुम्भन्त्य अश्वराधसः शुष्मेभिः शुष्मिणो नरो दिवश चिद येषाम बर्हत सुकीर्तिर बोधति तमना |||
verses.transliteration: ye aghne candra te ghiraḥ śumbhanty aśvarādhasaḥ śuṣmebhiḥ śuṣmiṇo naro divaś cid yeṣām bṛhat sukīrtir bodhati tmanā

translations.griffith: Bright Agni, they who deck their songs for thee have horses as their meed.  The men are mighty in their might, they whose high laud, as that of heaven, awakes thee of its own accord.

verses.sanskrit: तव तये अग्ने अर्चयो भराजन्तो यन्ति धर्ष्णुया परिज्मानो न विद्युतः सवानो रथो न वाजयुः |||
verses.transliteration: tava tye aghne arcayo bhrājanto yanti dhṛṣṇuyā parijmāno na vidyutaḥ svāno ratho na vājayuḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, those resplendent flames of thine go valorously forth,  Like lightnings flashing round us, like a rattling car that seeks the spoil.

verses.sanskrit: नू नो अग्न ऊतये सबाधसश च रातये अस्माकासश च सूरयो विश्वा आशास तरीषणि |||
verses.transliteration: nū no aghna ūtaye sabādhasaś ca rātaye asmākāsaś ca sūrayo viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi

translations.griffith: Now, Agni, come to succour us; let priests draw nigh to offer gifts;  And let the patrons of our rites subdue all regions of the earth.

verses.sanskrit: तवं नो अग्ने अङगिर सतुत सतवान आ भर होतर विभ्वासहं रयिं सतोत्र्भ्य सतवसे च न उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no aghne aṅghira stuta stavāna ā bhara hotar vibhvāsahaṃ rayiṃ stotṛbhya stavase ca na utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe

translations.griffith: Bring to us, Agni, Aṅgiras, lauded of old and lauded now,  Invoker! wealth to quell the strong, that singers may extol thee. Be near us in fight for our success.

verses.sanskrit: जनस्य गोपा अजनिष्ट जाग्र्विर अग्निः सुदक्षः सुविताय नव्यसे घर्तप्रतीको बर्हता दिविस्प्र्शा दयुमद वि भाति भरतेभ्यः शुचिः |||
verses.transliteration: janasya ghopā ajaniṣṭa jāghṛvir aghniḥ sudakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase ghṛtapratīko bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumad vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ

translations.griffith: THE watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni, the very strong, for fresh prosperity.  With oil upon his face, with high heaven-touching flame, he shineth splendidly, pure, for the Bharatas.

verses.sanskrit: यज्ञस्य केतुम परथमम पुरोहितम अग्निं नरस तरिषधस्थे सम ईधिरे इन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं स बर्हिषि सीदन नि होता यजथाय सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam aghniṃ naras triṣadhasthe sam īdhire indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ sa barhiṣi sīdan ni hotā yajathāya sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Ensign of sacrifice, the earliest Household-Priest, the men have kindled Agni in his threefold seat,  With Indra and the Gods together on the grass let the wise Priest sit to complete the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: असम्म्र्ष्टो जायसे मात्रोः शुचिर मन्द्रः कविर उद अतिष्ठो विवस्वतः घर्तेन तवावर्धयन्न अग्न आहुत धूमस ते केतुर अभवद दिवि शरितः |||
verses.transliteration: asammṛṣṭo jāyase mātroḥ śucir mandraḥ kavir ud atiṣṭho vivasvataḥ ghṛtena tvāvardhayann aghna āhuta dhūmas te ketur abhavad divi śritaḥ

translations.griffith: Pure , unadorned, from thy two Mothers art thou born: thou camest from Vivasvān as a charming Sage.  With oil they strengthened thee, O Agni, worshipped God: thy banner was the smoke that mounted to the sky.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर नो यज्ञम उप वेतु साधुयाग्निं नरो वि भरन्ते गर्हे-गर्हे अग्निर दूतो अभवद धव्यवाहनो ऽगनिं वर्णाना वर्णते कविक्रतुम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir no yajñam upa vetu sādhuyāghniṃ naro vi bharante ghṛhe-ghṛhe aghnir dūto abhavad dhavyavāhano 'ghniṃ vṛṇānā vṛṇate kavikratum

translations.griffith: May Agni graciously come to our sacrifice. The men bear Agni here and there in every house.  He hath become an envoy, bearer of our gifts: electing Agni, men choose one exceeding wise.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्येदम अग्ने मधुमत्तमं वचस तुभ्यम मनीषा इयम अस्तु शं हर्दे तवां गिरः सिन्धुम इवावनीर महीर आ पर्णन्ति शवसा वर्धयन्ति च |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyedam aghne madhumattamaṃ vacas tubhyam manīṣā iyam astu śaṃ hṛde tvāṃ ghiraḥ sindhum ivāvanīr mahīr ā pṛṇanti śavasā vardhayanti ca

translations.griffith: For thee, O Agni, is this sweetest prayer of mine: dear to thy spirit be this product of my thought.  As great streams fill the river so our song of praise fill thee, and make thee yet more mighty in thy strength.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने अङगिरसो गुहा हितम अन्व अविन्दञ छिश्रियाणं वने वने स जायसे मथ्यमानः सहो महत तवाम आहुः सहसस पुत्रम अङगिरः |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne aṅghiraso ghuhā hitam anv avindañ chiśriyāṇaṃ vane vane sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ saho mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasas putram aṅghiraḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, the Aṅgirases discovered thee what time thou layest hidden, fleeing back from wood to wood.  Thou by attrition art produced as conquering might, and men, O Aṅgiras, call thee the Son of Strength.

verses.sanskrit: पराग्नये बर्हते यज्ञियाय रतस्य वर्ष्णे असुराय मन्म घर्तं न यज्ञ आस्य सुपूतं गिरम भरे वर्षभाय परतीचीम |||
verses.transliteration: prāghnaye bṛhate yajñiyāya ṛtasya vṛṣṇe asurāya manma ghṛtaṃ na yajña āsy supūtaṃ ghiram bhare vṛṣabhāya pratīcīm

translations.griffith: To Agni, lofty Asura, meet for worship, Steer of eternal Law, my prayer I offer;  I bring my song directed to the Mighty like pure oil for his mouth at sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: रतं चिकित्व रतम इच चिकिद्ध्य रतस्य धारा अनु तर्न्धि पूर्वीः नाहं यातुं सहसा न दवयेन रतं सपाम्य अरुषस्य वर्ष्णः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtaṃ cikitva ṛtam ic cikiddhy ṛtasya dhārā anu tṛndhi pūrvīḥ nāhaṃ yātuṃ sahasā na dvayena ṛtaṃ sapāmy aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Mark the Law, thou who knowest, yea, observe it: send forth the full streams of eternal Order.  I use no sorcery with might or falsehood the sacred Law of the Red Steer I follow.

verses.sanskrit: कया नो अग्न रतयन्न रतेन भुवो नवेदा उचथस्य नव्यः वेदा मे देव रतुपा रतूनां नाहम पतिं सनितुर अस्य रायः |||
verses.transliteration: kayā no aghna ṛtayann ṛtena bhuvo navedā ucathasya navyaḥ vedā me deva ṛtupā ṛtūnāṃ nāham patiṃ sanitur asya rāyaḥ

translations.griffith: How hast thou, follower of the Law eternal, become the knower of a new song, Agni?  The God, the Guardian of the seasons, knows me: the Lord of him who won this wealth I know not.

verses.sanskrit: के ते अग्ने रिपवे बन्धनासः के पायवः सनिषन्त दयुमन्तः के धासिम अग्ने अन्र्तस्य पान्ति क आसतो वचसः सन्ति गोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: ke te aghne ripave bandhanāsaḥ ke pāyavaḥ saniṣanta dyumantaḥ ke dhāsim aghne anṛtasya pānti ka āsato vacasaḥ santi ghopāḥ

translations.griffith: Who, Agni, in alliance with thy foeman, what splendid helpers won for them their riches?  Agni, who guard the dwelling-place of falsehood? Who are protectors of the speech of liars?

verses.sanskrit: सखायस ते विषुणा अग्न एते शिवासः सन्तो अशिवा अभूवन अधूर्षत सवयम एते वचोभिर रजूयते वर्जिनानि बरुवन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: sakhāyas te viṣuṇā aghna ete śivāsaḥ santo aśivā abhūvan adhūrṣata svayam ete vacobhir ṛjūyate vṛjināni bruvantaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni, those friends of thine have turned them from thee: gracious of old, they have become ungracious.  They have deceived themselves by their own speeches, uttering wicked words against the righteous.

verses.sanskrit: यस ते अग्ने नमसा यज्ञम ईट्ट रतं स पात्य अरुषस्य वर्ष्णः तस्य कषयः पर्थुर आ साधुर एतु परसर्स्राणस्य नहुषस्य शेषः |||
verses.transliteration: yas te aghne namasā yajñam īṭṭa ṛtaṃ sa pāty aruṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ tasya kṣayaḥ pṛthur ā sādhur etu prasarsrāṇasya nahuṣasya śeṣaḥ

translations.griffith: He who pays sacrifice to thee with homage, O Agni, keeps the Red Steer's Law eternal;  Wide is his dwelling. May the noble offspring of Nahuṣa who wandered forth come hither.

verses.sanskrit: अर्चन्तस तवा हवामहे ऽरचन्तः सम इधीमहि अग्ने अर्चन्त ऊतये |||
verses.transliteration: arcantas tvā havāmahe 'rcantaḥ sam idhīmahi aghne arcanta ūtaye

translations.griffith: WITH songs of praise we call on thee, we kindle thee with songs of praise,  Agni, with songs of praise, for help.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने सतोमम मनामहे सिध्रम अद्य दिविस्प्र्शः देवस्य दरविणस्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne stomam manāmahe sidhram adya divispṛśaḥ devasya draviṇasyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Eager for wealth, we meditate Agni's effectual praise to-day,  Praise of the God who touches heaven.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर जुषत नो गिरो होता यो मानुषेष्व आ स यक्षद दैव्यं जनम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir juṣata no ghiro hotā yo mānuṣeṣv ā sa yakṣad daivyaṃ janam

translations.griffith: May Agni, Priest among mankind, take pleasure in our songs of praise,  And worship the Celestial Folk.

verses.sanskrit: तवम अग्ने सप्रथा असि जुष्टो होता वरेण्यः तवया यज्ञं वि तन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: tvam aghne saprathā asi juṣṭo hotā vareṇyaḥ tvayā yajñaṃ vi tanvate

translations.griffith: Thou, Agni, art spread widely forth, Priest dear and excellent; through thee  Men make the sacrifice complete.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम अग्ने वाजसातमं विप्रा वर्धन्ति सुष्टुतम स नो रास्व सुवीर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: tvām aghne vājasātamaṃ viprā vardhanti suṣṭutam sa no rāsva suvīryam

translations.griffith: Singers exalt thee, Agni, well lauded, best giver of our strength:  So grant thou us heroic might.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने नेमिर अरां इव देवांस तवम परिभूर असि आ राधश चित्रम रञ्जसे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne nemir arāṃ iva devāṃs tvam paribhūr asi ā rādhaś citram ṛñjase

translations.griffith: Thou Agni, as the felly rings the spokes, encompassest the Gods.  I yearn for bounty manifold.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं सतोमेन बोधय समिधानो अमर्त्यम हव्या देवेषु नो दधत |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ stomena bodhaya samidhāno amartyam havyā deveṣu no dadhat

translations.griffith: ENKINDLING the Immortal, wake Agni with song of praise: may he bear our oblations to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तम अध्वरेष्व ईळते देवम मर्ता अमर्त्यम यजिष्ठम मानुषे जने |||
verses.transliteration: tam adhvareṣv īḷate devam martā amartyam yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane

translations.griffith: At high solemnities mortal men glorify him the Immortal, best  At sacrifice among mankind.

verses.sanskrit: तं हि शश्वन्त ईळते सरुचा देवं घर्तश्चुता अग्निं हव्याय वोळ्हवे |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ hi śaśvanta īḷate srucā devaṃ ghṛtaścutā aghniṃ havyāya voḷhave

translations.griffith: That he may bear their gifts to heaven, all glorify him Agni, God,  With ladle that distilleth oil.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर जातो अरोचत घनन दस्यूञ जयोतिषा तमः अविन्दद गा अपः सवः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir jāto arocata ghnan dasyūñ jyotiṣā tamaḥ avindad ghā apaḥ svaḥ

translations.griffith: Agni shone bright when born, with light killing the Dasyus and the dark:  He found the Kine, the Floods, the Sun.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निम ईळेन्यं कविं घर्तप्र्ष्ठं सपर्यत वेतु मे शर्णवद धवम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnim īḷenyaṃ kaviṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ saparyata vetu me śṛṇavad dhavam

translations.griffith: Serve Agni, God adorable, the Sage whose back is balmed with oil:  Let him approach, and hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निं घर्तेन वाव्र्धु सतोमेभिर विश्वचर्षणिम सवाधीभिर वचस्युभिः |||
verses.transliteration: aghniṃ ghṛtena vāvṛdhu stomebhir viśvacarṣaṇim svādhībhir vacasyubhiḥ

translations.griffith: They have exalted Agni, God of all mankind, with oil and hymns  Of praise, devout and eloquent.

verses.sanskrit: पर वेधसे कवये वेद्याय गिरम भरे यशसे पूर्व्याय घर्तप्रसत्तो असुरः सुशेवो रायो धर्ता धरुणो वस्वो अग्निः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vedhase kavaye vedyāya ghiram bhare yaśase pūrvyāya ghṛtaprasatto asuraḥ suśevo rāyo dhartā dharuṇo vasvo aghniḥ

translations.griffith: To him, the far-renowned, the wise Ordainer, ancient and glorious, a song I offer.  Enthroned in oil, the Asura, bliss-giver, is Agni, firm support of noble, riches.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन रतं धरुणं धारयन्त यज्ञस्य शाके परमे वयोमन दिवो धर्मन धरुणे सेदुषो नञ्ञ जातैर अजातां अभि ये ननक्षुः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena ṛtaṃ dharuṇaṃ dhārayanta yajñasya śāke parame vyoman divo dharman dharuṇe seduṣo nññ jātair ajātāṃ abhi ye nanakṣuḥ

translations.griffith: By holy Law they kept supporting Order, by help of sacrifice, in loftiest heaven,—  They who attained with born men to the unborn, men seated on that stay, heaven's firm sustainer.

verses.sanskrit: अङहोयुवस तन्वस तन्वते वि वयो महद दुष्टरम पूर्व्याय स संवतो नवजातस तुतुर्यात सिङहं न करुद्धम अभितः परि षठुः |||
verses.transliteration: aṅhoyuvas tanvas tanvate vi vayo mahad duṣṭaram pūrvyāya sa saṃvato navajātas tuturyāt siṅhaṃ na kruddham abhitaḥ pari ṣṭhuḥ

translations.griffith: Averting woe, they labour hard to bring him, the ancient, plenteous food as power resistless.  May he, born newly, conquer his assailants: round him they stand as round an angry lion.

verses.sanskrit: मातेव यद भरसे पप्रथानो जनं-जनं धायसे चक्षसे च वयो-वयो जरसे यद दधानः परि तमना विषुरूपो जिगासि |||
verses.transliteration: māteva yad bharase paprathāno janaṃ-janaṃ dhāyase cakṣase ca vayo-vayo jarase yad dadhānaḥ pari tmanā viṣurūpo jighāsi

translations.griffith: When, like a mother, spreading forth to nourish, to cherish and regard each man that liveth,—  Consuming all the strength that thou hast gotten, thou wanderest round, thyself, in varied fashion.

verses.sanskrit: वाजो नु ते शवसस पात्व अन्तम उरुं दोघं धरुणं देव रायः पदं न तायुर गुहा दधानो महो राये चितयन्न अत्रिम अस्पः |||
verses.transliteration: vājo nu te śavasas pātv antam uruṃ doghaṃ dharuṇaṃ deva rāyaḥ padaṃ na tāyur ghuhā dadhāno maho rāye citayann atrim aspaḥ

translations.griffith: May strength preserve the compass of thy vigour, God! that broad stream of thine that beareth riches.  Thou, like a thief who keeps his refuge secret, hast holpen Atri to great wealth, by teaching.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हद वयो हि भानवे ऽरचा देवायाग्नये यम मित्रं न परशस्तिभिर मर्तासो दधिरे पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhad vayo hi bhānave 'rcā devāyāghnaye yam mitraṃ na praśastibhir martāso dadhire puraḥ

translations.griffith: GREAT power is in the beam of light, sing praise to, Agni, to the God  Whom men have set in foremost place like Mitra with their eulogies.

verses.sanskrit: स हि दयुभिर जनानां होता दक्षस्य बाह्वोः वि हव्यम अग्निर आनुषग भगो न वारम रण्वति |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi dyubhir janānāṃ hotā dakṣasya bāhvoḥ vi havyam aghnir ānuṣagh bhagho na vāram ṛṇvati

translations.griffith: He by the splendour of his arms is Priest of every able man.  Agni conveys oblation straight, and deals, as Bhaga deals, his boons.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य सतोमे मघोनः सख्ये वर्द्धशोचिषः विश्वा यस्मिन तुविष्वणि सम अर्ये शुष्मम आदधुः |||
verses.transliteration: asya stome maghonaḥ sakhye vṛddhaśociṣaḥ viśvā yasmin tuviṣvaṇi sam arye śuṣmam ādadhuḥ

translations.griffith: All rests upon the laud and love of him the rich, high-flaming God,  On whom, loud-roaring, men have laid great strength as on a faithful friend.

verses.sanskrit: अधा हय अग्न एषां सुवीर्यस्य मंहना तम इद यह्वं न रोदसी परि शरवो बभूवतुः |||
verses.transliteration: adhā hy aghna eṣāṃ suvīryasya maṃhanā tam id yahvaṃ na rodasī pari śravo babhūvatuḥ

translations.griffith: So, Agni, be the Friend of these with liberal gift of hero strength.  Yea, Heaven and Earth have not surpassed this Youthful One in glorious fame.

verses.sanskrit: नू न एहि वार्यम अग्ने गर्णान आ भर ये वयं ये च सूरयः सवस्ति धामहे सचोतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: nū na ehi vāryam aghne ghṛṇāna ā bhara ye vayaṃ ye ca sūrayaḥ svasti dhāmahe sacotaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe

translations.griffith: O Agni, quickly come to us, and, glorified, bring precious wealth.  So we and these our princes will assemble for the good of all. Be near in fight to prosper us.

verses.sanskrit: आ यज्ञैर देव मर्त्य इत्था तव्यांसम ऊतये अग्निं कर्ते सवध्वरे पूरुर ईळीतावसे |||
verses.transliteration: ā yajñair deva martya itthā tavyāṃsam ūtaye aghniṃ kṛte svadhvare pūrur īḷītāvase

translations.griffith: GOD, may a mortal call the Strong hither, with solemn rites, to aid,  A man call Agni to protect when sacrifice is well prepared.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य हि सवयशस्तर आसा विधर्मन मन्यसे तं नाकं चित्रशोचिषम मन्द्रम परो मनीषया |||
verses.transliteration: asya hi svayaśastara āsā vidharman manyase taṃ nākaṃ citraśociṣam mandram paro manīṣayā

translations.griffith: Near him thou seemest mightier still in native glory, set to hold  Apart yon flame-hued vault of heaven, lovely beyond the thought of man.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य वासा उ अर्चिषा य आयुक्त तुजा गिरा दिवो न यस्य रेतसा बर्हच छोचन्त्य अर्चयः |||
verses.transliteration: asya vāsā u arciṣā ya āyukta tujā ghirā divo na yasya retasā bṛhac chocanty arcayaḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, this is by the light of him whom powerful song hath bound to act,  Whose beams of splendour flash on high as though they sprang from heavenly seed.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य करत्वा विचेतसो दस्मस्य वसु रथ आ अधा विश्वासु हव्यो ऽगनिर विक्षु पर शस्यते |||
verses.transliteration: asya kratvā vicetaso dasmasya vasu ratha ā adhā viśvāsu havyo 'ghnir vikṣu pra śasyate

translations.griffith: Wealth loads the Wonder-Worker's car through his, the very wise One's power.  Then, meet to be invoked among all tribes, is Agni glorified.

verses.sanskrit: नू न इद धि वार्यम आसा सचन्त सूरयः ऊर्जो नपाद अभिष्टये पाहि शग्धि सवस्तय उतैधि पर्त्सु नो वर्धे |||
verses.transliteration: nū na id dhi vāryam āsā sacanta sūrayaḥ ūrjo napād abhiṣṭaye pāhi śaghdhi svastaya utaidhi pṛtsu no vṛdhe

translations.griffith: Now, too, the princes shall obtain excellent riches by our lips.  Protect us for our welfare: lend thy succour, O thou Son of Strength. Be near in fight to prosper us.

verses.sanskrit: परातर अग्निः पुरुप्रियो विश सतवेतातिथिः विश्वानि यो अमर्त्यो हव्या मर्तेषु रण्यति |||
verses.transliteration: prātar aghniḥ purupriyo viśa stavetātithiḥ viśvāni yo amartyo havyā marteṣu raṇyati

translations.griffith: AT dawn let Agni, much-beloved guest of the house, be glorified;  Immortal who delights in all oblations brought by mortal men.

verses.sanskrit: दविताय मर्क्तवाहसे सवस्य दक्षस्य मंहना इन्दुं स धत्त आनुषक सतोता चित ते अमर्त्य |||
verses.transliteration: dvitāya mṛktavāhase svasya dakṣasya maṃhanā induṃ sa dhatta ānuṣak stotā cit te amartya

translations.griffith: For Dvita who receives through wealth of native strength maimed offerings,  Thy praiser even gains at once the Soma-drops, Immortal Gods!

verses.sanskrit: तं वो दीर्घायुशोचिषं गिरा हुवे मघोनाम अरिष्टो येषां रथो वय अश्वदावन्न ईयते |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vo dīrghāyuśociṣaṃ ghirā huve maghonām ariṣṭo yeṣāṃ ratho vy aśvadāvann īyate

translations.griffith: Nobles, with song I call that car of yours that shines with lengthened life,  For, God who givest steeds! that car hither and thither goes unharmed.

verses.sanskrit: चित्रा वा येषु दीधितिर आसन्न उक्था पान्ति ये सतीर्णम बर्हिः सवर्णरे शरवांसि दधिरे परि |||
verses.transliteration: citrā vā yeṣu dīdhitir āsann ukthā pānti ye stīrṇam barhiḥ svarṇare śravāṃsi dadhire pari

translations.griffith: They who have varied ways of thought, who guard the lauds within their lips,  And strew the grass before the light, have decked themselves with high renown.

verses.sanskrit: ये मे पञ्चाशतं ददुर अश्वानां सधस्तुति दयुमद अग्ने महि शरवो बर्हत कर्धि मघोनां नर्वद अम्र्त नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: ye me pañcāśataṃ dadur aśvānāṃ sadhastuti dyumad aghne mahi śravo bṛhat kṛdhi maghonāṃ nṛvad amṛta nṛṇām

translations.griffith: Immortal Agni, give the chiefs, heroes who institute the rite,  Heroes’ illustrious, lofty fame, who at the synod met for praise presented me with fifty steeds.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्य अवस्थाः पर जायन्ते पर वव्रेर वव्रिश चिकेत उपस्थे मातुर वि चष्टे |||
verses.transliteration: abhy avasthāḥ pra jāyante pra vavrer vavriś ciketa upasthe mātur vi caṣṭe

translations.griffith: ONE state begets another state: husk is made visible from husk:  Within his Mother's side he speaks.

verses.sanskrit: जुहुरे वि चितयन्तो ऽनिमिषं नर्म्णम पान्ति आ दर्ळ्हाम पुरं विविशुः |||
verses.transliteration: juhure vi citayanto 'nimiṣaṃ nṛmṇam pānti ā dṛḷhām puraṃ viviśuḥ

translations.griffith: Discerning, have they offered gifts: they guard the strength that never wastes.  To a strong fort have they pressed in.

verses.sanskrit: आ शवैत्रेयस्य जन्तवो दयुमद वर्धन्त कर्ष्टयः निष्कग्रीवो बर्हदुक्थ एना मध्वा न वाजयुः |||
verses.transliteration: ā śvaitreyasya jantavo dyumad vardhanta kṛṣṭayaḥ niṣkaghrīvo bṛhaduktha enā madhvā na vājayuḥ

translations.griffith: Śvaitreya's people, all his men, have gloriously increased in might.  A gold chain Bṛhaduktha wears, as, through this Soma, seeking spoil.

verses.sanskrit: परियं दुग्धं न काम्यम अजामि जाम्योः सचा घर्मो न वाजजठरो ऽदब्धः शश्वतो दभः |||
verses.transliteration: priyaṃ dughdhaṃ na kāmyam ajāmi jāmyoḥ sacā gharmo na vājajaṭharo 'dabdhaḥ śaśvato dabhaḥ

translations.griffith: I bring, as ’twere, the longed-for milk, the dear milk of the Sister-Pair.  Like to a caldron filled with food is he, unconquered, conquering all.

verses.sanskrit: करीळन नो रश्म आ भुवः सम भस्मना वायुना वेविदानः ता अस्य सन धर्षजो न तिग्माः सुसंशिता वक्ष्यो वक्षणेस्थाः |||
verses.transliteration: krīḷan no raśma ā bhuvaḥ sam bhasmanā vāyunā vevidānaḥ tā asya san dhṛṣajo na tighmāḥ susaṃśitā vakṣyo vakṣaṇesthāḥ

translations.griffith: Beam of light, come to us in sportive fashion, finding thyself close to the wind that fans thee.  These flames of his are wasting flames, like arrows keen-pointed, sharpened, on his breast.

verses.sanskrit: यम अग्ने वाजसातम तवं चिन मन्यसे रयिम तं नो गीर्भिः शरवाय्यं देवत्रा पनया युजम |||
verses.transliteration: yam aghne vājasātama tvaṃ cin manyase rayim taṃ no ghīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṃ devatrā panayā yujam

translations.griffith: AGNI, best winner of the spoil, cause us to praise before the Gods  As our associate meet for lauds, wealth which thou verily deemest wealth.

verses.sanskrit: ये अग्ने नेरयन्ति ते वर्द्धा उग्रस्य शवसः अप दवेषो अप हवरो ऽनयव्रतस्य सश्चिरे |||
verses.transliteration: ye aghne nerayanti te vṛddhā ughrasya śavasaḥ apa dveṣo apa hvaro 'nyavratasya saścire

translations.griffith: Agni, the great who ward not off the anger of thy power and might  Stir up the wrath and hatred due to one who holds an alien creed.

verses.sanskrit: होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे ऽगने दक्षस्य साधनम यज्ञेषु पूर्व्यं गिरा परयस्वन्तो हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe 'ghne dakṣasya sādhanam yajñeṣu pūrvyaṃ ghirā prayasvanto havāmahe

translations.griffith: Thee, Agni, would we choose as Priest, the perfecter of strength and skill;  We who bring sacred food invoke with song thee Chief at holy rites.

verses.sanskrit: इत्था यथा त ऊतये सहसावन दिवे-दिवे राय रताय सुक्रतो गोभिः षयाम सधमादो वीरैः सयाम सधमादः |||
verses.transliteration: itthā yathā ta ūtaye sahasāvan dive-dive rāya ṛtāya sukrato ghobhiḥ ṣyāma sadhamādo vīraiḥ syāma sadhamādaḥ

translations.griffith: Here as is needful for thine aid we toil, O Conqueror, day by day,  For wealth, for Law. May we rejoice, Most Wise One! at the feast, with kine, rejoice, with heroes, at the feast.

verses.sanskrit: मनुष्वत तवा नि धीमहि मनुष्वत सम इधीमहि अग्ने मनुष्वद अङगिरो देवान देवयते यज |||
verses.transliteration: manuṣvat tvā ni dhīmahi manuṣvat sam idhīmahi aghne manuṣvad aṅghiro devān devayate yaja

translations.griffith: WE stablish thee as Manus used, as Manus used we kindle thee.  Like Manus, for the pious man , Aṅgiras, Agni, worship Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तवं हि मानुषे जने ऽगने सुप्रीत इध्यसे सरुचस तवा यन्त्य आनुषक सुजात सर्पिरासुते |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi mānuṣe jane 'ghne suprīta idhyase srucas tvā yanty ānuṣak sujāta sarpirāsute

translations.griffith: For well, O Agni, art thou pleased when thou art kindled mid mankind.  Straight go the ladles unto thee, thou highborn God whose food is oil.

verses.sanskrit: तवां विश्वे सजोषसो देवासो दूतम अक्रत सपर्यन्तस तवा कवे यज्ञेषु देवम ईळते |||
verses.transliteration: tvāṃ viśve sajoṣaso devāso dūtam akrata saparyantas tvā kave yajñeṣu devam īḷate

translations.griffith: Thee have all Gods of one accord established as their messenger.  Serving at sacrifices men adore thee as a God, O Sage.

verses.sanskrit: देवं वो देवयज्ययाग्निम ईळीत मर्त्यः समिद्धः शुक्र दीदिह्य रतस्य योनिम आसदः ससस्य योनिम आसदः |||
verses.transliteration: devaṃ vo devayajyayāghnim īḷīta martyaḥ samiddhaḥ śukra dīdihy ṛtasya yonim āsadaḥ sasasya yonim āsadaḥ

translations.griffith: Let mortal man adore your God, Agni, with worship due to Gods.  Shine forth enkindled, Radiant One. Sit in the chamber of the Law, sit in the chamber of the food.

verses.sanskrit: पर विश्वसामन्न अत्रिवद अर्चा पावकशोचिषे यो अध्वरेष्व ईड्यो होता मन्द्रतमो विशि |||
verses.transliteration: pra viśvasāmann atrivad arcā pāvakaśociṣe yo adhvareṣv īḍyo hotā mandratamo viśi

translations.griffith: LIKE Atri, Viśvasāman! sing to him of purifying light,  Who must be praised in holy rites, the Priest most welcome in the house.

verses.sanskrit: नय अग्निं जातवेदसं दधाता देवम रत्विजम पर यज्ञ एत्व आनुषग अद्या देवव्यचस्तमः |||
verses.transliteration: ny aghniṃ jātavedasaṃ dadhātā devam ṛtvijam pra yajña etv ānuṣagh adyā devavyacastamaḥ

translations.griffith: Set Jātavedas in his place, Agni the God and Minister.  Let sacrifice proceed to-day duly, comprising all the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: चिकित्विन्मनसं तवा देवम मर्तास ऊतये वरेण्यस्य ते ऽवस इयानासो अमन्महि |||
verses.transliteration: cikitvinmanasaṃ tvā devam martāsa ūtaye vareṇyasya te 'vasa iyānāso amanmahi

translations.griffith: All mortals come to thee for aid, the God of most observant mind.  Of thine excelling favour we bethink us as we long for it.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने चिकिद्ध्य अस्य न इदं वचः सहस्य तं तवा सुशिप्र दम्पते सतोमैर वर्धन्त्य अत्रयो गीर्भिः शुम्भन्त्य अत्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne cikiddhy asya na idaṃ vacaḥ sahasya taṃ tvā suśipra dampate stomair vardhanty atrayo ghīrbhiḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ

translations.griffith: Mark with attention this our speech, O Agni, thou victorious One.  Thee, Strong-jawed! as the homestead's Lord, the Atris with their lauds exalt, the Atris beautify with songs.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने सहन्तम आ भर दयुम्नस्य परासहा रयिम विश्वा यश चर्षणीर अभ्य रसा वाजेषु सासहत |||
verses.transliteration: aghne sahantam ā bhara dyumnasya prāsahā rayim viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhy ṛsā vājeṣu sāsahat

translations.griffith: By thy fair splendour's mighty power, O Agni, bring victorious wealth,  Wealth that o’ercometh all mankind, and, near us, conquereth in fight.

verses.sanskrit: तम अग्ने पर्तनाषहं रयिं सहस्व आ भर तवं हि सत्यो अद्भुतो दाता वाजस्य गोमतः |||
verses.transliteration: tam aghne pṛtanāṣahaṃ rayiṃ sahasva ā bhara tvaṃ hi satyo adbhuto dātā vājasya ghomataḥ

translations.griffith: Victorious Agni, bring to us the wealth that vanquisheth in war;  For thou art wonderful and true, giver of strength in herds of kine.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे हि तवा सजोषसो जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः होतारं सद्मसु परियं वयन्ति वार्या पुरु |||
verses.transliteration: viśve hi tvā sajoṣaso janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ hotāraṃ sadmasu priyaṃ vyanti vāryā puru

translations.griffith: For all the folk with one accord, whose sacred grass is trimmed and strewn,  Invite thee to their worship-halls, as a dear Priest, for choicest wealth.

verses.sanskrit: स हि षमा विश्वचर्षणिर अभिमाति सहो दधे अग्न एषु कषयेष्व आ रेवन नः शुक्र दीदिहि दयुमत पावक दीदिहि |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi ṣmā viśvacarṣaṇir abhimāti saho dadhe aghna eṣu kṣayeṣv ā revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi

translations.griffith: For he, the God of all men, hath gotten him might that quelleth foes.  O Agni, in these homes shine forth, bright God! for our prosperity, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने तवं नो अन्तम उत तराता शिवो भवा वरूथ्यः ||
verses.transliteration: aghne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ

translations.griffith: O AGNI, be our nearest Friend, be thou a kind deliverer and a gracious Friend.

verses.sanskrit: वसुर अग्निर वसुश्रवा अछा नक्षि दयुमत्तमं रयिं दाः ||
verses.transliteration: vasur aghnir vasuśravā achā nakṣi dyumattamaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ

translations.griffith: Excellent Agni, come thou nigh to us, and give us wealth most splendidly renowned.

verses.sanskrit: स नो बोधि शरुधी हवम उरुष्या णो अघायतः समस्मात ||
verses.transliteration: sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo aghāyataḥ samasmāt

translations.griffith: So hear us, listen to this call of ours, and keep us far from every sinful man.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा शोचिष्ठ दीदिवः सुम्नाय नूनम ईमहे सखिभ्यः ||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ

translations.griffith: To thee then, O Most Bright, O Radiant God, we come with prayer for happiness for our friends.

verses.sanskrit: अछा वो अग्निम अवसे देवं गासि स नो वसुः रासत पुत्र रषूणाम रतावा पर्षति दविषः |||
verses.transliteration: achā vo aghnim avase devaṃ ghāsi sa no vasuḥ rāsat putra ṛṣūṇām ṛtāvā parṣati dviṣaḥ

translations.griffith: I WILL sing near, for grace, your God Agni, for he is good to us.  Son of the Brands, may he give gifts, and, righteous, save us from the foe.

verses.sanskrit: स हि सत्यो यम पूर्वे चिद देवासश चिद यम ईधिरे होतारम मन्द्रजिह्वम इत सुदीतिभिर विभावसुम |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi satyo yam pūrve cid devāsaś cid yam īdhire hotāram mandrajihvam it sudītibhir vibhāvasum

translations.griffith: For he is true, whom men of old enkindled, and the Gods themselves,  The Priest with the delicious tongue, rich with the light of glorious beams.

verses.sanskrit: स नो धीती वरिष्ठया शरेष्ठया च सुमत्या अग्ने रायो दिदीहि नः सुव्र्क्तिभिर वरेण्य |||
verses.transliteration: sa no dhītī variṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā ca sumatyā aghne rāyo didīhi naḥ suvṛktibhir vareṇya

translations.griffith: With wisdom that surpasseth all, with gracious will most excellent,  O Agni, worthy of our choice, shine wealth on us through hymns of praise.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर देवेषु राजत्य अग्निर मर्तेष्व आविशन अग्निर नो हव्यवाहनो ऽगनिं धीभिः सपर्यत |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir deveṣu rājaty aghnir marteṣv āviśan aghnir no havyavāhano 'ghniṃ dhībhiḥ saparyata

translations.griffith: Agni is King, for he extends to mortals and to Gods alike.  Agni is bearer of our gifts. Worship ye Agni with your thoughts.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निस तुविश्रवस्तमं तुविब्रह्माणम उत्तमम अतूर्तं शरावयत्पतिम पुत्रं ददाति दाशुषे |||
verses.transliteration: aghnis tuviśravastamaṃ tuvibrahmāṇam uttamam atūrtaṃ śrāvayatpatim putraṃ dadāti dāśuṣe

translations.griffith: Agni gives to the worshipper a son, the best, of mightiest fame,  Of deep devotion, ne’er subdued, bringer of glory to his sire.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर ददाति सत्पतिं सासाह यो युधा नर्भिः अग्निर अत्यं रघुष्यदं जेतारम अपराजितम |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir dadāti satpatiṃ sāsāha yo yudhā nṛbhiḥ aghnir atyaṃ raghuṣyadaṃ jetāram aparājitam

translations.griffith: Agni bestows the hero-lord who conquers with the men in fight.  Agni bestows the fleet-foot steed, the victor never overcome.

verses.sanskrit: यद वाहिष्ठं तद अग्नये बर्हद अर्च विभावसो महिषीव तवद रयिस तवद वाजा उद ईरते |||
verses.transliteration: yad vāhiṣṭhaṃ tad aghnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate

translations.griffith: The mightiest song is Agni's: shine on high, thou who art rich in light.  Like the Chief Consort of a King, riches and strength proceed from thee.

verses.sanskrit: तव दयुमन्तो अर्चयो गरावेवोच्यते बर्हत उतो ते तन्यतुर यथा सवानो अर्त तमना दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: tava dyumanto arcayo ghrāvevocyate bṛhat uto te tanyatur yathā svāno arta tmanā divaḥ

translations.griffith: Resplendent are thy rays of light: loud is thy voice like pressing-stones.  Yea, of itself thy thunder goes forth like the roaring of the heaven.

verses.sanskrit: एवां अग्निं वसूयवः सहसानं ववन्दिम स नो विश्वा अति दविषः पर्षन नावेव सुक्रतुः |||
verses.transliteration: evāṃ aghniṃ vasūyavaḥ sahasānaṃ vavandima sa no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ parṣan nāveva sukratuḥ

translations.griffith: Thus, seeking riches, have we paid homage to Agni Conqueror.  May he, most wise, as with a ship, carry us over all our foes.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने पावक रोचिषा मन्द्रया देव जिह्वया आ देवान वक्षि यक्षि च |||
verses.transliteration: aghne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca

translations.griffith: O AGNI, Holy and Divine, with splendour and thy pleasant tongue  Bring hither and adore the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: तं तवा घर्तस्नव ईमहे चित्रभानो सवर्द्र्शम देवां आ वीतये वह |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ tvā ghṛtasnav īmahe citrabhāno svardṛśam devāṃ ā vītaye vaha

translations.griffith: We pray thee, thou who droppest oil, bright-rayed! who lookest on the Sun,  Bring the Gods hither to the feast.

verses.sanskrit: वीतिहोत्रं तवा कवे दयुमन्तं सम इधीमहि अग्ने बर्हन्तम अध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: vītihotraṃ tvā kave dyumantaṃ sam idhīmahi aghne bṛhantam adhvare

translations.griffith: We have enkindled thee, O Sage, bright caller of the Gods to feast.  O Agni, great in Sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने विश्वेभिर आ गहि देवेभिर हव्यदातये होतारं तवा वर्णीमहे |||
verses.transliteration: aghne viśvebhir ā ghahi devebhir havyadātaye hotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe

translations.griffith: O Agni, come with all the Gods, come to our sacrificial gift:  We choose thee as Invoking Priest.

verses.sanskrit: यजमानाय सुन्वत आग्ने सुवीर्यं वह देवैर आ सत्सि बर्हिषि |||
verses.transliteration: yajamānāya sunvata āghne suvīryaṃ vaha devair ā satsi barhiṣi

translations.griffith: Bring, Agni, to the worshipper who pours the juice, heroic strength:  Sit with the Gods upon the grass.

verses.sanskrit: समिधानः सहस्रजिद अग्ने धर्माणि पुष्यसि देवानां दूत उक्थ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: samidhānaḥ sahasrajid aghne dharmāṇi puṣyasi devānāṃ dūta ukthyaḥ

translations.griffith: Victor of thousands, Agni, thou, enkindled, cherishest the laws,  Laud-worthy, envoy of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: नय अग्निं जातवेदसं होत्रवाहं यविष्ठ्यम दधाता देवम रत्विजम |||
verses.transliteration: ny aghniṃ jātavedasaṃ hotravāhaṃ yaviṣṭhyam dadhātā devam ṛtvijam

translations.griffith: Set Agni Jātavedas down, the bearer of our sacred gifts,  MostYouthful, God and Minister.

verses.sanskrit: पर यज्ञ एत्व आनुषग अद्या देवव्यचस्तमः सत्र्णीत बर्हिर आसदे |||
verses.transliteration: pra yajña etv ānuṣagh adyā devavyacastamaḥ stṛṇīta barhir āsade

translations.griffith: Duly proceed our sacrifice, comprising all the Gods, to-day:  Strew holy grass to be their seat.

verses.sanskrit: एदम मरुतो अश्विना मित्रः सीदन्तु वरुणः देवासः सर्वया विशा |||
verses.transliteration: edam maruto aśvinā mitraḥ sīdantu varuṇaḥ devāsaḥ sarvayā viśā

translations.griffith: So may the Maruts sit thereon, the Aśvins, Mitra, Varuṇa:  The Gods with all their company.

verses.sanskrit: अनस्वन्ता सत्पतिर मामहे मे गावा चेतिष्ठो असुरो मघोनः तरैव्र्ष्णो अग्ने दशभिः सहस्रैर वैश्वानर तर्यरुणश चिकेत |||
verses.transliteration: anasvantā satpatir māmahe me ghāvā cetiṣṭho asuro maghonaḥ traivṛṣṇo aghne daśabhiḥ sahasrair vaiśvānara tryaruṇaś ciketa

translations.griffith: THE Godlike hero, famousest of nobles, hath granted me two oxen with a wagon.  Trvrsan's son Tryaruna hath distinguished himself, Vaiśvānara Agni! with ten thousands.

verses.sanskrit: यो मे शता च विंशतिं च गोनां हरी च युक्ता सुधुरा ददाति वैश्वानर सुष्टुतो वाव्र्धानो ऽगने यछ तर्यरुणाय शर्म |||
verses.transliteration: yo me śatā ca viṃśatiṃ ca ghonāṃ harī ca yuktā sudhurā dadāti vaiśvānara suṣṭuto vāvṛdhāno 'ghne yacha tryaruṇāya śarma

translations.griffith: Protect Tryaruna, as thou art waxing strong and art highly praised, Vaiśvānara Agni!  Who granteth me a hundred kine and twenty, and two bay horses, good at draught, and harnessed.

verses.sanskrit: एवा ते अग्ने सुमतिं चकानो नविष्ठाय नवमं तरसदस्युः यो मे गिरस तुविजातस्य पूर्वीर युक्तेनाभि तर्यरुणो गर्णाति |||
verses.transliteration: evā te aghne sumatiṃ cakāno naviṣṭhāya navamaṃ trasadasyuḥ yo me ghiras tuvijātasya pūrvīr yuktenābhi tryaruṇo ghṛṇāti

translations.griffith: So Trasadasyu served thee, God Most Youthful, craving thy favour for the ninth time, Agni;  Tryaruya who with attentive spirit accepteth many a song from me the mighty.

verses.sanskrit: यो म इति परवोचत्य अश्वमेधाय सूरये ददद रचा सनिं यते ददन मेधाम रतायते |||
verses.transliteration: yo ma iti pravocaty aśvamedhāya sūraye dadad ṛcā saniṃ yate dadan medhām ṛtāyate

translations.griffith: He who declares his wish to me, to Asvamedha, to the Prince,  Pays him who with his verse seeks gain, gives power to him who keeps the Law.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य मा परुषाः शतम उद्धर्षयन्त्य उक्षणः अश्वमेधस्य दानाः सोमा इव तर्य्र्शिरः |||
verses.transliteration: yasya mā paruṣāḥ śatam uddharṣayanty ukṣaṇaḥ aśvamedhasya dānāḥ somā iva tryṛśiraḥ

translations.griffith: From whom a hundred oxen, all of speckled hue, delight my heart,  The gifts of Asvamedha, like thrice-mingled draughts of Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी शतदाव्न्य अश्वमेधे सुवीर्यम कषत्रं धारयतम बर्हद दिवि सूर्यम इवाजरम |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī śatadāvny aśvamedhe suvīryam kṣatraṃ dhārayatam bṛhad divi sūryam ivājaram

translations.griffith: To Asvamedha who bestows a hundred gifts grant hero power,  O Indra-Agni! lofty rule like the unwasting Sun in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्निर दिवि शोचिर अश्रेत परत्यङङ उषसम उर्विया वि भाति एति पराची विश्ववारा नमोभिर देवां ईळाना हविषा घर्ताची |||
verses.transliteration: samiddho aghnir divi śocir aśret pratyaṅṅ uṣasam urviyā vi bhāti eti prācī viśvavārā namobhir devāṃ īḷānā haviṣā ghṛtācī

translations.griffith: AGNI inflamed hath sent to heaven his lustre: he shines forth widely turning unto Morning.  Eastward the ladle goes that brings all blessing, praising the Godswith homage and oblation.

verses.sanskrit: समिध्यमानो अम्र्तस्य राजसि हविष कर्ण्वन्तं सचसे सवस्तये विश्वं स धत्ते दरविणं यम इन्वस्य आतिथ्यम अग्ने नि च धत्त इत पुरः |||
verses.transliteration: samidhyamāno amṛtasya rājasi haviṣ kṛṇvantaṃ sacase svastaye viśvaṃ sa dhatte draviṇaṃ yam invasy ātithyam aghne ni ca dhatta it puraḥ

translations.griffith: Enkindled, thou art King of the immortal world: him who brings offerings thou attendest for his weal.  He whom thou urgest on makes all possessions his: he sets before thee, Agni, gifts that guests may claim.
