verses.sanskrit: अग्ने शर्ध महते सौभगाय तव दयुम्नान्य उत्तमानि सन्तु सं जास्पत्यं सुयमम आ कर्णुष्व शत्रूयताम अभि तिष्ठा महांसि |||
verses.transliteration: aghne śardha mahate saubhaghāya tava dyumnāny uttamāni santu saṃ jāspatyaṃ suyamam ā kṛṇuṣva śatrūyatām abhi tiṣṭhā mahāṃsi

translations.griffith: Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni, most excellent be thine effulgent splendours.  Make easy to maintain our household lordship, and overcome the might of those who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धस्य परमहसो ऽगने वन्दे तव शरियम वर्षभो दयुम्नवां असि सम अध्वरेष्व इध्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: samiddhasya pramahaso 'ghne vande tava śriyam vṛṣabho dyumnavāṃ asi sam adhvareṣv idhyase

translations.griffith: Thy glory, Agni, I adore, kindled, exalted in thy strength.  A Steer of brilliant splendour, thou art lighted well at sacred rites.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धो अग्न आहुत देवान यक्षि सवध्वर तवं हि हव्यवाळ असि |||
verses.transliteration: samiddho aghna āhuta devān yakṣi svadhvara tvaṃ hi havyavāḷ asi

translations.griffith: Agni, invoked and kindled, serve the Gods, thou skilled in sacrifice:  For thou art bearer of our gifts.

verses.sanskrit: आ जुहोता दुवस्यताग्निम परयत्य अध्वरे वर्णीध्वं हव्यवाहनम |||
verses.transliteration: ā juhotā duvasyatāghnim prayaty adhvare vṛṇīdhvaṃ havyavāhanam

translations.griffith: Invoke and worship Agni while the sacrificial rite proceeds:  For offering-bearer choose ye him.

verses.sanskrit: तर्य अर्यमा मनुषो देवताता तरी रोचना दिव्या धारयन्त अर्चन्ति तवा मरुतः पूतदक्षास तवम एषाम रषिर इन्द्रासि धीरः |||
verses.transliteration: try aryamā manuṣo devatātā trī rocanā divyā dhārayanta arcanti tvā marutaḥ pūtadakṣās tvam eṣām ṛṣir indrāsi dhīraḥ

translations.griffith: MAN'S worship of the Gods hath three great lustres, and three celestial lights have they established  The Maruts gifted with pure strength adore thee, for thou, O Indra, art their sapient Ṛṣi.

verses.sanskrit: अनु यद ईम मरुतो मन्दसानम आर्चन्न इन्द्रम पपिवांसं सुतस्य आदत्त वज्रम अभि यद अहिं हन्न अपो यह्वीर अस्र्जत सर्तवा उ |||
verses.transliteration: anu yad īm maruto mandasānam ārcann indram papivāṃsaṃ sutasya ādatta vajram abhi yad ahiṃ hann apo yahvīr asṛjat sartavā u

translations.griffith: What time the Maruts sang their song to Indra, joyous when he had drunk of Soma juices,  He grasped his thunderbolt to slay the Dragon, and loosed, that they might flow, the youthful Waters.

verses.sanskrit: उत बरह्माणो मरुतो मे अस्येन्द्रः सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पेयाः तद धि हव्यम मनुषे गा अविन्दद अहन्न अहिम पपिवां इन्द्रो अस्य |||
verses.transliteration: uta brahmāṇo maruto me asyendraḥ somasya suṣutasya peyāḥ tad dhi havyam manuṣe ghā avindad ahann ahim papivāṃ indro asya

translations.griffith: And, O ye Brahmans, Maruts, so may Indra drink draughts of this my carefully pressed Soma;  For this oblation found for man the cattle, and Indra, having quaffed it, slew the Dragon.

verses.sanskrit: आद रोदसी वितरं वि षकभायत संविव्यानश चिद भियसे मर्गं कः जिगर्तिम इन्द्रो अपजर्गुराणः परति शवसन्तम अव दानवं हन |||
verses.transliteration: ād rodasī vitaraṃ vi ṣkabhāyat saṃvivyānaś cid bhiyase mṛghaṃ kaḥ jighartim indro apajarghurāṇaḥ prati śvasantam ava dānavaṃ han

translations.griffith: Then heaven and earth he sundered and supported: wrapped even in these he struck the Beast with terror.  So Indra forced the Engulfer to disgorgement, and slew the Dānava. panting against him.

verses.sanskrit: अध करत्वा मघवन तुभ्यं देवा अनु विश्वे अददुः सोमपेयम यत सूर्यस्य हरितः पतन्तीः पुरः सतीर उपरा एतशे कः |||
verses.transliteration: adha kratvā maghavan tubhyaṃ devā anu viśve adaduḥ somapeyam yat sūryasya haritaḥ patantīḥ puraḥ satīr uparā etaśe kaḥ

translations.griffith: Thus all the Gods, O Maghavan, delivered to thee of their free will the draught of Soma;  When thou for Etaśa didst cause to tarry the flying mares of Sūrya racing forward.

verses.sanskrit: नव यद अस्य नवतिं च भोगान साकं वज्रेण मघवा विव्र्श्चत अर्चन्तीन्द्रम मरुतः सधस्थे तरैष्टुभेन वचसा बाधत दयाम |||
verses.transliteration: nava yad asya navatiṃ ca bhoghān sākaṃ vajreṇa maghavā vivṛścat arcantīndram marutaḥ sadhasthe traiṣṭubhena vacasā bādhata dyām

translations.griffith: When Maghavan with the thunderbolt demolished his nine-and-ninety castles all together,  The Maruts, where they met, glorified Indra: ye with the Tṛṣṭup hymn obstructed heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सखा सख्ये अपचत तूयम अग्निर अस्य करत्वा महिषा तरी शतानि तरी साकम इन्द्रो मनुषः सरांसि सुतम पिबद वर्त्रहत्याय सोमम |||
verses.transliteration: sakhā sakhye apacat tūyam aghnir asya kratvā mahiṣā trī śatāni trī sākam indro manuṣaḥ sarāṃsi sutam pibad vṛtrahatyāya somam

translations.griffith: As friend to aid a friend, Agni dressed quickly three hundred buffaloes, even as he willed it.  And Indra, from man's gift, for Vṛtra's slaughter, drank ofr at once three lakes of pressed-out Soma.

verses.sanskrit: तरी यच छता महिषाणाम अघो मास तरी सरांसि मघवा सोम्यापाः कारं न विश्वे अह्वन्त देवा भरम इन्द्राय यद अहिं जघान |||
verses.transliteration: trī yac chatā mahiṣāṇām agho mās trī sarāṃsi maghavā somyāpāḥ kāraṃ na viśve ahvanta devā bharam indrāya yad ahiṃ jaghāna

translations.griffith: When thou three hundred buffaloes' flesh hadst eaten, and drunk, as Maghavan, three lakes of Soma,  All the Gods raised as ’twere a shout of triumph to Indra praise because he slew the Dragon.

verses.sanskrit: उशना यत सहस्यैर अयातं गर्हम इन्द्र जूजुवानेभिर अश्वैः वन्वानो अत्र सरथं ययाथ कुत्सेन देवैर अवनोर ह शुष्णम |||
verses.transliteration: uśanā yat sahasyair ayātaṃ ghṛham indra jūjuvānebhir aśvaiḥ vanvāno atra sarathaṃ yayātha kutsena devair avanor ha śuṣṇam

translations.griffith: What time ye came with strong steeds swiftly speeding, O Uśanā and Indra, to the dwelling,  Thou camest thither -conquering together with Kutsa and the Gods: thou slewest Śuṣṇa.

verses.sanskrit: परान्यच चक्रम अव्र्हः सूर्यस्य कुत्सायान्यद वरिवो यातवे ऽकः अनासो दस्यूंर अम्र्णो वधेन नि दुर्योण आव्र्णङ मर्ध्रवाचः |||
verses.transliteration: prānyac cakram avṛhaḥ sūryasya kutsāyānyad varivo yātave 'kaḥ anāso dasyūṃr amṛṇo vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācaḥ

translations.griffith: One car-wheel of the Sun thou rolledst forward, and one thou settest free to move for Kutsa.  Thou slewest noseless Dasyus with thy weapon, and in their home o’erthrewest hostile speakers.

verses.sanskrit: सतोमासस तवा गौरिवीतेर अवर्धन्न अरन्धयो वैदथिनाय पिप्रुम आ तवाम रजिश्वा सख्याय चक्रे पचन पक्तीर अपिबः सोमम अस्य |||
verses.transliteration: stomāsas tvā ghaurivīter avardhann arandhayo vaidathināya piprum ā tvām ṛjiśvā sakhyāya cakre pacan paktīr apibaḥ somam asya

translations.griffith: The lauds of Gauriviti made thee mighty to Vidathin's son, as prey, thou gavest Pipru.  Rjisivan drew thee into friendship dressing the sacred food, and thou hast drunk his Soma.

verses.sanskrit: नवग्वासः सुतसोमास इन्द्रं दशग्वासो अभ्य अर्चन्त्य अर्कैः गव्यं चिद ऊर्वम अपिधानवन्तं तं चिन नरः शशमाना अप वरन |||
verses.transliteration: navaghvāsaḥ sutasomāsa indraṃ daśaghvāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ ghavyaṃ cid ūrvam apidhānavantaṃ taṃ cin naraḥ śaśamānā apa vran

translations.griffith: Navagvas and Dasgvas with libations of Soma juice sing hymns of praise to Indra.  Labouring at their task the men laid open the stall of Kine though firmly closed and fastened.

verses.sanskrit: कथो नु ते परि चराणि विद्वान वीर्य्र मघवन या चकर्थ या चो नु नव्या कर्णवः शविष्ठ परेद उ ता ते विदथेषु बरवाम |||
verses.transliteration: katho nu te pari carāṇi vidvān vīryṛ maghavan yā cakartha yā co nu navyā kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha pred u tā te vidatheṣu bravāma

translations.griffith: How shall I serve thee, Maghavan, though knowing full well what hero deeds thou hast accomplished?  And the fresh deeds which thou wilt do, Most Mighty! these, too, will we tell forth in sacred synods.

verses.sanskrit: एता विश्वा चक्र्वां इन्द्र भूर्य अपरीतो जनुषा वीर्येण या चिन नु वज्रिन कर्णवो दध्र्ष्वान न ते वर्ता तविष्या अस्ति तस्याः |||
verses.transliteration: etā viśvā cakṛvāṃ indra bhūry aparīto januṣā vīryeṇa yā cin nu vajrin kṛṇavo dadhṛṣvān na te vartā taviṣyā asti tasyāḥ

translations.griffith: Resistless from of old through hero courage, thou hast done all these many acts, O Indra.  What thou wilt do in bravery, Thunder-wielder! none is there who may hinder this thy prowess.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्र बरह्म करियमाणा जुषस्व या ते शविष्ठ नव्या अकर्म वस्त्रेव भद्रा सुक्र्ता वसूयू रथं न धीरः सवपा अतक्षम |||
verses.transliteration: indra brahma kriyamāṇā juṣasva yā te śaviṣṭha navyā akarma vastreva bhadrā sukṛtā vasūyū rathaṃ na dhīraḥ svapā atakṣam

translations.griffith: Indra, accept the prayers which now are offered, accept the new prayers, Mightiest! which we utter.  Like fair and well-made robes, I, seeking riches, as a deft craftsman makes a car, have wrought them.

verses.sanskrit: कव सय वीरः को अपश्यद इन्द्रं सुखरथम ईयमानं हरिभ्याम यो राया वज्री सुतसोमम इछन तद ओको गन्ता पुरुहूत ऊती |||
verses.transliteration: kva sya vīraḥ ko apaśyad indraṃ sukharatham īyamānaṃ haribhyām yo rāyā vajrī sutasomam ichan tad oko ghantā puruhūta ūtī

translations.griffith: WHERE is that Hero? Who hath looked on Indra borne on light-rolling car by Tawny Coursers,  Who, Thunderer, seeks with wealth the Soma-presser, and to his house goes, much-invoked, to aid him?

verses.sanskrit: अवाचचक्षम पदम अस्य सस्वर उग्रं निधातुर अन्व आयम इछन अप्र्छम अन्यां उत ते म आहुर इन्द्रं नरो बुबुधाना अशेम |||
verses.transliteration: avācacakṣam padam asya sasvar ughraṃ nidhātur anv āyam ichan apṛcham anyāṃ uta te ma āhur indraṃ naro bubudhānā aśema

translations.griffith: I have beheld his strong and secret dwelling, longing have sought the Founder's habitation.  I asked of others, and they said in answer, May we, awakened men, attain to Indra.

verses.sanskrit: पर नु वयं सुते या ते कर्तानीन्द्र बरवाम यानि नो जुजोषः वेदद अविद्वाञ छर्णवच च विद्वान वहते ऽयम मघवा सर्वसेनः |||
verses.transliteration: pra nu vayaṃ sute yā te kṛtānīndra bravāma yāni no jujoṣaḥ vedad avidvāñ chṛṇavac ca vidvān vahate 'yam maghavā sarvasenaḥ

translations.griffith: We will tell, Indra, when we pour libation, what mighty deeds thou hast performed to please us.  Let him who knows not learn, who knows them listen: hither rides Maghavan with all his army.

verses.sanskrit: सथिरम मनश चक्र्षे जात इन्द्र वेषीद एको युधये भूयसश चित अश्मानं चिच छवसा दिद्युतो वि विदो गवाम ऊर्वम उस्रियाणाम |||
verses.transliteration: sthiram manaś cakṛṣe jāta indra veṣīd eko yudhaye bhūyasaś cit aśmānaṃ cic chavasā didyuto vi vido ghavām ūrvam usriyāṇām

translations.griffith: Indra, when born, thou madest firm thy spirit: alone thou seekest war to fight with many.  With might thou clavest e’en the rock asunder, and foundest out the stable of the Milch-kine.

verses.sanskrit: परो यत तवम परम आजनिष्ठाः परावति शरुत्यं नाम बिभ्रत अतश चिद इन्द्राद अभयन्त देवा विश्वा अपो अजयद दासपत्नीः |||
verses.transliteration: paro yat tvam parama ājaniṣṭhāḥ parāvati śrutyaṃ nāma bibhrat ataś cid indrād abhayanta devā viśvā apo ajayad dāsapatnīḥ

translations.griffith: When thou wast born supremest at a distance, bearing a name renowned in far-off regions,  Since then e’en Gods have been afraid of Indra: he conquered all the floods which served the Dāsa.

verses.sanskrit: तुभ्येद एते मरुतः सुशेवा अर्चन्त्य अर्कं सुन्वन्त्य अन्धः अहिम ओहानम अप आशयानम पर मायाभिर मायिनं सक्षद इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: tubhyed ete marutaḥ suśevā arcanty arkaṃ sunvanty andhaḥ ahim ohānam apa āśayānam pra māyābhir māyinaṃ sakṣad indraḥ

translations.griffith: These blissful Maruts sing their psalm to praise thee, and pour to thee libation of the Soma.  Indra with wondrous powers subdued the Dragon, the guileful lurker who beset the waters.

verses.sanskrit: वि षू मर्धो जनुषा दानम इन्वन्न अहन गवा मघवन संचकानः अत्रा दासस्य नमुचेः शिरो यद अवर्तयो मनवे गातुम इछन |||
verses.transliteration: vi ṣū mṛdho januṣā dānam invann ahan ghavā maghavan saṃcakānaḥ atrā dāsasya namuceḥ śiro yad avartayo manave ghātum ichan

translations.griffith: Thou, Maghavan, from the first didst scatter foemen, speeding, while joying in the milk, the Giver.  There, seeking man's prosperity, thou torest away the head of Namuci the Dāsa.

verses.sanskrit: युजं हि माम अक्र्था आद इद इन्द्र शिरो दासस्य नमुचेर मथायन अश्मानं चित सवर्यं वर्तमानम पर चक्रियेव रोदसी मरुद्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yujaṃ hi mām akṛthā ād id indra śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan aśmānaṃ cit svaryaṃ vartamānam pra cakriyeva rodasī marudbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Pounding the head of Namuci the Dāsa, me, too thou madest thine associate, Indra!  Yea, and the rolling stone that is in heaven both worlds, as on a car, brought to the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit: सत्रियो हि दास आयुधानि चक्रे किम मा करन्न अबला अस्य सेनाः अन्तर हय अख्यद उभे अस्य धेने अथोप परैद युधये दस्युम इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: striyo hi dāsa āyudhāni cakre kim mā karann abalā asya senāḥ antar hy akhyad ubhe asya dhene athopa praid yudhaye dasyum indraḥ

translations.griffith: Women for weapons hath the Dāsa taken, What injury can his feeble armies To me?  Well he distinguished his two different voices, and Indra then advanced to fight the Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit: सम अत्र गावो ऽभितो ऽनवन्तेहेह वत्सैर वियुता यद आसन सं ता इन्द्रो अस्र्जद अस्य शाकैर यद ईं सोमासः सुषुता अमन्दन |||
verses.transliteration: sam atra ghāvo 'bhito 'navanteheha vatsair viyutā yad āsan saṃ tā indro asṛjad asya śākair yad īṃ somāsaḥ suṣutā amandan

translations.griffith: Divided from their calves the Cows went lowing around, on every side, hither and thither.  These Indra re-united with his helpers, what time the well-pressed Soma made him joyful.

verses.sanskrit: यद ईं सोमा बभ्रुधूता अमन्दन्न अरोरवीद वर्षभः सादनेषु पुरंदरः पपिवां इन्द्रो अस्य पुनर गवाम अददाद उस्रियाणाम |||
verses.transliteration: yad īṃ somā babhrudhūtā amandann aroravīd vṛṣabhaḥ sādaneṣu puraṃdaraḥ papivāṃ indro asya punar ghavām adadād usriyāṇām

translations.griffith: What time the Somas mixed by Babhru cheered him, loud the Steer bellowed in his habitations.  So Indra drank thereof, the Fort-destroyer, and gave him guerdon, in return, of milch-kine.

verses.sanskrit: भद्रम इदं रुशमा अग्ने अक्रन गवां चत्वारि ददतः सहस्रा रणंचयस्य परयता मघानि परत्य अग्रभीष्म नर्तमस्य नर्णाम |||
verses.transliteration: bhadram idaṃ ruśamā aghne akran ghavāṃ catvāri dadataḥ sahasrā ṛṇaṃcayasya prayatā maghāni praty aghrabhīṣma nṛtamasya nṛṇām

translations.griffith: This good deed have the Rusamas done, Agni! that they have granted me four thousand cattle.  We have received Rnancaya's wealth, of heroes the most heroic, which was freely offered.

verses.sanskrit: सुपेशसम माव सर्जन्त्य अस्तं गवां सहस्रै रुशमासो अग्ने तीव्रा इन्द्रम अममन्दुः सुतासो ऽकतोर वयुष्टौ परितक्म्यायाः |||
verses.transliteration: supeśasam māva sṛjanty astaṃ ghavāṃ sahasrai ruśamāso aghne tīvrā indram amamanduḥ sutāso 'ktor vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyāḥ

translations.griffith: The Rusamas, O Agni, sent me homeward with fair adornment and with kine in thousands.  The strong libations have made Indra joyful, when night, whose course was ending, changed to morning.

verses.sanskrit: औछत सा रात्री परितक्म्या यां रणंचये राजनि रुशमानाम अत्यो न वाजी रघुर अज्यमानो बभ्रुश चत्वार्य असनत सहस्रा |||
verses.transliteration: auchat sā rātrī paritakmyā yāṃ ṛṇaṃcaye rājani ruśamānām atyo na vājī raghur ajyamāno babhruś catvāry asanat sahasrā

translations.griffith: Night, well-nigh ended, at Rnancaya's coming, King of the Rusamas, was changed to morning.  Like a strong courser, fleet of foot, urged onward, Babhru hath gained four thousand as his guerdon.

verses.sanskrit: चतुःसहस्रं गव्यस्य पश्वः परत्य अग्रभीष्म रुशमेष्व अग्ने घर्मश चित तप्तः परव्र्जे य आसीद अयस्मयस तं व आदाम विप्राः |||
verses.transliteration: catuḥsahasraṃ ghavyasya paśvaḥ praty aghrabhīṣma ruśameṣv aghne gharmaś cit taptaḥ pravṛje ya āsīd ayasmayas taṃ v ādāma viprāḥ

translations.griffith: We have received four thousand head of cattle presented by the Rusamas, O Agni.  And we, the singers, have received the caldron of metal which was heated for Pravargya.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रो रथाय परवतं कर्णोति यम अध्यस्थान मघवा वाजयन्तम यूथेव पश्वो वय उनोति गोपा अरिष्टो याति परथमः सिषासन |||
verses.transliteration: indro rathāya pravataṃ kṛṇoti yam adhyasthān maghavā vājayantam yūtheva paśvo vy unoti ghopā aṛiṣṭo yāti prathamaḥ siṣāsan

translations.griffith: MAGHAVAN Indra turns his chariot downward, the strength-displaying car which he hath mounted.  Even as a herdsman driveth forth his cattle, he goeth, first, uninjured, fain for treasure.

verses.sanskrit: आ पर दरव हरिवो मा वि वेनः पिशङगराते अभि नः सचस्व नहि तवद इन्द्र वस्यो अन्यद अस्त्य अमेनांश चिज जनिवतश चकर्थ |||
verses.transliteration: ā pra drava harivo mā vi venaḥ piśaṅgharāte abhi naḥ sacasva nahi tvad indra vasyo anyad asty amenāṃś cij janivataś cakartha

translations.griffith: Haste to us, Lord of Bays; be not ungracious: visit us, lover of gold-hued oblation.  There is naught else better than thou art, Indra: e’en to the wifeless hast thou given spouses.

verses.sanskrit: उद यत सहः सहस आजनिष्ट देदिष्ट इन्द्र इन्द्रियाणि विश्वा पराचोदयत सुदुघा वव्रे अन्तर वि जयोतिषा संवव्र्त्वत तमो ऽवः |||
verses.transliteration: ud yat sahaḥ sahasa ājaniṣṭa dediṣṭa indra indriyāṇi viśvā prācodayat sudughā vavre antar vi jyotiṣā saṃvavṛtvat tamo 'vaḥ

translations.griffith: When out of strength arose the strength that conquers, Indra displayed all powers that he possesses.  Forth from the cave he drove the milky mothers, and with the light laid bare investing darkness.

verses.sanskrit: अनवस ते रथम अश्वाय तक्षन तवष्टा वज्रम पुरुहूत दयुमन्तम बरह्माण इन्द्रम महयन्तो अर्कैर अवर्धयन्न अहये हन्तवा उ |||
verses.transliteration: anavas te ratham aśvāya takṣan tvaṣṭā vajram puruhūta dyumantam brahmāṇa indram mahayanto arkair avardhayann ahaye hantavā u

translations.griffith: Anus have wrought a chariot for thy Courser, and Tvaṣṭar, Much-invoked! thy bolt that glitters.  The Brahmans with their songs exalting Indra increased his strength that he might slaughter Ahi.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्णे यत ते वर्षणो अर्कम अर्चान इन्द्र गरावाणो अदितिः सजोषाः अनश्वासो ये पवयो ऽरथा इन्द्रेषिता अभ्य अवर्तन्त दस्यून |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇe yat te vṛṣaṇo arkam arcān indra ghrāvāṇo aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ anaśvāso ye pavayo 'rathā indreṣitā abhy avartanta dasyūn

translations.griffith: When heroes sang their laud to thee the Hero, Indra! and stones and Aditi accordant,  Without or steed or chariot were the fellies which, sped by Indra, rolled upon the Dasytis.

verses.sanskrit: पर ते पूर्वाणि करणानि वोचम पर नूतना मघवन या चकर्थ शक्तीवो यद विभरा रोदसी उभे जयन्न अपो मनवे दानुचित्राः |||
verses.transliteration: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni vocam pra nūtanā maghavan yā cakartha śaktīvo yad vibharā rodasī ubhe jayann apo manave dānucitrāḥ

translations.griffith: I will declare thine exploits wrought aforetime, and, Maghavan, thy deeds of late achievement,  When, Lord of Might, thou sunderedst earth and heaven, winning for man the moistly-gleaming waters.

verses.sanskrit: तद इन नु ते करणं दस्म विप्राहिं यद घनन्न ओजो अत्रामिमीथाः शुष्णस्य चित परि माया अग्र्भ्णाः परपित्वं यन्न अप दस्यूंर असेधः |||
verses.transliteration: tad in nu te karaṇaṃ dasma viprāhiṃ yad ghnann ojo atrāmimīthāḥ śuṣṇasya cit pari māyā aghṛbhṇāḥ prapitvaṃ yann apa dasyūṃr asedhaḥ

translations.griffith: This is thy deed, e’en this, Wonderful! Singer! that, slaying Ahi, here thy strength thou showedst,  Didst check and stay e’en gusna's wiles and magic, and, drawing nigh, didst chase away the Dasytis.

verses.sanskrit: तवम अपो यदवे तुर्वशायारमयः सुदुघाः पार इन्द्र उग्रम अयातम अवहो ह कुत्सं सं ह यद वाम उशनारन्त देवाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvam apo yadave turvaśāyāramayaḥ sudughāḥ pāra indra ughram ayātam avaho ha kutsaṃ saṃ ha yad vām uśanāranta devāḥ

translations.griffith: Thou, Indra, on the farther bank forYadu and Turvaga didst stay the gushing waters.  Ye both assailed the fierce: thou barest Kutsa: when Gods and Uśanā came to you together.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राकुत्सा वहमाना रथेना वाम अत्या अपि कर्णे वहन्तु निः षीम अद्भ्यो धमथो निः षधस्थान मघोनो हर्दो वरथस तमांसि |||
verses.transliteration: indrākutsā vahamānā rathenā vām atyā api karṇe vahantu niḥ ṣīm adbhyo dhamatho niḥ ṣadhasthān maghono hṛdo varathas tamāṃsi

translations.griffith: Let the steeds bring you both, Indra and Kutsa, borne on the chariot within hearing-distance.  Ye blew him from the waters, from his dwelling, and chased the darkness from the noble's spirit.

verses.sanskrit: वातस्य युक्तान सुयुजश चिद अश्वान कविश चिद एषो अजगन्न अवस्युः विश्वे ते अत्र मरुतः सखाय इन्द्र बरह्माणि तविषीम अवर्धन |||
verses.transliteration: vātasya yuktān suyujaś cid aśvān kaviś cid eṣo ajaghann avasyuḥ viśve te atra marutaḥ sakhāya indra brahmāṇi taviṣīm avardhan

translations.griffith: Even this sage hath come looking for succour even to Vāta's docile harnessed horses.  Here are the Maruts, all, thy dear companions: prayers have increased thy power and might, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit: सूरश चिद रथम परितक्म्यायाम पूर्वं करद उपरं जूजुवांसम भरच चक्रम एतशः सं रिणाति पुरो दधत सनिष्यति करतुं नः |||
verses.transliteration: sūraś cid ratham paritakmyāyām pūrvaṃ karad uparaṃ jūjuvāṃsam bharac cakram etaśaḥ saṃ riṇāti puro dadhat saniṣyati kratuṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: When night was near its close he carried forward e’en the Sun's chariot backward in its running.  Etaga brought his wheel and firmly stays it: setting it eastward he shall give us courage.

verses.sanskrit: आयं जना अभिचक्षे जगामेन्द्रः सखायं सुतसोमम इछन वदन गरावाव वेदिम भरियाते यस्य जीरम अध्वर्यवश चरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: āyaṃ janā abhicakṣe jaghāmendraḥ sakhāyaṃ sutasomam ichan vadan ghrāvāva vedim bhriyāte yasya jīram adhvaryavaś caranti

translations.griffith: This Indra, O ye men, hath come to see you, seeking a friend who hath expressed the Soma.  The creaking stone is laid upon the altar, and the Adhvaryus come to turn it quickly.

verses.sanskrit: ये चाकनन्त चाकनन्त नू ते मर्ता अम्र्त मो ते अंह आरन वावन्धि यज्यूंर उत तेषु धेह्य ओजो जनेषु येषु ते सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: ye cākananta cākananta nū te martā amṛta mo te aṃha āran vāvandhi yajyūṃr uta teṣu dhehy ojo janeṣu yeṣu te syāma

translations.griffith: Let mortals who were happy still be happy; let them not come to sorrow, O Immortal.  Love thou the pious, and to these thy people-with whom may we be numbered-give thou vigour.

verses.sanskrit: अदर्दर उत्सम अस्र्जो वि खानि तवम अर्णवान बद्बधानां अरम्णाः महान्तम इन्द्र पर्वतं वि यद वः सर्जो वि धारा अव दानवं हन |||
verses.transliteration: adardar utsam asṛjo vi khāni tvam arṇavān badbadhānāṃ aramṇāḥ mahāntam indra parvataṃ vi yad vaḥ sṛjo vi dhārā ava dānavaṃ han

translations.griffith: 1ṬHE well thou clavest, settest free the fountains, and gavest rest to floods that were obstructed.  Thou, Indra, laying the great mountain open, slaying the Dānava, didst loose the torrents.

verses.sanskrit: तवम उत्सां रतुभिर बद्बधानां अरंह ऊधः पर्वतस्य वज्रिन अहिं चिद उग्र परयुतं शयानं जघन्वां इन्द्र तविषीम अधत्थाः |||
verses.transliteration: tvam utsāṃ ṛtubhir badbadhānāṃ araṃha ūdhaḥ parvatasya vajrin ahiṃ cid ughra prayutaṃ śayānaṃ jaghanvāṃ indra taviṣīm adhatthāḥ

translations.griffith: The fountain-depths obstructed in their seasons, thou, Thunderer! madest flow, the mountain's udder.  Strong Indra, thou by slaying e’en the Dragon that lay extended there hast shown thy vigour.

verses.sanskrit: तयस्य चिन महतो निर मर्गस्य वधर जघान तविषीभिर इन्द्रः य एक इद अप्रतिर मन्यमान आद अस्माद अन्यो अजनिष्ट तव्यान |||
verses.transliteration: tyasya cin mahato nir mṛghasya vadhar jaghāna taviṣībhir indraḥ ya eka id apratir manyamāna ād asmād anyo ajaniṣṭa tavyān

translations.griffith: Indra with violence smote down the weapon,  yea, even of that wild and mighty creature.  Although he deemed himself alone unequalled, another had been born e’en yet more potent.

verses.sanskrit: तयं चिद एषां सवधया मदन्तम मिहो नपातं सुव्र्धं तमोगाम वर्षप्रभर्मा दानवस्य भामं वज्रेण वज्री नि जघान शुष्णम |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cid eṣāṃ svadhayā madantam miho napātaṃ suvṛdhaṃ tamoghām vṛṣaprabharmā dānavasya bhāmaṃ vajreṇa vajrī ni jaghāna śuṣṇam

translations.griffith: Him, whom the heavenly food of these delighted, child of the mist, strong waxing, couched in darkness,  Him the bolt-hurling Thunderer with his lightning smote down and slew, the Dānava's wrath-fire, Śuṣṇa.

verses.sanskrit: तयं चिद अस्य करतुभिर निषत्तम अमर्मणो विदद इद अस्य मर्म यद ईं सुक्षत्र परभ्र्ता मदस्य युयुत्सन्तं तमसि हर्म्ये धाः |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cid asya kratubhir niṣattam amarmaṇo vidad id asya marma yad īṃ sukṣatra prabhṛtā madasya yuyutsantaṃ tamasi harmye dhāḥ

translations.griffith: Though he might ne’er be wounded still his vitals felt that, the God's bolt, which his powers supported,  When, after offered draughts, Strong Lord, thou laidest him, fain to battle, in the pit in darkness.

verses.sanskrit: तयं चिद इत्था कत्पयं शयानम असूर्ये तमसि वाव्र्धानम तं चिन मन्दानो वर्षभः सुतस्योच्चैर इन्द्रो अपगूर्या जघान |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cid itthā katpayaṃ śayānam asūrye tamasi vāvṛdhānam taṃ cin mandāno vṛṣabhaḥ sutasyoccair indro apaghūryā jaghāna

translations.griffith: Him as he lay there huge in length extended, still waxing in the gloom which no sun lightened,  Him, after loud-voiced threats, the Hero Indra, rejoicing in the poured libation, slaughtered.

verses.sanskrit: उद यद इन्द्रो महते दानवाय वधर यमिष्ट सहो अप्रतीतम यद ईं वज्रस्य परभ्र्तौ ददाभ विश्वस्य जन्तोर अधमं चकार |||
verses.transliteration: ud yad indro mahate dānavāya vadhar yamiṣṭa saho apratītam yad īṃ vajrasya prabhṛtau dadābha viśvasya jantor adhamaṃ cakāra

translations.griffith: When 'gainst the mighty Dānava his weapon Indra uplifted, power which none could combat,  When at the hurling of his bolt he smote him, he made him lower than all living creatures.

verses.sanskrit: तयं चिद अर्णम मधुपं शयानम असिन्वं वव्रम मह्य आदद उग्रः अपादम अत्रम महता वधेन नि दुर्योण आव्र्णङ मर्ध्रवाचम |||
verses.transliteration: tyaṃ cid arṇam madhupaṃ śayānam asinvaṃ vavram mahy ādad ughraḥ apādam atram mahatā vadhena ni duryoṇa āvṛṇaṅ mṛdhravācam

translations.griffith: The fierce God seized that huge and restless coiler, insatiate, drinker of the sweets, recumbent,  And with his mighty weapon in his dwelling smote down the footless evil-speaking ogre.

verses.sanskrit: को अस्य शुष्मं तविषीं वरात एको धना भरते अप्रतीतः इमे चिद अस्य जरयसो नु देवी इन्द्रस्यौजसो भियसा जिहाते |||
verses.transliteration: ko asya śuṣmaṃ taviṣīṃ varāta eko dhanā bharate apratītaḥ ime cid asya jrayaso nu devī indrasyaujaso bhiyasā jihāte

translations.griffith: Who may arrest his strength or cheek his vigour? Alone, resistless, he bears off all riches.  Even these Twain, these Goddesses, through terror of Indra's might, retire from his dominion.

verses.sanskrit: नय अस्मै देवी सवधितिर जिहीत इन्द्राय गातुर उशतीव येमे सं यद ओजो युवते विश्वम आभिर अनु सवधाव्ने कषितयो नमन्त |||
verses.transliteration: ny asmai devī svadhitir jihīta indrāya ghātur uśatīva yeme saṃ yad ojo yuvate viśvam ābhir anu svadhāvne kṣitayo namanta

translations.griffith: E’en the Celestial Axe bows down before him, and the Earth, lover-like, gives way to Indra.  As he imparts all vigour to these people, straightway the folk bend them to him the Godlike.

verses.sanskrit: एकं नु तवा सत्पतिम पाञ्चजन्यं जातं शर्णोमि यशसं जनेषु तम मे जग्र्भ्र आशसो नविष्ठं दोषा वस्तोर हवमानास इन्द्रम |||
verses.transliteration: ekaṃ nu tvā satpatim pāñcajanyaṃ jātaṃ śṛṇomi yaśasaṃ janeṣu tam me jaghṛbhra āśaso naviṣṭhaṃ doṣā vastor havamānāsa indram

translations.griffith: I hear that thou wast born sole Lord of heroes of the Five Races, famed among the people.  As such my wishes have most lately grasped him, invoking Indra both at eve and morning.

verses.sanskrit: एवा हि तवाम रतुथा यातयन्तम मघा विप्रेभ्यो ददतं शर्णोमि किं ते बरह्माणो गर्हते सखायो ये तवाया निदधुः कामम इन्द्र |||
verses.transliteration: evā hi tvām ṛtuthā yātayantam maghā viprebhyo dadataṃ śṛṇomi kiṃ te brahmāṇo ghṛhate sakhāyo ye tvāyā nidadhuḥ kāmam indra

translations.griffith: So, too, I hear of thee as in due season urging to action and enriching singers.  What have thy friends received from thee, the Brahmans who, faithful, rest their hopes on thee, O Indra?

verses.sanskrit: महि महे तवसे दीध्ये नॄन इन्द्रायेत्था तवसे अतव्यान यो अस्मै सुमतिं वाजसातौ सतुतो जने समर्यश चिकेत |||
verses.transliteration: mahi mahe tavase dīdhye nṝn indrāyetthā tavase atavyān yo asmai sumatiṃ vājasātau stuto jane samaryaś ciketa

translations.griffith: GREAT praise to Indra, great and strong mid heroes, I ponder thus, the feeble to the Mighty,  Who with his band shows favour to this people, when lauded, in the fight where spoil is gathered.

verses.sanskrit: स तवं न इन्द्र धियसानो अर्कैर हरीणां वर्षन योक्त्रम अश्रेः या इत्था मघवन्न अनु जोषं वक्षो अभि परार्यः सक्षि जनान |||
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indra dhiyasāno arkair harīṇāṃ vṛṣan yoktram aśreḥ yā itthā maghavann anu joṣaṃ vakṣo abhi prāryaḥ sakṣi janān

translations.griffith: So made attentive by our hymns, Steer! Indra! thou fastenedst the girth of thy Bay Coursers,  Which, Maghavan, at thy will thou drivest hither. With these subdue for us the men who hate us.

verses.sanskrit: न ते त इन्द्राभ्य अस्मद रष्वायुक्तासो अब्रह्मता यद असन तिष्ठा रथम अधि तं वज्रहस्ता रश्मिं देव यमसे सवश्वः |||
verses.transliteration: na te ta indrābhy asmad ṛṣvāyuktāso abrahmatā yad asan tiṣṭhā ratham adhi taṃ vajrahastā raśmiṃ deva yamase svaśvaḥ

translations.griffith: They were not turned to us-wtrd, lofty Indra! while yet through lack of prayer they stood unharnessed.  Ascend this chariot, thou whose hand wields thunder, and draw the rein, O Lord of noble horses.

verses.sanskrit: पुरू यत त इन्द्र सन्त्य उक्था गवे चकर्थोर्वरासु युध्यन ततक्षे सूर्याय चिद ओकसि सवे वर्षा समत्सु दासस्य नाम चित |||
verses.transliteration: purū yat ta indra santy ukthā ghave cakarthorvarāsu yudhyan tatakṣe sūryāya cid okasi sve vṛṣā samatsu dāsasya nāma cit

translations.griffith: Thou, because many lauds are thine, O Indra, wast active warring in the fields  for cattle.  For Sūrya in his own abode thou, Hero, formedst in fights even a Dāsa's nature.

verses.sanskrit: वयं ते त इन्द्र ये च नरः शर्धो जज्ञाना याताश च रथाः आस्माञ जगम्याद अहिशुष्म सत्वा भगो न हव्यः परभ्र्थेषु चारुः |||
verses.transliteration: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca naraḥ śardho jajñānā yātāś ca rathāḥ āsmāñ jaghamyād ahiśuṣma satvā bhagho na havyaḥ prabhṛtheṣu cāruḥ

translations.griffith: Thine are we, Indra; thine are all these people, conscious of might, whose cars are set in motion.  Some hero come to us, O Strong as Ahi beauteous in war, to be invoked like Bhaga.

verses.sanskrit: पप्र्क्षेण्यम इन्द्र तवे हय ओजो नर्म्णानि च नर्तमानो अमर्तः स न एनीं वसवानो रयिं दाः परार्य सतुषे तुविमघस्य दानम |||
verses.transliteration: papṛkṣeṇyam indra tve hy ojo nṛmṇāni ca nṛtamāno amartaḥ sa na enīṃ vasavāno rayiṃ dāḥ prārya stuṣe tuvimaghasya dānam

translations.griffith: Strength much to be desired is in thee, Indra: the Immortal dances forth his hero exploits.  Such, Lord of Treasure, give us splendid riches. I praise the Friend's gift, his whose wealth is mighty.

verses.sanskrit: एवा न इन्द्रोतिभिर अव पाहि गर्णतः शूर कारून उत तवचं ददतो वाजसातौ पिप्रीहि मध्वः सुषुतस्य चारोः |||
verses.transliteration: evā na indrotibhir ava pāhi ghṛṇataḥ śūra kārūn uta tvacaṃ dadato vājasātau piprīhi madhvaḥ suṣutasya cāroḥ

translations.griffith: Thus favour us, O Indra, with ihy succour; Hero, protect the bards who sing thy praises.  Be friendly in the fray to those who offer the skin of beautiful and well-pressed Soma.

verses.sanskrit: उत तये मा पौरुकुत्स्यस्य सूरेस तरसदस्योर हिरणिनो रराणाः वहन्तु मा दश शयेतासो अस्य गैरिक्षितस्य करतुभिर नु सश्चे |||
verses.transliteration: uta tye mā paurukutsyasya sūres trasadasyor hiraṇino rarāṇāḥ vahantu mā daśa śyetāso asya ghairikṣitasya kratubhir nu saśce

translations.griffith: And these ten steeds which Trasadasyu gives me, the goldrich chief, the son of Purukutsa,  Resplendent in their brightness shall convey me. Gairiksita willed it and so came I hither.

verses.sanskrit: उत तये मा मारुताश्वस्य शोणाः करत्वामघासो विदथस्य रातौ सहस्रा मे चयवतानो ददान आनूकम अर्यो वपुषे नार्चत |||
verses.transliteration: uta tye mā mārutāśvasya śoṇāḥ kratvāmaghāso vidathasya rātau sahasrā me cyavatāno dadāna ānūkam aryo vapuṣe nārcat

translations.griffith: And these, bestowed as sacrificial guerdon, the powerful tawny steeds of Marutasva;  And thousands which kind Cyavatana gave me, abundantly bestowed for my adornment.

verses.sanskrit: उत तये मा धवन्यस्य जुष्टा लक्ष्मण्यस्य सुरुचो यतानाः मह्ना रायः संवरणस्य रषेर वरजं न गावः परयता अपि गमन |||
verses.transliteration: uta tye mā dhvanyasya juṣṭā lakṣmaṇyasya suruco yatānāḥ mahnā rāyaḥ saṃvaraṇasya ṛṣer vrajaṃ na ghāvaḥ prayatā api ghman

translations.griffith: And these commended horses, bright and active, by Dhvanya son of Laksmana presented,  Came unto me, as cows into the Ṛṣi Samvarana's stall, with magnitude of riches.

verses.sanskrit: अजातशत्रुम अजरा सवर्वत्य अनु सवधामिता दस्मम ईयते सुनोतन पचत बरह्मवाहसे पुरुष्टुताय परतरं दधातन |||
verses.transliteration: ajātaśatrum ajarā svarvaty anu svadhāmitā dasmam īyate sunotana pacata brahmavāhase puruṣṭutāya prataraṃ dadhātana

translations.griffith: BOUNDLESS and wasting not, the heavenly food of Gods goes to the foeless One, doer of wondrous deeds.  Press out, make ready, offer gifts with special zeal to him whom many laud, accepter of the prayer.

verses.sanskrit: आ यः सोमेन जठरम अपिप्रतामन्दत मघवा मध्वो अन्धसः यद ईम मर्गाय हन्तवे महावधः सहस्रभ्र्ष्टिम उशना वधं यमत |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaḥ somena jaṭharam apipratāmandata maghavā madhvo andhasaḥ yad īm mṛghāya hantave mahāvadhaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭim uśanā vadhaṃ yamat

translations.griffith: He who filled full his belly with the Soma's juice, Maghavan, was delighted with the meath's sweet draught,  When Uśanā, that he might slay the monstrous beast, gave him the mighty weapon with a thousand points.

verses.sanskrit: यो अस्मै घरंस उत वा य ऊधनि सोमं सुनोति भवति दयुमां अह अपाप शक्रस ततनुष्टिम ऊहति तनूशुभ्रम मघवा यः कवासखः |||
verses.transliteration: yo asmai ghraṃsa uta vā ya ūdhani somaṃ sunoti bhavati dyumāṃ aha apāpa śakras tatanuṣṭim ūhati tanūśubhram maghavā yaḥ kavāsakhaḥ

translations.griffith: Illustrious is the man whoever presseth out Soma for him in sunshine or in cloud and rain.  The mighty Maghavan who is the sage's Friend advanceth more and more his beauteous progeny.

verses.sanskrit: यस्यावधीत पितरं यस्य मातरं यस्य शक्रो भरातरं नात ईषते वेतीद व अस्य परयता यतंकरो न किल्बिषाद ईषते वस्व आकरः |||
verses.transliteration: yasyāvadhīt pitaraṃ yasya mātaraṃ yasya śakro bhrātaraṃ nāta īṣate vetīd v asya prayatā yataṃkaro na kilbiṣād īṣate vasva ākaraḥ

translations.griffith: The Strong God doth not flee away from him whose sire, whose mother or whose brother he hath done to death.  He, the Avenger, seeketh this man's offered gifts: this God, the source of riches, doth not flee from sin.

verses.sanskrit: न पञ्चभिर दशभिर वष्ट्य आरभं नासुन्वता सचते पुष्यता चन जिनाति वेद अमुया हन्ति वा धुनिर आ देवयुम भजति गोमति वरजे |||
verses.transliteration: na pañcabhir daśabhir vaṣṭy ārabhaṃ nāsunvatā sacate puṣyatā cana jināti ved amuyā hanti vā dhunir ā devayum bhajati ghomati vraje

translations.griffith: He seeks no enterprise with five or ten to aid, nor stays with him who pours no juice though prospering well.  The Shaker conquers or slays in this way or that, and to the pious gives a stable full of kine.

verses.sanskrit: वित्वक्षणः सम्र्तौ चक्रमासजो ऽसुन्वतो विषुणः सुन्वतो वर्धः इन्द्रो विश्वस्य दमिता विभीषणो यथावशं नयति दासम आर्यः |||
verses.transliteration: vitvakṣaṇaḥ samṛtau cakramāsajo 'sunvato viṣuṇaḥ sunvato vṛdhaḥ indro viśvasya damitā vibhīṣaṇo yathāvaśaṃ nayati dāsam āryaḥ

translations.griffith: Exceeding strong in war he stays the chariot wheel, and, hating him who pours not, prospers him who pours.  Indra the terrible, tamer of every man, as Ārya leads away the Dāsa at his will.

verses.sanskrit: सम ईम पणेर अजति भोजनम मुषे वि दाशुषे भजति सूनरं वसु दुर्गे चन धरियते विश्व आ पुरु जनो यो अस्य तविषीम अचुक्रुधत |||
verses.transliteration: sam īm paṇer ajati bhojanam muṣe vi dāśuṣe bhajati sūnaraṃ vasu durghe cana dhriyate viśva ā puru jano yo asya taviṣīm acukrudhat

translations.griffith: He gathers up for plunder all the niggard’s gear: excellent wealth he gives to him who offers gifts.  Not even in wide stronghold may all the folk stand firm who have provoked to anger his surpassing might.

verses.sanskrit: सं यज जनौ सुधनौ विश्वशर्धसाव अवेद इन्द्रो मघवा गोषु शुभ्रिषु युजं हय अन्यम अक्र्त परवेपन्य उद ईं गव्यं सर्जते सत्वभिर धुनिः |||
verses.transliteration: saṃ yaj janau sudhanau viśvaśardhasāv aved indro maghavā ghoṣu śubhriṣu yujaṃ hy anyam akṛta pravepany ud īṃ ghavyaṃ sṛjate satvabhir dhuniḥ

translations.griffith: When Indra Maghavan hath marked two wealthy men fighting for beauteous cows with all their followers,  He who stirs all things takes one as his close ally, and, Shaker, with his Heroes, sends the kine to him.

verses.sanskrit: सहस्रसाम आग्निवेशिं गर्णीषे शत्रिम अग्न उपमां केतुम अर्यः तस्मा आपः संयतः पीपयन्त तस्मिन कषत्रम अमवत तवेषम अस्तु |||
verses.transliteration: sahasrasām āghniveśiṃ ghṛṇīṣe śatrim aghna upamāṃ ketum aryaḥ tasmā āpaḥ saṃyataḥ pīpayanta tasmin kṣatram amavat tveṣam astu

translations.griffith: Agni! I laud the liberal Agnivesi, Satri the type and standard of the pious.  May the collected waters yield him plenty, and his be powerful and bright dominion.

verses.sanskrit: यस ते साधिष्ठो ऽवस इन्द्र करतुष टम आ भर अस्मभ्यं चर्षणीसहं सस्निं वाजेषु दुष्टरम |||
verses.transliteration: yas te sādhiṣṭho 'vasa indra kratuṣ ṭam ā bhara asmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahaṃ sasniṃ vājeṣu duṣṭaram

translations.griffith: INDRA, for our assistance bring that most effectual power of thine,  Which conquers men for us, and wins the spoil, invincible in fight.

verses.sanskrit: यद इन्द्र ते चतस्रो यच छूर सन्ति तिस्रः यद वा पञ्च कषितीनाम अवस तत सु न आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: yad indra te catasro yac chūra santi tisraḥ yad vā pañca kṣitīnām avas tat su na ā bhara

translations.griffith: Indra, whatever aids be thine, four be they, or, O Hero, three,  Or those of the Five Tribes of men, bring quickly all that help to us.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते ऽवो वरेण्यं वर्षन्तमस्य हूमहे वर्षजूतिर हि जज्ञिष आभूभिर इन्द्र तुर्वणिः |||
verses.transliteration: ā te 'vo vareṇyaṃ vṛṣantamasya hūmahe vṛṣajūtir hi jajñiṣa ābhūbhir indra turvaṇiḥ

translations.griffith: The aid most excellent of thee the Mightiest hitherward we call,  For thou wast born with hero might, conquering, Indra, with the Strong.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा हय असि राधसे जज्ञिषे वर्ष्णि ते शवः सवक्षत्रं ते धर्षन मनः सत्राहम इन्द्र पौंस्यम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā hy asi rādhase jajñiṣe vṛṣṇi te śavaḥ svakṣatraṃ te dhṛṣan manaḥ satrāham indra pauṃsyam

translations.griffith: Mighty to prosper us wast thou born, and mighty is the strength thou hast.  In native power thy soul is firm: thy valour, Indra, slays a host.

verses.sanskrit: तवं तम इन्द्र मर्त्यम अमित्रयन्तम अद्रिवः सर्वरथा शतक्रतो नि याहि शवसस पते |||
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ tam indra martyam amitrayantam adrivaḥ sarvarathā śatakrato ni yāhi śavasas pate

translations.griffith: O Śatakratu, Lord of Strength, O Indra, Caster of the Stone.  With all thy chariot's force assail the man who shows himself thy foe.

verses.sanskrit: तवाम इद वर्त्रहन्तम जनासो वर्क्तबर्हिषः उग्रम पूर्वीषु पूर्व्यं हवन्ते वाजसातये |||
verses.transliteration: tvām id vṛtrahantama janāso vṛktabarhiṣaḥ ughram pūrvīṣu pūrvyaṃ havante vājasātaye

translations.griffith: For, Mightiest Vṛtra-slayer, thee, fierce, foremost among many, folk  Whose sacred grass is trimmed invite to battle where the spoil is won.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकम इन्द्र दुष्टरम पुरोयावानम आजिषु सयावानं धने-धने वाजयन्तम अवा रथम |||
verses.transliteration: asmākam indra duṣṭaram puroyāvānam ājiṣu sayāvānaṃ dhane-dhane vājayantam avā ratham

translations.griffith: Indra, do thou protect our car that mingles foremost in the fights,  That bears its part in every fray, invincible and seeking spoil.

verses.sanskrit: अस्माकम इन्द्रेहि नो रथम अवा पुरंध्या वयं शविष्ठ वार्यं दिवि शरवो दधीमहि दिवि सतोमम मनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: asmākam indrehi no ratham avā puraṃdhyā vayaṃ śaviṣṭha vāryaṃ divi śravo dadhīmahi divi stomam manāmahe

translations.griffith: Come to us, Indra, and protect our car with thine intelligence.  May we, O Mightiest One, obtain excellent fame at break of day, and meditate our hymn at dawn.

verses.sanskrit: स आ गमद इन्द्रो यो वसूनां चिकेतद दातुं दामनो रयीणाम धन्वचरो न वंसगस तर्षाणश चकमानः पिबतु दुग्धम अंशुम |||
verses.transliteration: sa ā ghamad indro yo vasūnāṃ ciketad dātuṃ dāmano rayīṇām dhanvacaro na vaṃsaghas tṛṣāṇaś cakamānaḥ pibatu dughdham aṃśum

translations.griffith: MAY Indra come to us, he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches.  Even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milked-out Soma.

verses.sanskrit: आ ते हनू हरिवः शूर शिप्रे रुहत सोमो न पर्वतस्य पर्ष्ठे अनु तवा राजन्न अर्वतो न हिन्वन गीर्भिर मदेम पुरुहूत विश्वे |||
verses.transliteration: ā te hanū harivaḥ śūra śipre ruhat somo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhe anu tvā rājann arvato na hinvan ghīrbhir madema puruhūta viśve

translations.griffith: Lord of Bay Horses, Hero, may the Soma rise to thy cheeks and jaws like mountain-ridges.  May we, O King, as he who driveth coursers, all joy in thee with hymns, invoked of many!

verses.sanskrit: चक्रं न वर्त्तम पुरुहूत वेपते मनो भिया मे अमतेर इद अद्रिवः रथाद अधि तवा जरिता सदाव्र्ध कुविन नु सतोषन मघवन पुरूवसुः |||
verses.transliteration: cakraṃ na vṛttam puruhūta vepate mano bhiyā me amater id adrivaḥ rathād adhi tvā jaritā sadāvṛdha kuvin nu stoṣan maghavan purūvasuḥ

translations.griffith: Invoked of many, Caster of the Stone my heart quakes like a rolling wheel for fear of penury.  Shall not Puruvasu the singer give thee praise, O ever-prospering Maghavan, mounted on thy car?

verses.sanskrit: एष गरावेव जरिता त इन्द्रेयर्ति वाचम बर्हद आशुषाणः पर सव्येन मघवन यंसि रायः पर दक्षिणिद धरिवो मा वि वेनः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa ghrāveva jaritā ta indreyarti vācam bṛhad āśuṣāṇaḥ pra savyena maghavan yaṃsi rāyaḥ pra dakṣiṇid dharivo mā vi venaḥ

translations.griffith: Like the press-stone is this thy praiser, Indra. Loudly he lifts his voice with strong endeavour.  With thy left hand, O Maghavan, give us riches: with thy right, Lord of Bays, be not reluctant.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा तवा वर्षणं वर्धतु दयौर वर्षा वर्षभ्यां वहसे हरिभ्याम स नो वर्षा वर्षरथः सुशिप्र वर्षक्रतो वर्षा वज्रिन भरे धाः |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhatu dyaur vṛṣā vṛṣabhyāṃ vahase haribhyām sa no vṛṣā vṛṣarathaḥ suśipra vṛṣakrato vṛṣā vajrin bhare dhāḥ

translations.griffith: May the strong Heaven make thee the Strong wax stronger: Strong, thou art borne by thy two strong Bay Horses.  So, fair of cheek, with mighty chariot, mighty, uphold us, strong-willed, thunderarmed, in battle.

verses.sanskrit: यो रोहितौ वाजिनौ वाजिनीवान तरिभिः शतैः सचमानाव अदिष्ट यूने सम अस्मै कषितयो नमन्तां शरुतरथाय मरुतो दुवोया |||
verses.transliteration: yo rohitau vājinau vājinīvān tribhiḥ śataiḥ sacamānāv adiṣṭa yūne sam asmai kṣitayo namantāṃ śrutarathāya maruto duvoyā

translations.griffith: Maruts, let all the people in obeisance bow down before this youthful Srutaratha,  Who, rich in steeds, gave me two dark red horses together with three hundred head of cattle.

verses.sanskrit: सम भानुना यतते सूर्यस्याजुह्वानो घर्तप्र्ष्ठः सवञ्चाः तस्मा अम्र्ध्रा उषसो वय उछान य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्य आह |||
verses.transliteration: sam bhānunā yatate sūryasyājuhvāno ghṛtapṛṣṭhaḥ svañcāḥ tasmā amṛdhrā uṣaso vy uchān ya indrāya sunavāmety āha

translations.griffith: BEDEWED with holy oil and meetly worshipped, the Swift One vies with Sūrya's beam in splendour.  For him may mornings dawn without cessation who saith, Let us press Soma out for Indra.

verses.sanskrit: समिद्धाग्निर वनवत सतीर्णबर्हिर युक्तग्रावा सुतसोमो जराते गरावाणो यस्येषिरं वदन्त्य अयद अध्वर्युर हविषाव सिन्धुम |||
verses.transliteration: samiddhāghnir vanavat stīrṇabarhir yuktaghrāvā sutasomo jarāte ghrāvāṇo yasyeṣiraṃ vadanty ayad adhvaryur haviṣāva sindhum

translations.griffith: With kindled fire and strewn grass let him worship, and, Soma-presser, sing with stones adjusted:  And let the priest whose press-stones ring forth loudly, go down with his oblation to the river.

verses.sanskrit: वधूर इयम पतिम इछन्त्य एति य ईं वहाते महिषीम इषिराम आस्य शरवस्याद रथ आ च घोषात पुरू सहस्रा परि वर्तयाते |||
verses.transliteration: vadhūr iyam patim ichanty eti ya īṃ vahāte mahiṣīm iṣirām āsya śravasyād ratha ā ca ghoṣāt purū sahasrā pari vartayāte

translations.griffith: This wife is coming near who loves her husband who carries to his home a vigorous consort.  Here may his car seek fame, here loudly thunder, and his wheel make a thousand revolutions.

verses.sanskrit: न स राजा वयथते यस्मिन्न इन्द्रस तीव्रं सोमम पिबति गोसखायम आ सत्वनैर अजति हन्ति वर्त्रं कषेति कषितीः सुभगो नाम पुष्यन |||
verses.transliteration: na sa rājā vyathate yasminn indras tīvraṃ somam pibati ghosakhāyam ā satvanair ajati hanti vṛtraṃ kṣeti kṣitīḥ subhagho nāma puṣyan

translations.griffith: No troubles vex that King in whose home Indra drinks the sharp Soma juice with milk commingled.  With heroes he drives near, he slays the foeman: Blest, cherishing that name, he guards his people.

verses.sanskrit: पुष्यात कषेमे अभि योगे भवात्य उभे वर्तौ संयती सं जयाति परियः सूर्ये परियो अग्ना भवाति य इन्द्राय सुतसोमो ददाशत |||
verses.transliteration: puṣyāt kṣeme abhi yoghe bhavāty ubhe vṛtau saṃyatī saṃ jayāti priyaḥ sūrye priyo aghnā bhavāti ya indrāya sutasomo dadāśat

translations.griffith: May he support in peace and win in battle: he masters both the hosts that meet together.  Dear shall he be to Sūrya, dear to Agni, who with pressed Soma offers gifts to India.

verses.sanskrit: उरोष ट इन्द्र राधसो विभ्वी रातिः शतक्रतो अधा नो विश्वचर्षणे दयुम्ना सुक्षत्र मंहय |||
verses.transliteration: uroṣ ṭa indra rādhaso vibhvī rātiḥ śatakrato adhā no viśvacarṣaṇe dyumnā sukṣatra maṃhaya

translations.griffith: WIDE, Indra Śatakratu, spreads the bounty of thine ample grace:  So, Lord of fair dominion, Friend of all men, give us splendid wealth.

verses.sanskrit: यद ईम इन्द्र शरवाय्यम इषं शविष्ठ दधिषे पप्रथे दीर्घश्रुत्तमं हिरण्यवर्ण दुष्टरम |||
verses.transliteration: yad īm indra śravāyyam iṣaṃ śaviṣṭha dadhiṣe paprathe dīrghaśruttamaṃ hiraṇyavarṇa duṣṭaram

translations.griffith: The food which, Mightiest Indra, thou possessest worthy of renown  Is bruited as most widely famed, invincible, O Golden-hued!

verses.sanskrit: शुष्मासो ये ते अद्रिवो मेहना केतसापः उभा देवाव अभिष्टये दिवश च गमश च राजथः |||
verses.transliteration: śuṣmāso ye te adrivo mehanā ketasāpaḥ ubhā devāv abhiṣṭaye divaś ca ghmaś ca rājathaḥ

translations.griffith: O Darter of the Stone, the powers which readily obey thy will,—  Divinities, both thou and they, ye rule, to guard them, earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: उतो नो अस्य कस्य चिद दक्षस्य तव वर्त्रहन अस्मभ्यं नर्म्णम आ भरास्मभ्यं नर्मणस्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: uto no asya kasya cid dakṣasya tava vṛtrahan asmabhyaṃ nṛmṇam ā bharāsmabhyaṃ nṛmaṇasyase

translations.griffith: And from whatever power of thine, O Vṛtra-slayer, it may be,  Bring thou to us heroic strength: thou hast a man's regard for us.

verses.sanskrit: नू त आभिर अभिष्टिभिस तव शर्मञ छतक्रतो इन्द्र सयाम सुगोपाः शूर सयाम सुगोपाः |||
verses.transliteration: nū ta ābhir abhiṣṭibhis tava śarmañ chatakrato indra syāma sughopāḥ śūra syāma sughopāḥ

translations.griffith: In thy protection, with these aids of thine, O Lord of Hundred Powers,  Indra, may we be guarded well, Hero, may we be guarded well.

verses.sanskrit: यद इन्द्र चित्र मेहनास्ति तवादातम अद्रिवः राधस तन नो विदद्वस उभयाहस्त्य आ भर |||
verses.transliteration: yad indra citra mehanāsti tvādātam adrivaḥ rādhas tan no vidadvasa ubhayāhasty ā bhara

translations.griffith: STONE-DARTING Indra. Wondrous One, what wealth is richly given from thee,  That bounty, Treasure-Finder! bring filling both thy hands, to us.

verses.sanskrit: यन मन्यसे वरेण्यम इन्द्र दयुक्षं तद आ भर विद्याम तस्य ते वयम अकूपारस्य दावने |||
verses.transliteration: yan manyase vareṇyam indra dyukṣaṃ tad ā bhara vidyāma tasya te vayam akūpārasya dāvane

translations.griffith: Bring what thou deemest worth the wish, O Indra, that which is in heaven.  So may we know thee as thou art, boundless in thy munificence.

verses.sanskrit: यत ते दित्सु परराध्यम मनो अस्ति शरुतम बर्हत तेन दर्ळ्हा चिद अद्रिव आ वाजं दर्षि सातये |||
verses.transliteration: yat te ditsu prarādhyam mano asti śrutam bṛhat tena dṛḷhā cid adriva ā vājaṃ darṣi sātaye

translations.griffith: Thy lofty spirit, far-renowned as fain to give and prompt to win,—  With this thou rendest e’en the firm, Stone-Darter! so to gain thee strength.

verses.sanskrit: मंहिष्ठं वो मघोनां राजानं चर्षणीनाम इन्द्रम उप परशस्तये पूर्वीभिर जुजुषे गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: maṃhiṣṭhaṃ vo maghonāṃ rājānaṃ carṣaṇīnām indram upa praśastaye pūrvībhir jujuṣe ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: Singers with many songs have made Indra propitious to their fame,  Him who is King of human kind, most liberal of your wealthy ones.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा इत काव्यं वच उक्थम इन्द्राय शंस्यम तस्मा उ बरह्मवाहसे गिरो वर्धन्त्य अत्रयो गिरः शुम्भन्त्य अत्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: asmā it kāvyaṃ vaca uktham indrāya śaṃsyam tasmā u brahmavāhase ghiro vardhanty atrayo ghiraḥ śumbhanty atrayaḥ

translations.griffith: To him, to Indra must be sung the poet's word, the hymn of praise.  To him, accepter of the prayer, the Atris raise their songs on high, the Atris beautify their songs.

verses.sanskrit: आ याह्य अद्रिभिः सुतं सोमं सोमपते पिब वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāhy adribhiḥ sutaṃ somaṃ somapate piba vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama

translations.griffith: COME thou to what the stones have pressed, drink Soma, O thou Soma's Lord,  Indra best Vṛtra-slayer Strong One, with the Strong.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा गरावा वर्षा मदो वर्षा सोमो अयं सुतः वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā ghrāvā vṛṣā mado vṛṣā somo ayaṃ sutaḥ vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama

translations.griffith: Strong is the stone, the draught is strong, strong is this Soma that is pressed,  Indra, best Vṛtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

verses.sanskrit: वर्षा तवा वर्षणं हुवे वज्रिञ चित्राभिर ऊतिभिः वर्षन्न इन्द्र वर्षभिर वर्त्रहन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣā tvā vṛṣaṇaṃ huve vajriñ citrābhir ūtibhiḥ vṛṣann indra vṛṣabhir vṛtrahantama

translations.griffith: As strong I call on thee the Strong, O Thunder-armed, with various aids,  Indra, best Vṛtra-slayer, Strong One with the Strong.

verses.sanskrit: रजीषी वज्री वर्षभस तुराषाट छुष्मी राजा वर्त्रहा सोमपावा युक्त्वा हरिभ्याम उप यासद अर्वाङ माध्यंदिने सवने मत्सद इन्द्रः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛjīṣī vajrī vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ chuṣmī rājā vṛtrahā somapāvā yuktvā haribhyām upa yāsad arvāṅ mādhyaṃdine savane matsad indraḥ

translations.griffith: Impetuous, Thunderer, Strong, quelling the mighty, King, potent, Vṛtra-slayer, Soma-drinker,  May he come hither with his yoked Bay Horses; may Indra gladden him at the noon libation.

verses.sanskrit: यत तवा सूर्य सवर्भानुस तमसाविध्यद आसुरः अक्षेत्रविद यथा मुग्धो भुवनान्य अदीधयुः |||
verses.transliteration: yat tvā sūrya svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ akṣetravid yathā mughdho bhuvanāny adīdhayuḥ

translations.griffith: O Sūrya, when the Asura's descendant Svarbhanu, pierced thee through and through with darkness,  All creatures looked like one who is bewildered, who knoweth not the place where he is standing.

verses.sanskrit: सवर्भानोर अध यद इन्द्र माया अवो दिवो वर्तमाना अवाहन गूळ्हं सूर्यं तमसापव्रतेन तुरीयेण बरह्मणाविन्दद अत्रिः |||
verses.transliteration: svarbhānor adha yad indra māyā avo divo vartamānā avāhan ghūḷhaṃ sūryaṃ tamasāpavratena turīyeṇa brahmaṇāvindad atriḥ

translations.griffith: What time thou smotest down Svarbhanu's magic that spread itself beneath the sky, O Indra,  By his fourth sacred prayer Atri disoovered Sūrya concealed in gloom that stayed his function.

verses.sanskrit: मा माम इमं तव सन्तम अत्र इरस्या दरुग्धो भियसा नि गारीत तवम मित्रो असि सत्यराधास तौ मेहावतं वरुणश च राजा |||
verses.transliteration: mā mām imaṃ tava santam atra irasyā drughdho bhiyasā ni ghārīt tvam mitro asi satyarādhās tau mehāvataṃ varuṇaś ca rājā

translations.griffith: Let not the oppressor with this dread, through anger swallow me up, for I am thine, O Atri.  Mitra art thou, the sender of true blessings: thou and King Varuṇa be both my helpers.

verses.sanskrit: गराव्णो बरह्मा युयुजानः सपर्यन कीरिणा देवान नमसोपशिक्षन अत्रिः सूर्यस्य दिवि चक्षुर आधात सवर्भानोर अप माया अघुक्षत |||
verses.transliteration: ghrāvṇo brahmā yuyujānaḥ saparyan kīriṇā devān namasopaśikṣan atriḥ sūryasya divi cakṣur ādhāt svarbhānor apa māyā aghukṣat

translations.griffith: The Brahman Atri, as he set the press-stones, serving the Gods with praise and adoration,  Established in the heaven the eye of Sūrya, and caused Svarbhanu's magic arts to vanish.

verses.sanskrit: यं वै सूर्यं सवर्भानुस तमसाविध्यद आसुरः अत्रयस तम अन्व अविन्दन नह्य अन्ये अशक्नुवन |||
verses.transliteration: yaṃ vai sūryaṃ svarbhānus tamasāvidhyad āsuraḥ atrayas tam anv avindan nahy anye aśaknuvan

translations.griffith: The Atris found the Sun again, him whom Svarbhanu of the brood  Of Asuras had pierced with gloom. This none besides had power to do.

verses.sanskrit: को नु वाम मित्रावरुणाव रतायन दिवो वा महः पार्थिवस्य वा दे रतस्य वा सदसि तरासीथां नो यज्ञायते वा पशुषो न वाजान |||
verses.transliteration: ko nu vām mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāyan divo vā mahaḥ pārthivasya vā de ṛtasya vā sadasi trāsīthāṃ no yajñāyate vā paśuṣo na vājān

translations.griffith: WHO, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven?  Preserve us in the seat of holy Order, and give the offerer power that winneth cattle.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमायुर इन्द्र रभुक्षा मरुतो जुषन्त नमोभिर वा ये दधते सुव्र्क्तिं सतोमं रुद्राय मीळ्हुषे सजोषाः |||
verses.transliteration: te no mitro varuṇo aryamāyur indra ṛbhukṣā maruto juṣanta namobhir vā ye dadhate suvṛktiṃ stomaṃ rudrāya mīḷhuṣe sajoṣāḥ

translations.griffith: May Mitra, Varuṇa, Aryaman, and Āyu, Indra Ṛbhukṣan, and the Maruts, love us,  And they who of one mind with bounteous Rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां येष्ठाश्विना हुवध्यै वातस्य पत्मन रथ्यस्य पुष्टौ उत वा दिवो असुराय मन्म परान्धांसीव यज्यवे भरध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ yeṣṭhāśvinā huvadhyai vātasya patman rathyasya puṣṭau uta vā divo asurāya manma prāndhāṃsīva yajyave bharadhvam

translations.griffith: You will I call to feed the car-horse, Aśvins, with the wind's flight swiftest of those who travel:  Or also to the Asura of heaven, Worshipful, bring a hymn as ’twere libation.

verses.sanskrit: पर सक्षणो दिव्यः कण्वहोता तरितो दिवः सजोषा वातो अग्निः पूषा भगः परभ्र्थे विश्वभोजा आजिं न जग्मुर आश्वश्वतमाः |||
verses.transliteration: pra sakṣaṇo divyaḥ kaṇvahotā trito divaḥ sajoṣā vāto aghniḥ pūṣā bhaghaḥ prabhṛthe viśvabhojā ājiṃ na jaghmur āśvaśvatamāḥ

translations.griffith: The heavenly Victor, he whose priest is Kaṇva, Tṛta with Dyaus accordant, Vāta, Agni,  All-feeding Pūṣan, Bhaga sought the oblation, as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो रयिं युक्ताश्वम भरध्वं राय एषे ऽवसे दधीत धीः सुशेव एवैर औशिजस्य होता ये व एवा मरुतस तुराणाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo rayiṃ yuktāśvam bharadhvaṃ rāya eṣe 'vase dadhīta dhīḥ suśeva evair auśijasya hotā ye va evā marutas turāṇām

translations.griffith: Bring ye your riches forward borne on horses: let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure.  Blest he the priest of Auśija through courses, the courses which are yours the fleet, O Maruts.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो वायुं रथयुजं कर्णुध्वम पर देवं विप्रम पनितारम अर्कैः इषुध्यव रतसापः पुरंधीर वस्वीर नो अत्र पत्नीर आ धिये धुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujaṃ kṛṇudhvam pra devaṃ vipram panitāram arkaiḥ iṣudhyava ṛtasāpaḥ puraṃdhīr vasvīr no atra patnīr ā dhiye dhuḥ

translations.griffith: Bring hither him who yokes the car, your Vāyu, who praises with his songs, the God and Singer;  And, praying and devout, noble and prudent, may the Gods’ Spouses in their thoughts retain us.

verses.sanskrit: उप व एषे वन्द्येभिः शूषैः पर यह्वी दिवश चितयद्भिर अर्कैः उषासानक्ता विदुषीव विश्वम आ हा वहतो मर्त्याय यज्ञम |||
verses.transliteration: upa va eṣe vandyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ pra yahvī divaś citayadbhir arkaiḥ uṣāsānaktā viduṣīva viśvam ā hā vahato martyāya yajñam

translations.griffith: I speed to you with powers that should be honoured, with songs distinguishing Heaven's mighty Daughters,  Morning and Night, the Two, as ’twere all-knowing: these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal.

verses.sanskrit: अभि वो अर्चे पोष्यावतो नॄन वास्तोष पतिं तवष्टारं रराणः धन्या सजोषा धिषणा नमोभिर वनस्पतींर ओषधी राय एषे |||
verses.transliteration: abhi vo arce poṣyāvato nṝn vāstoṣ patiṃ tvaṣṭāraṃ rarāṇaḥ dhanyā sajoṣā dhiṣaṇā namobhir vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāya eṣe

translations.griffith: You I extol, the nourishers of heroes bringing you gifts, Vastospati and Tvaṣṭar-  Rich Dhiṣaṇā accords through our obeisance - andTrees and Plants, for the swift gain of riches.

verses.sanskrit: तुजे नस तने पर्वताः सन्तु सवैतवो ये वसवो न वीराः पनित आप्त्यो यजतः सदा नो वर्धान नः शंसं नर्यो अभिष्टौ |||
verses.transliteration: tuje nas tane parvatāḥ santu svaitavo ye vasavo na vīrāḥ panita āptyo yajataḥ sadā no vardhān naḥ śaṃsaṃ naryo abhiṣṭau

translations.griffith: Ours be the Parvatas, even they, for offspring, free-moving, who are Heroes like the Vasus.  May holy Āptya, Friend of man, exalted, strengthen our word for ever and be near us.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्णो अस्तोषि भूम्यस्य गर्भं तरितो नपातम अपां सुव्र्क्ति गर्णीते अग्निर एतरी न शूषैः शोचिष्केशो नि रिणाति वना |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṇo astoṣi bhūmyasya gharbhaṃ trito napātam apāṃ suvṛkti ghṛṇīte aghnir etarī na śūṣaiḥ śociṣkeśo ni riṇāti vanā

translations.griffith: Tṛta praised him, germ of the earthly hero, with pure songs him the Offspring of the Waters.  Agn; with might neighs loudly like a charger: he of the flaming hair destroys the forests.

verses.sanskrit: कथा महे रुद्रियाय बरवाम कद राये चिकितुषे भगाय आप ओषधीर उत नो ऽवन्तु दयौर वना गिरयो वर्क्षकेशाः |||
verses.transliteration: kathā mahe rudriyāya bravāma kad rāye cikituṣe bhaghāya āpa oṣadhīr uta no 'vantu dyaur vanā ghirayo vṛkṣakeśāḥ

translations.griffith: How shall we speak to the great might of Rudra? How speak to Bhaga who takes thought for riches?  May Plants, the Waters, and the Sky preserve us, and Woods and Mountains with their trees for tresses.

verses.sanskrit: शर्णोतु न ऊर्जाम पतिर गिरः स नभस तरीयां इषिरः परिज्मा शर्ण्वन्त्व आपः पुरो न शुभ्राः परि सरुचो बब्र्हाणस्याद्रेः |||
verses.transliteration: śṛṇotu na ūrjām patir ghiraḥ sa nabhas tarīyāṃ iṣiraḥ parijmā śṛṇvantv āpaḥ puro na śubhrāḥ pari sruco babṛhāṇasyādreḥ

translations.griffith: May the swift Wanderer, Lord of refreshments listen to our songs, who speeds throuih cloudy heaven:  And may the Waters, bright like castles, hear us, as they flow onward from the cloven mountain.

verses.sanskrit: विदा चिन नु महान्तो ये व एवा बरवाम दस्मा वार्यं दधानाः वयश चन सुभ्व आव यन्ति कषुभा मर्तम अनुयतं वधस्नैः |||
verses.transliteration: vidā cin nu mahānto ye va evā bravāma dasmā vāryaṃ dadhānāḥ vayaś cana subhva āva yanti kṣubhā martam anuyataṃ vadhasnaiḥ

translations.griffith: We know your ways, ye Mighty Ones receiving choice meed, ye Wonderful, we will proclaim it.  Even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons.

verses.sanskrit: आ दैव्यानि पार्थिवानि जन्मापश चाछा सुमखाय वोचम वर्धन्तां दयावो गिरश चन्द्राग्रा उदा वर्धन्ताम अभिषाता अर्णाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā daivyāni pārthivāni janmāpaś cāchā sumakhāya vocam vardhantāṃ dyāvo ghiraś candrāghrā udā vardhantām abhiṣātā arṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Celestial and terrestrial generations, and Waters will I summon to the feasting.  May days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper, and may the conquered streams increase their waters.

verses.sanskrit: पदे-पदे मे जरिमा नि धायि वरूत्री वा शक्रा या पायुभिश च सिषक्तु माता मही रसा नः समत सूरिभिर रजुहस्त रजुवनिः |||
verses.transliteration: pade-pade me jarimā ni dhāyi varūtrī vā śakrā yā pāyubhiś ca siṣaktu mātā mahī rasā naḥ smat sūribhir ṛjuhasta ṛjuvaniḥ

translations.griffith: Duly to each one hath my laud been offered. Strong be Varūtrī with her powers to succour.  May the great Mother Rasā here befriend us, straight-handed, with the princes, striving forward.

verses.sanskrit: कथा दाशेम नमसा सुदानून एवया मरुतो अछोक्तौ परश्रवसो मरुतो अछोक्तौ मा नो ऽहिर बुध्न्यो रिषे धाद अस्माकम भूद उपमातिवनिः |||
verses.transliteration: kathā dāśema namasā sudānūn evayā maruto achoktau praśravaso maruto achoktau mā no 'hir budhnyo riṣe dhād asmākam bhūd upamātivaniḥ

translations.griffith: How may we serve the Liberal Ones with worship, the Maruts swift of course in invocation, the Maruts far-renowned in invocation?  Let not the Dragon of the Deep annoy us, and gladly may he welcome our addresses.

verses.sanskrit: इति चिन नु परजायै पशुमत्यै देवासो वनते मर्त्यो व आ देवासो वनते मर्त्यो वः अत्रा शिवां तन्वो धासिम अस्या जरां चिन मे निर्र्तिर जग्रसीत |||
verses.transliteration: iti cin nu prajāyai paśumatyai devāso vanate martyo va ā devāso vanate martyo vaḥ atrā śivāṃ tanvo dhāsim asyā jarāṃ cin me nirṛtir jaghrasīta

translations.griffith: Thus thinking, O ye Gods, the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle: the mortal wins him, O ye Gods, your favour.  Here he wins wholesome food to feed this body: as for mine old age, Nirrti consume it

verses.sanskrit: तां वो देवाः सुमतिम ऊर्जयन्तीम इषम अश्याम वसवः शसा गोः सा नः सुदानुर मर्ळयन्ती देवी परति दरवन्ती सुविताय गम्याः |||
verses.transliteration: tāṃ vo devāḥ sumatim ūrjayantīm iṣam aśyāma vasavaḥ śasā ghoḥ sā naḥ sudānur mṛḷayantī devī prati dravantī suvitāya ghamyāḥ

translations.griffith: O Gods, may we obtain from you this favour, strengthening food through the Cow's praise, ye Vasus.  May she who gives good gifts, the gracious Goddes. s, come speeding nigh to us for our well-being.

verses.sanskrit: अभि न इळा यूथस्य माता समन नदीभिर उर्वशी वा गर्णातु उर्वशी वा बर्हद्दिवा गर्णानाभ्यूर्ण्वाना परभ्र्थस्यायोः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi na iḷā yūthasya mātā sman nadībhir urvaśī vā ghṛṇātu urvaśī vā bṛhaddivā ghṛṇānābhyūrṇvānā prabhṛthasyāyoḥ

translations.griffith: May Iḷā, Mother of the herds of cattle, and Urvasi with all the streams accept us;  May Urvasi in lofty heaven accepting, as she partakes the oblation of the living,

verses.sanskrit: सिषक्तु न ऊर्जव्यस्य पुष्टेः ||
verses.transliteration: siṣaktu na ūrjavyasya puṣṭeḥ

translations.griffith: Visit us while she shares Urjavya's food.

verses.sanskrit: पर शंतमा वरुणं दीधिती गीर मित्रम भगम अदितिं नूनम अश्याः पर्षद्योनिः पञ्चहोता शर्णोत्व अतूर्तपन्था असुरो मयोभुः |||
verses.transliteration: pra śaṃtamā varuṇaṃ dīdhitī ghīr mitram bhagham aditiṃ nūnam aśyāḥ pṛṣadyoniḥ pañcahotā śṛṇotv atūrtapanthā asuro mayobhuḥ

translations.griffith: Now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach Varuṇa, Mitra, Aditi, and Bhaga.  May the Five Priests' Lord, dwelling in oblations, bliss-giving Asura, hear, whose paths are open.

verses.sanskrit: परति मे सतोमम अदितिर जग्र्भ्यात सूनुं न माता हर्द्यं सुशेवम बरह्म परियं देवहितं यद अस्त्य अहम मित्रे वरुणे यन मयोभु |||
verses.transliteration: prati me stomam aditir jaghṛbhyāt sūnuṃ na mātā hṛdyaṃ suśevam brahma priyaṃ devahitaṃ yad asty aham mitre varuṇe yan mayobhu

translations.griffith: May Aditi welcome, even as a mother her dear heart-gladdening son, my song that lauds her.  The prayer they love, bliss-giving, God-appointed, I offer unto Varuṇa and Mitra.

verses.sanskrit: उद ईरय कवितमं कवीनाम उनत्तैनम अभि मध्वा घर्तेन स नो वसूनि परयता हितानि चन्द्राणि देवः सविता सुवाति |||
verses.transliteration: ud īraya kavitamaṃ kavīnām unattainam abhi madhvā ghṛtena sa no vasūni prayatā hitāni candrāṇi devaḥ savitā suvāti

translations.griffith: In spirit him, the Sagest of the Sages; with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him  So then let him, God Savitar, provide us excellent, ready, and resplendent treasures.

verses.sanskrit: सम इन्द्र णो मनसा नेषि गोभिः सं सूरिभिर हरिवः सं सवस्ति सम बरह्मणा देवहितं यद अस्ति सं देवानां सुमत्या यज्ञियानाम |||
verses.transliteration: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi ghobhiḥ saṃ sūribhir harivaḥ saṃ svasti sam brahmaṇā devahitaṃ yad asti saṃ devānāṃ sumatyā yajñiyānām

translations.griffith: With willing mind, Indra, vouchsafe us cattle, prosperity, Lord of Bays! and pious patrons;  And, with the sacred prayer by Gods appointed, give us the holy Deities' lovingkindness.

verses.sanskrit: देवो भगः सविता रायो अंश इन्द्रो वर्त्रस्य संजितो धनानाम रभुक्षा वाज उत वा पुरंधिर अवन्तु नो अम्र्तासस तुरासः |||
verses.transliteration: devo bhaghaḥ savitā rāyo aṃśa indro vṛtrasya saṃjito dhanānām ṛbhukṣā vāja uta vā puraṃdhir avantu no amṛtāsas turāsaḥ

translations.griffith: God Bhaga, Savitar who deals forth riches, Indra, and they who conquer Vṛtra's treasures,  And Vāja and Ṛbhukṣan and Purandhi, the Mighty and Immortal Ones, protect us!

verses.sanskrit: मरुत्वतो अप्रतीतस्य जिष्णोर अजूर्यतः पर बरवामा कर्तानि न ते पूर्वे मघवन नापरासो न वीर्यं नूतनः कश चनाप |||
verses.transliteration: marutvato apratītasya jiṣṇor ajūryataḥ pra bravāmā kṛtāni na te pūrve maghavan nāparāso na vīryaṃ nūtanaḥ kaś canāpa

translations.griffith: Let us declare his deeds, the undecaying unrivalled Victor whom the Maruts follow.  None of old times, O Maghavan, nor later, none of these days hath reached thy hero prowess.

verses.sanskrit: उप सतुहि परथमं रत्नधेयम बर्हस्पतिं सनितारं धनानाम यः शंसते सतुवते शम्भविष्ठः पुरूवसुर आगमज जोहुवानम |||
verses.transliteration: upa stuhi prathamaṃ ratnadheyam bṛhaspatiṃ sanitāraṃ dhanānām yaḥ śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhaḥ purūvasur āghamaj johuvānam

translations.griffith: Praise him the Chief who gives the boon of riches, Bṛhaspati distributor of treasures,  Who, blessing most the man who sings and praises, comes with abundant wealth to his invoker.

verses.sanskrit: तवोतिभिः सचमाना अरिष्टा बर्हस्पते मघवानः सुवीराः ये अश्वदा उत वा सन्ति गोदा ये वस्त्रदाः सुभगास तेषु रायः |||
verses.transliteration: tavotibhiḥ sacamānā ariṣṭā bṛhaspate maghavānaḥ suvīrāḥ ye aśvadā uta vā santi ghodā ye vastradāḥ subhaghās teṣu rāyaḥ

translations.griffith: Tended, Bṛhaspati, with thy protections, the princes are unharmed and girt by heroes.  Wealth that brings bliss is found among the givers of horses and of cattle and of raiment.

verses.sanskrit: विसर्माणं कर्णुहि वित्तम एषां ये भुञ्जते अप्र्णन्तो न उक्थैः अपव्रतान परसवे वाव्र्धानान बरह्मद्विषः सूर्याद यावयस्व |||
verses.transliteration: visarmāṇaṃ kṛṇuhi vittam eṣāṃ ye bhuñjate apṛṇanto na ukthaiḥ apavratān prasave vāvṛdhānān brahmadviṣaḥ sūryād yāvayasva

translations.griffith: Make their wealth flee who, through our hymns enjoying their riches, yield us not an ample guerdon.  Far from the sun keep those who hate devotion, the godless, prospering in their vocation.

verses.sanskrit: य ओहते रक्षसो देववीताव अचक्रेभिस तम मरुतो नि यात यो वः शमीं शशमानस्य निन्दात तुछ्यान कामान करते सिष्विदानः |||
verses.transliteration: ya ohate rakṣaso devavītāv acakrebhis tam maruto ni yāta yo vaḥ śamīṃ śaśamānasya nindāt tuchyān kāmān karate siṣvidānaḥ

translations.griffith: With wheelless chariots drive down him, O Maruts, who at the feasts of Gods regards the demons.  May he, though bathed in sweat, form empty wishes, who blames his sacred rite who toils to serve you.

verses.sanskrit: तम उ षटुहि यः सविषुः सुधन्वा यो विश्वस्य कषयति भेषजस्य यक्ष्वा महे सौमनसाय रुद्रं नमोभिर देवम असुरं दुवस्य |||
verses.transliteration: tam u ṣṭuhi yaḥ sviṣuḥ sudhanvā yo viśvasya kṣayati bheṣajasya yakṣvā mahe saumanasāya rudraṃ namobhir devam asuraṃ duvasya

translations.griffith: Praise him whose bow is strong and sure his arrow, him who is Lord of every balm that bealeth.  Worship thou Rudra for his great good favour: adore the Asura, God, with salutations.

verses.sanskrit: दमूनसो अपसो ये सुहस्ता वर्ष्णः पत्नीर नद्यो विभ्वतष्टाः सरस्वती बर्हद्दिवोत राका दशस्यन्तीर वरिवस्यन्तु शुभ्राः |||
verses.transliteration: damūnaso apaso ye suhastā vṛṣṇaḥ patnīr nadyo vibhvataṣṭāḥ sarasvatī bṛhaddivota rākā daśasyantīr varivasyantu śubhrāḥ

translations.griffith: May the House-friends, the cunning-handed Artists, may the Steer's Wives, the streams carved out by Vibhvan,  And may the fair Ones honour and befriend us, Sarasvatī, Brhaddiva, and Rākā.

verses.sanskrit: पर सू महे सुशरणाय मेधां गिरम भरे नव्यसीं जायमानाम य आहना दुहितुर वक्षणासु रूपा मिनानो अक्र्णोद इदं नः |||
verses.transliteration: pra sū mahe suśaraṇāya medhāṃ ghiram bhare navyasīṃ jāyamānām ya āhanā duhitur vakṣaṇāsu rūpā mināno akṛṇod idaṃ naḥ

translations.griffith: My newest song, thought that now springs within me, I offer to the Great, the Sure Protector,  Who made for us this All, in fond love laying each varied form within his Daughter's bosom.

verses.sanskrit: पर सुष्टुति सतनयन्तं रुवन्तम इळस पतिं जरितर नूनम अश्याः यो अब्दिमां उदनिमां इयर्ति पर विद्युता रोदसी उक्षमाणः |||
verses.transliteration: pra suṣṭuti stanayantaṃ ruvantam iḷas patiṃ jaritar nūnam aśyāḥ yo abdimāṃ udanimāṃ iyarti pra vidyutā rodasī ukṣamāṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Now, even now, may thy fair praise, O Singer, attain Idaspati who roars and thunders,  Who, rich in clouds and waters with his lightning speeds forth bedewing both the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit: एष सतोमो मारुतं शर्धो अछा रुद्रस्य सूनूंर युवन्यूंर उद अश्याः कामो राये हवते मा सवस्त्य उप सतुहि पर्षदश्वां अयासः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa stomo mārutaṃ śardho achā rudrasya sūnūṃr yuvanyūṃr ud aśyāḥ kāmo rāye havate mā svasty upa stuhi pṛṣadaśvāṃ ayāsaḥ

translations.griffith: May this my laud attain the troop of Maruts, those who are youths in act, the Sons of Rudra.  The wish calls me to riches and well-being: praise the unwearied Ones whose steeds are dappled.

verses.sanskrit: परैष सतोमः पर्थिवीम अन्तरिक्षं वनस्पतींर ओषधी राये अश्याः देवो-देवः सुहवो भूतु मह्यम मा नो माता पर्थिवी दुर्मतौ धात |||
verses.transliteration: praiṣa stomaḥ pṛthivīm antarikṣaṃ vanaspatīṃr oṣadhī rāye aśyāḥ devo-devaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt

translations.griffith: May this my laud reach earth and air's mid-region, and forest trees and plants to win me riches.  May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

verses.sanskrit: उरौ देवा अनिबाधे सयाम सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि || ||
verses.transliteration: urau devā anibādhe syāma sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni

translations.griffith: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

verses.sanskrit: आ धेनवः पयसा तूर्ण्यर्था अमर्धन्तीर उप नो यन्तु मध्वा महो राये बर्हतीः सप्त विप्रो मयोभुवो जरिता जोहवीति |||
verses.transliteration: ā dhenavaḥ payasā tūrṇyarthā amardhantīr upa no yantu madhvā maho rāye bṛhatīḥ sapta vipro mayobhuvo jaritā johavīti

translations.griffith: MAY the Milch-cows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness.  The Singer, lauding, calls, for ample riches, the Seven Mighty Ones who bring enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit: आ सुष्टुती नमसा वर्तयध्यै दयावा वाजाय पर्थिवी अम्र्ध्रे पिता माता मधुवचाः सुहस्ता भरे-भरे नो यशसाव अविष्टाम |||
verses.transliteration: ā suṣṭutī namasā vartayadhyai dyāvā vājāya pṛthivī amṛdhre pitā mātā madhuvacāḥ suhastā bhare-bhare no yaśasāv aviṣṭām

translations.griffith: With reverence and fair praise will I bring hither, for sake of strength, exhaustless Earth and Heaven.  Father and Mother, sweetof speech, fairhanded, may they, far-famed, in every fight protect us.

verses.sanskrit: अध्वर्यवश चक्र्वांसो मधूनि पर वायवे भरत चारु शुक्रम होतेव नः परथमः पाह्य अस्य देव मध्वो ररिमा ते मदाय |||
verses.transliteration: adhvaryavaś cakṛvāṃso madhūni pra vāyave bharata cāru śukram hoteva naḥ prathamaḥ pāhy asya deva madhvo rarimā te madāya

translations.griffith: Adhvaryus, make the sweet libations ready, and bring the beautiful bright juice to Vāyu.  God, as our Priest, be thou the first to drink it: we give thee of the mead to make thee joyful.

verses.sanskrit: दश कषिपो युञ्जते बाहू अद्रिं सोमस्य या शमितारा सुहस्ता मध्वो रसं सुगभस्तिर गिरिष्ठां चनिश्चदद दुदुहे शुक्रम अंशुः |||
verses.transliteration: daśa kṣipo yuñjate bāhū adriṃ somasya yā śamitārā suhastā madhvo rasaṃ sughabhastir ghiriṣṭhāṃ caniścadad duduhe śukram aṃśuḥ

translations.griffith: Two arms-the Soma's dexterous immo. lators-and the ten fingers set and fix the press-stone.  The stalk hath poured, fair with its spreading branches, the mead's bright glittering juice that dwells on mountains.

verses.sanskrit: असावि ते जुजुषाणाय सोमः करत्वे दक्षाय बर्हते मदाय हरी रथे सुधुरा योगे अर्वाग इन्द्र परिया कर्णुहि हूयमानः |||
verses.transliteration: asāvi te jujuṣāṇāya somaḥ kratve dakṣāya bṛhate madāya harī rathe sudhurā yoghe arvāgh indra priyā kṛṇuhi hūyamānaḥ

translations.griffith: The Soma hath been pressed for thee, its lover, to give thee power and might and high enjoyment.  Invoked, turn hither in thy car, O Indra, at need, thy two well-trained and dear Bay Horses.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो महीम अरमतिं सजोषा गनां देवीं नमसा रातहव्याम मधोर मदाय बर्हतीम रतज्ञाम आग्ने वह पथिभिर देवयानैः |||
verses.transliteration: ā no mahīm aramatiṃ sajoṣā ghnāṃ devīṃ namasā rātahavyām madhor madāya bṛhatīm ṛtajñām āghne vaha pathibhir devayānaiḥ

translations.griffith: Bring by God-traversed paths, accordant, Agni, the great Aramati, Celestial Lady,  Exalted, worshipped with our gifts and homage, who knoweth holy Law, to drink sweet Soma.

verses.sanskrit: अञ्जन्ति यम परथयन्तो न विप्रा वपावन्तं नाग्निना तपन्तः पितुर न पुत्र उपसि परेष्ठ आ घर्मो अग्निम रतयन्न असादि |||
verses.transliteration: añjanti yam prathayanto na viprā vapāvantaṃ nāghninā tapantaḥ pitur na putra upasi preṣṭha ā gharmo aghnim ṛtayann asādi

translations.griffith: As on his father's lap the son, the darling, so on the fire is set the sacred caldron,  Which holy singers deck, as if extending and heating that which holds the fatty membrane.

verses.sanskrit: अछा मही बर्हती शंतमा गीर दूतो न गन्त्व अश्विना हुवध्यै मयोभुवा सरथा यातम अर्वाग गन्तं निधिं धुरम आणिर न नाभिम |||
verses.transliteration: achā mahī bṛhatī śaṃtamā ghīr dūto na ghantv aśvinā huvadhyai mayobhuvā sarathā yātam arvāgh ghantaṃ nidhiṃ dhuram āṇir na nābhim

translations.griffith: Hither, as herald to invite the Aśvins, come the great lofty song, most sweet and pleasant!  Come in one car, joy-givers! to the banquet, like the bolt binding pole and nave, come hither.

verses.sanskrit: पर तव्यसो नमक्तिं तुरस्याहम पूष्ण उत वायोर अदिक्षि या राधसा चोदितारा मतीनां या वाजस्य दरविणोदा उत तमन |||
verses.transliteration: pra tavyaso namaktiṃ turasyāham pūṣṇa uta vāyor adikṣi yā rādhasā coditārā matīnāṃ yā vājasya draviṇodā uta tman

translations.griffith: I have declared this speech of adoration to mightiest Pūṣan and victorious Vāyu,  Who by their bounty are the hymns' inspirers, and of themselves give power as a possession.

verses.sanskrit: आ नामभिर मरुतो वक्षि विश्वान आ रूपेभिर जातवेदो हुवानः यज्ञं गिरो जरितुः सुष्टुतिं च विश्वे गन्त मरुतो विश्व ऊती |||
verses.transliteration: ā nāmabhir maruto vakṣi viśvān ā rūpebhir jātavedo huvānaḥ yajñaṃ ghiro jarituḥ suṣṭutiṃ ca viśve ghanta maruto viśva ūtī

translations.griffith: Invoked by us bring hither, jatavedas the Maruts all under their names and figures.  Come to the sacrifice with aid all Maruts, all to the songs and praises of the singer!

verses.sanskrit: आ नो दिवो बर्हतः पर्वताद आ सरस्वती यजता गन्तु यज्ञम हवं देवी जुजुषाणा घर्ताची शग्मां नो वाचम उशती शर्णोतु |||
verses.transliteration: ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ā sarasvatī yajatā ghantu yajñam havaṃ devī jujuṣāṇā ghṛtācī śaghmāṃ no vācam uśatī śṛṇotu

translations.griffith: From high heaven may Sarasvatī the Holy visit our sacrifice, and from the mountain.  Eager, propitious, may the balmy Goddess hear our effectual speech, our invocation.

verses.sanskrit: आ वेधसं नीलप्र्ष्ठम बर्हन्तम बर्हस्पतिं सदने सादयध्वम सादद्योनिं दम आ दीदिवांसं हिरण्यवर्णम अरुषं सपेम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vedhasaṃ nīlapṛṣṭham bṛhantam bṛhaspatiṃ sadane sādayadhvam sādadyoniṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsaṃ hiraṇyavarṇam aruṣaṃ sapema

translations.griffith: Set in his seat the God whose back is dusky, Bṛhaspati the lofty, the Disposer.  Him let us worship, set within the dwelling, the red, the golden-hued, the allresplendent.

verses.sanskrit: आ धर्णसिर बर्हद्दिवो रराणो विश्वेभिर गन्त्व ओमभिर हुवानः गना वसान ओषधीर अम्र्ध्रस तरिधातुश्र्ङगो वर्षभो वयोधाः |||
verses.transliteration: ā dharṇasir bṛhaddivo rarāṇo viśvebhir ghantv omabhir huvānaḥ ghnā vasāna oṣadhīr amṛdhras tridhātuśṛṅgho vṛṣabho vayodhāḥ

translations.griffith: May the Sustainer, high in heaven, come hither, the Bounteous One, invoked, with all his favours,  Dweller with Dames divine, with plants, unwearied, the Steer with triple horn, the life-bestower.

verses.sanskrit: मातुष पदे परमे शुक्र आयोर विपन्यवो रास्पिरासो अग्मन सुशेव्यं नमसा रातहव्याः शिशुम मर्जन्त्य आयवो न वासे |||
verses.transliteration: mātuṣ pade parame śukra āyor vipanyavo rāspirāso aghman suśevyaṃ namasā rātahavyāḥ śiśum mṛjanty āyavo na vāse

translations.griffith: The tuneful eloquent priests of him who liveth have sought the Mother's bright and loftiest station.  As living men, with offered gifts and homage they deck the most auspicious Child to clothe him.

verses.sanskrit: बर्हद वयो बर्हते तुभ्यम अग्ने धियाजुरो मिथुनासः सचन्त देवो-देवः सुहवो भूतु मह्यम मा नो माता पर्थिवी दुर्मतौ धात |||
verses.transliteration: bṛhad vayo bṛhate tubhyam aghne dhiyājuro mithunāsaḥ sacanta devo-devaḥ suhavo bhūtu mahyam mā no mātā pṛthivī durmatau dhāt

translations.griffith: Agni, great vital power is thine, the mighty: pairs waxing old in their devotion seek thee.  May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

verses.sanskrit: उरौ देवा अनिबाधे सयाम सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि || ||
verses.transliteration: urau devā anibādhe syāma sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni

translations.griffith: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

verses.sanskrit: तम परत्नथा पूर्वथा विश्वथेमथा जयेष्ठतातिम बर्हिषदं सवर्विदम परतीचीनं वर्जनं दोहसे गिराशुं जयन्तम अनु यासु वर्धसे |||
verses.transliteration: tam pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathemathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadaṃ svarvidam pratīcīnaṃ vṛjanaṃ dohase ghirāśuṃ jayantam anu yāsu vardhase

translations.griffith: As in the first old times, as all were wont, as now, he draweth forth the power turned hitherward with song,  The Princedom throned on holy grass, who findeth light, swift, conquering in the' plants wherein he waxeth strong.

verses.sanskrit: शरिये सुद्र्शीर उपरस्य याः सवर विरोचमानः ककुभाम अचोदते सुगोपा असि न दभाय सुक्रतो परो मायाभिर रत आस नाम ते |||
verses.transliteration: śriye sudṛśīr uparasya yāḥ svar virocamānaḥ kakubhām acodate sughopā asi na dabhāya sukrato paro māyābhir ṛta āsa nāma te

translations.griffith: Shining to him who leaves heaven's regions undisturbed, which to his sheen who is beneath show fair in light,  Good guardian art thou, not to be deceived, Most Wise! Far from deceits thy name dwelleth in holy Law.
