verses.sanskrit: अत्यं हविः सचते सच च धातु चारिष्टगातुः स होता सहोभरिः परसर्स्राणो अनु बर्हिर वर्षा शिशुर मध्ये युवाजरो विस्रुहा हितः |||
verses.transliteration: atyaṃ haviḥ sacate sac ca dhātu cāriṣṭaghātuḥ sa hotā sahobhariḥ prasarsrāṇo anu barhir vṛṣā śiśur madhye yuvājaro visruhā hitaḥ

translations.griffith: Truth waits upon oblation present and to come: naught checks him in his way, this vic tory- bringing Priest:  The Mighty Child who glides along the sacred grass, the undecaying Youth set in the midst of plants.

verses.sanskrit: पर व एते सुयुजो यामन्न इष्टये नीचीर अमुष्मै यम्य रताव्र्धः सुयन्तुभिः सर्वशासैर अभीशुभिः करिविर नामानि परवणे मुषायति |||
verses.transliteration: pra va ete suyujo yāmann iṣṭaye nīcīr amuṣmai yamya ṛtāvṛdhaḥ suyantubhiḥ sarvaśāsair abhīśubhiḥ krivir nāmāni pravaṇe muṣāyati

translations.griffith: These come, well-yoked, to you for furtherance in the rite: down come the twinborn strengtheners of Law for him,  With reins easily guided and commanding all. In the deep fall the hide stealeth away their names.

verses.sanskrit: संजर्भुराणस तरुभिः सुतेग्र्भं वयाकिनं चित्तगर्भासु सुस्वरुः धारवाकेष्व रजुगाथ शोभसे वर्धस्व पत्नीर अभि जीवो अध्वरे |||
verses.transliteration: saṃjarbhurāṇas tarubhiḥ suteghṛbhaṃ vayākinaṃ cittagharbhāsu susvaruḥ dhāravākeṣv ṛjughātha śobhase vardhasva patnīr abhi jīvo adhvare

translations.griffith: Thou, moving beauteously in visibly pregnant ones, snatching with trees the branching plant that grasps the juice,  Shinest, true Singer! mid the upholders of the voice. Increase thy Consorts thou, lively at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: याद्र्ग एव दद्र्शे ताद्र्ग उच्यते सं छायया दधिरे सिध्रयाप्स्व आ महीम अस्मभ्यम उरुषाम उरु जरयो बर्हत सुवीरम अनपच्युतं सहः |||
verses.transliteration: yādṛgh eva dadṛśe tādṛgh ucyate saṃ chāyayā dadhire sidhrayāpsv ā mahīm asmabhyam uruṣām uru jrayo bṛhat suvīram anapacyutaṃ sahaḥ

translations.griffith: Like as he is beheld such is he said to be.  They with effectual splendour in the floods have made  Earth yield us room enough and amply wide extent, great might invincible, with store of hero sons.

verses.sanskrit: वेत्य अग्रुर जनिवान वा अति सप्र्धः समर्यता मनसा सूर्यः कविः घरंसं रक्षन्तम परि विश्वतो गयम अस्माकं शर्म वनवत सवावसुः |||
verses.transliteration: vety aghrur janivān vā ati spṛdhaḥ samaryatā manasā sūryaḥ kaviḥ ghraṃsaṃ rakṣantam pari viśvato ghayam asmākaṃ śarma vanavat svāvasuḥ

translations.griffith: Sūrya the Sage, as if unwedded, with a Spouse, in battle-loving spirit moveth o’er the foes.  May he, self-excellent, grant us a sheltering home, a house that wards the fierce heat off on every side.

verses.sanskrit: जयायांसम अस्य यतुनस्य केतुन रषिस्वरं चरति यासु नाम ते याद्र्श्मिन धायि तम अपस्यया विदद य उ सवयं वहते सो अरं करत |||
verses.transliteration: jyāyāṃsam asya yatunasya ketuna ṛṣisvaraṃ carati yāsu nāma te yādṛśmin dhāyi tam apasyayā vidad ya u svayaṃ vahate so araṃ karat

translations.griffith: Thy name, sung forth by Ṛṣis in these hymns of ours, goes to the loftier One with this swift mover's light.  By skill he wins the boon whereon his heart is set: he who bestirs himself shall bring the thing to pass.

verses.sanskrit: समुद्रम आसाम अव तस्थे अग्रिमा न रिष्यति सवनं यस्मिन्न आयता अत्रा न हार्दि करवणस्य रेजते यत्रा मतिर विद्यते पूतबन्धनी |||
verses.transliteration: samudram āsām ava tasthe aghrimā na riṣyati savanaṃ yasminn āyatā atrā na hārdi kravaṇasya rejate yatrā matir vidyate pūtabandhanī

translations.griffith: The chief and best of these abideth in the sea, nor doth libation fail wherein it is prolonged.  The heart of him who praiseth trembleth not in fear there where the hymn is found connected with the pure.

verses.sanskrit: स हि कषत्रस्य मनसस्य चित्तिभिर एवावदस्य यजतस्य सध्रेः अवत्सारस्य सप्र्णवाम रण्वभिः शविष्ठं वाजं विदुषा चिद अर्ध्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi kṣatrasya manasasya cittibhir evāvadasya yajatasya sadhreḥ avatsārasya spṛṇavāma raṇvabhiḥ śaviṣṭhaṃ vājaṃ viduṣā cid ardhyam

translations.griffith: For it is he: with though to of Ksatra, Manasa, of Yajata, and Sadhri, and Evavada,  With Avatsara's sweet songs will we strive to win the mightiest strength which even he who knows should gain.

verses.sanskrit: शयेन आसाम अदितिः कक्ष्यो मदो विश्ववारस्य यजतस्य मायिनः सम अन्यम-अन्यम अर्थयन्त्य एतवे विदुर विषाणम परिपानम अन्ति ते |||
verses.transliteration: śyena āsām aditiḥ kakṣyo mado viśvavārasya yajatasya māyinaḥ sam anyam-anyam arthayanty etave vidur viṣāṇam paripānam anti te

translations.griffith: The Hawk is their full source, girth-stretching rapturous drink of Visvavara, of Mayin, and Yajata.  They ever seek a fresh draught so that they may come, know when thy time to halt and drink thy fill is near.

verses.sanskrit: सदाप्र्णो यजतो वि दविषो वधीद बाहुव्र्क्तः शरुतवित तर्यो वः सचा उभा स वरा परत्य एति भाति च यद ईं गणम भजते सुप्रयावभिः |||
verses.transliteration: sadāpṛṇo yajato vi dviṣo vadhīd bāhuvṛktaḥ śrutavit taryo vaḥ sacā ubhā sa varā praty eti bhāti ca yad īṃ ghaṇam bhajate suprayāvabhiḥ

translations.griffith: Sadaprna the holy, Tarya, Srutavit, and Bahuvrkta, joined with you, have slain the foes.  He gains his wish in both the worlds and brightly shines-when he adores the host with well-advancing steeds.

verses.sanskrit: सुतम्भरो यजमानस्य सत्पतिर विश्वासाम ऊधः स धियाम उदञ्चनः भरद धेनू रसवच छिश्रिये पयो ऽनुब्रुवाणो अध्य एति न सवपन |||
verses.transliteration: sutambharo yajamānasya satpatir viśvāsām ūdhaḥ sa dhiyām udañcanaḥ bharad dhenū rasavac chiśriye payo 'nubruvāṇo adhy eti na svapan

translations.griffith: The worshipper's defender is Sutambhara, producer and uplifter of all holy thoughts.  The milch-cow brought, sweet-flavoured milk was dealt around. Who speaks the bidding text knows this, not he who sleeps.

verses.sanskrit: यो जागार तम रचः कामयन्ते यो जागार तम उ सामानि यन्ति यो जागार तम अयं सोम आह तवाहम अस्मि सख्ये नयोकाः |||
verses.transliteration: yo jāghāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante yo jāghāra tam u sāmāni yanti yo jāghāra tam ayaṃ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ

translations.griffith: The sacred hymns love him who wakes and watches: to him who watches come the Sāma verses.  This Soma saith unto the man who watches, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निर जागार तम रचः कामयन्ते ऽगनिर जागार तम उ सामानि यन्ति अग्निर जागार तम अयं सोम आह तवाहम अस्मि सख्ये नयोकाः |||
verses.transliteration: aghnir jāghāra tam ṛcaḥ kāmayante 'ghnir jāghāra tam u sāmāni yanti aghnir jāghāra tam ayaṃ soma āha tavāham asmi sakhye nyokāḥ

translations.griffith: Agni is watchful, and the gcas love him; Agni is watchful, Sāma verses seek him.  Agni is watchful, to him saith this Soma, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

verses.sanskrit: विदा दिवो विष्यन्न अद्रिम उक्थैर आयत्या उषसो अर्चिनो गुः अपाव्र्त वरजिनीर उत सवर गाद वि दुरो मानुषीर देव आवः |||
verses.transliteration: vidā divo viṣyann adrim ukthair āyatyā uṣaso arcino ghuḥ apāvṛta vrajinīr ut svar ghād vi duro mānuṣīr deva āvaḥ

translations.griffith: BARDS of approaching Dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open.  The Sun hath risen and oped the stable portals: the doors of men, too, hath the God thrown open.

verses.sanskrit: वि सूर्यो अमतिं न शरियं साद ओर्वाद गवाम माता जानती गात धन्वर्णसो नद्यः खादोर्णा सथूणेव सुमिता दरंहत दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: vi sūryo amatiṃ na śriyaṃ sād orvād ghavām mātā jānatī ghāt dhanvarṇaso nadyaḥ khādoarṇā sthūṇeva sumitā dṛṃhata dyauḥ

translations.griffith: Sūrya hath spread his light as splendour: hither came the Cows' Mother, conscious, from the stable,  To streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firm-set pillar.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मा उक्थाय पर्वतस्य गर्भो महीनां जनुषे पूर्व्याय वि पर्वतो जिहीत साधत दयौर आविवासन्तो दसयन्त भूम |||
verses.transliteration: asmā ukthāya parvatasya gharbho mahīnāṃ januṣe pūrvyāya vi parvato jihīta sādhata dyaur āvivāsanto dasayanta bhūma

translations.griffith: This laud hath won the burden of the mountain. To aid the ancient birth of mighty waters  The mountain parted, Heaven performed his office. The worshippers were worn with constant serving.

verses.sanskrit: सूक्तेभिर वो वचोभिर देवजुष्टैर इन्द्रा नव अग्नी अवसे हुवध्यै उक्थेभिर हि षमा कवयः सुयज्ञा आविवासन्तो मरुतो यजन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: sūktebhir vo vacobhir devajuṣṭair indrā nv aghnī avase huvadhyai ukthebhir hi ṣmā kavayaḥ suyajñā āvivāsanto maruto yajanti

translations.griffith: With hymns and God-loved words will I invoke you, Indra and Agni, to obtain your favour,  For verily sages, skilled in sacrificing, worship the Maruts and with lauds invite them.

verses.sanskrit: एतो नव अद्य सुध्यो भवाम पर दुछुना मिनवामा वरीयः आरे दवेषांसि सनुतर दधामायाम पराञ्चो यजमानम अछ |||
verses.transliteration: eto nv adya sudhyo bhavāma pra duchunā minavāmā varīyaḥ āre dveṣāṃsi sanutar dadhāmāyāma prāñco yajamānam acha

translations.griffith: This day approach us: may our thoughts be holy, far from us let us cast away misfortune.  Let us keep those who hate us at a distance, and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit: एता धियं कर्णवामा सखायो ऽप या मातां रणुत वरजं गोः यया मनुर विशिशिप्रं जिगाय यया वणिग वङकुर आपा पुरीषम |||
verses.transliteration: etā dhiyaṃ kṛṇavāmā sakhāyo 'pa yā mātāṃ ṛṇuta vrajaṃ ghoḥ yayā manur viśiśipraṃ jighāya yayā vaṇigh vaṅkur āpā purīṣam

translations.griffith: Come, let us carry out, O friends, the purpose wherewith the Mother threw the Cow's stall open,  That wherewith Manu conquered Visisipra, wherewith the wandering merchant gained heaven's water.

verses.sanskrit: अनूनोद अत्र हस्तयतो अद्रिर आर्चन येन दश मासो नवग्वाः रतं यती सरमा गा अविन्दद विश्वानि सत्याङगिराश चकार |||
verses.transliteration: anūnod atra hastayato adrir ārcan yena daśa māso navaghvāḥ ṛtaṃ yatī saramā ghā avindad viśvāni satyāṅghirāś cakāra

translations.griffith: Here, urged by hands, loudly hath rung the press-stone wherewith Navagvas through ten months sang praises.  Saramā went aright and found the cattle. Aṅgiras gave effect to all their labours.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे अस्या वयुषि माहिनायाः सं यद गोभिर अङगिरसो नवन्त उत्स आसाम परमे सधस्थ रतस्य पथा सरमा विदद गाः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve asyā vyuṣi māhināyāḥ saṃ yad ghobhir aṅghiraso navanta utsa āsām parame sadhastha ṛtasya pathā saramā vidad ghāḥ

translations.griffith: When at the dawning of this mighty Goddess, Aṅgirases all sang forth with the cattle,—  Their spring is in the loftiest place of meeting,—Saramā found the kine by Order's pathway.

verses.sanskrit: आ सूर्यो यातु सप्ताश्वः कषेत्रं यद अस्योर्विया दीर्घयाथे रघुः शयेनः पतयद अन्धो अछा युवा कविर दीदयद गोषु गछन |||
verses.transliteration: ā sūryo yātu saptāśvaḥ kṣetraṃ yad asyorviyā dīrghayāthe raghuḥ śyenaḥ patayad andho achā yuvā kavir dīdayad ghoṣu ghachan

translations.griffith: Borne by his Coursers Seven may Sūrya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey.  Down on the Soma swooped the rapid Falcon. Bright was the young Sage moving mid his cattle.

verses.sanskrit: आ सूर्यो अरुहच छुक्रम अर्णो ऽयुक्त यद धरितो वीतप्र्ष्ठाः उद्ना न नावम अनयन्त धीरा आश्र्ण्वतीर आपो अर्वाग अतिष्ठन |||
verses.transliteration: ā sūryo aruhac chukram arṇo 'yukta yad dharito vītapṛṣṭhāḥ udnā na nāvam anayanta dhīrā āśṛṇvatīr āpo arvāgh atiṣṭhan

translations.griffith: Sūrya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fair-backed Tawny Horses.  The wise have drawn him like a ship through water: the floods obedient have descended hither.

verses.sanskrit: धियं वो अप्सु दधिषे सवर्षां ययातरन दश मासो नवग्वाः अया धिया सयाम देवगोपा अया धिया तुतुर्यामात्य अंहः |||
verses.transliteration: dhiyaṃ vo apsu dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ yayātaran daśa māso navaghvāḥ ayā dhiyā syāma devaghopā ayā dhiyā tuturyāmāty aṃhaḥ

translations.griffith: I lay upon the Floods your hymn, lightwinning, wherewith Navagvas their ten months completed.  Through this our hymn may we have Gods to guard us: through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction.

verses.sanskrit: हयो न विद्वां अयुजि सवयं धुरि तां वहामि परतरणीम अवस्युवम नास्या वश्मि विमुचं नाव्र्तम पुनर विद्वान पथः पुरेत रजु नेषति |||
verses.transliteration: hayo na vidvāṃ ayuji svayaṃ dhuri tāṃ vahāmi prataraṇīm avasyuvam nāsyā vaśmi vimucaṃ nāvṛtam punar vidvān pathaḥ puraeta ṛju neṣati

translations.griffith: WELL knowing I have bound me, horselike, to the pole: I carry that which bears as on and gives us help.  I seek for no release, no turning back therefrom. May he who knows the way, the Leader, guide me straight.

verses.sanskrit: अग्न इन्द्र वरुण मित्र देवाः शर्धः पर यन्त मारुतोत विष्णो उभा नासत्या रुद्रो अध गनाः पूषा भगः सरस्वती जुषन्त |||
verses.transliteration: aghna indra varuṇa mitra devāḥ śardhaḥ pra yanta mārutota viṣṇo ubhā nāsatyā rudro adha ghnāḥ pūṣā bhaghaḥ sarasvatī juṣanta

translations.griffith: O Agni, Indra, Varuṇa, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Viṣṇu.  May both Nāsatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pūṣan, Sarasvatī, Bhaga, accept us.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी मित्रावरुणादितिं सवः पर्थिवीं दयाम मरुतः पर्वतां अपः हुवे विष्णुम पूषणम बरह्मणस पतिम भगं नु शंसं सवितारम ऊतये |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī mitrāvaruṇāditiṃ svaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām marutaḥ parvatāṃ apaḥ huve viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim bhaghaṃ nu śaṃsaṃ savitāram ūtaye

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven,  Viṣṇu I call, Pūṣan, and Brahmaṇaspati, and Bhaga, Samsa, Savitar that they may help.

verses.sanskrit: उत नो विष्णुर उत वातो अस्रिधो दरविणोदा उत सोमो मयस करत उत रभव उत राये नो अश्विनोत तवष्टोत विभ्वानु मंसते |||
verses.transliteration: uta no viṣṇur uta vāto asridho draviṇodā uta somo mayas karat uta ṛbhava uta rāye no aśvinota tvaṣṭota vibhvānu maṃsate

translations.griffith: May Viṣṇu also and Vāta who injures none, and Soma granter of possessions give us joy;  And may the Ṛbhus and the Aśvins, Tvaṣṭar and Vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उत तयन नो मारुतं शर्ध आ गमद दिविक्षयं यजतम बर्हिर आसदे बर्हस्पतिः शर्म पूषोत नो यमद वरूथ्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा |||
verses.transliteration: uta tyan no mārutaṃ śardha ā ghamad divikṣayaṃ yajatam barhir āsade bṛhaspatiḥ śarma pūṣota no yamad varūthyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā

translations.griffith: So may the band of Maruts dwelling in the sky, the holy, come to us to sit on sacred grass;  Bṛhaspati and Pūṣan grant us sure defence, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman guard and shelter us.

verses.sanskrit: उत तये नः पर्वतासः सुशस्तयः सुदीतयो नद्यस तरामणे भुवन भगो विभक्ता शवसावसा गमद उरुव्यचा अदितिः शरोतु मे हवम |||
verses.transliteration: uta tye naḥ parvatāsaḥ suśastayaḥ sudītayo nadyas trāmaṇe bhuvan bhagho vibhaktā śavasāvasā ghamad uruvyacā aditiḥ śrotu me havam

translations.griffith: And may the Mountains famed in noble eulogies, and the fair-gleaming Rivers keep us safe from harm.  May Bhaga the Dispenser come with power and grace, and far-pervading Aditi listen to my call.

verses.sanskrit: देवानाम पत्नीर उशतीर अवन्तु नः परावन्तु नस तुजये वाजसातये याः पार्थिवासो या अपाम अपि वरते ता नो देवीः सुहवाः शर्म यछत |||
verses.transliteration: devānām patnīr uśatīr avantu naḥ prāvantu nas tujaye vājasātaye yāḥ pārthivāso yā apām api vrate tā no devīḥ suhavāḥ śarma yachata

translations.griffith: May the Gods’ Spouses aid us of their own freewill, aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil.  Grant us protection, O ye gracious Goddesses, ye who are on the earth or in the waters' realm.

verses.sanskrit: उत गना वयन्तु देवपत्नीर इन्द्राण्य अग्नाय्य अश्विनी राट आ रोदसी वरुणानी शर्णोतु वयन्तु देवीर य रतुर जनीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: uta ghnā vyantu devapatnīr indrāṇy aghnāyy aśvinī rāṭ ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu vyantu devīr ya ṛtur janīnām

translations.griffith: May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Rat, Aśvini, Agnāyī, and Indrāṇī.  May Rodasī and Varuṇānī hear us, and Goddesses come at the Matrons' season.

verses.sanskrit: परयुञ्जती दिव एति बरुवाणा मही माता दुहितुर बोधयन्ती आविवासन्ती युवतिर मनीषा पित्र्भ्य आ सदने जोहुवाना |||
verses.transliteration: prayuñjatī diva eti bruvāṇā mahī mātā duhitur bodhayantī āvivāsantī yuvatir manīṣā pitṛbhya ā sadane johuvānā

translations.griffith: URGING to toil and making proclamation, seeking Heaven's Daughter comes the Mighty Mother:  She comes, the youthful Hymn, unto the Fathers, inviting to her home and loudly calling.

verses.sanskrit: अजिरासस तदप ईयमाना आतस्थिवांसो अम्र्तस्य नाभिम अनन्तास उरवो विश्वतः सीम परि दयावाप्र्थिवी यन्ति पन्थाः |||
verses.transliteration: ajirāsas tadapa īyamānā ātasthivāṃso amṛtasya nābhim anantāsa uravo viśvataḥ sīm pari dyāvāpṛthivī yanti panthāḥ

translations.griffith: Swift in their motion, hasting to their duty, reaching the central point of life immortal,  On every side about the earth and heaven go forth the spacious paths without a limit.

verses.sanskrit: उक्षा समुद्रो अरुषः सुपर्णः पूर्वस्य योनिम पितुर आ विवेश मध्ये दिवो निहितः पर्श्निर अश्मा वि चक्रमे रजसस पात्य अन्तौ |||
verses.transliteration: ukṣā samudro aruṣaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pitur ā viveśa madhye divo nihitaḥ pṛśnir aśmā vi cakrame rajasas pāty antau

translations.griffith: Steer, Sea, Red Bird with strong wings, he hath entered the dwelling-place of the Primeval Father.  A gay-hued Stone set in the midst of heaven, he hath gone forth and guards mid-air's two limits.

verses.sanskrit: चत्वार ईम बिभ्रति कषेमयन्तो दश गर्भं चरसे धापयन्ते तरिधातवः परमा अस्य गावो दिवश चरन्ति परि सद्यो अन्तान |||
verses.transliteration: catvāra īm bibhrati kṣemayanto daśa gharbhaṃ carase dhāpayante tridhātavaḥ paramā asya ghāvo divaś caranti pari sadyo antān

translations.griffith: Four bear him up and give him rest and quiet, and ten invigorate the Babe for travel.  His kine most excellent, of threefold nature, pass swiftly round the boundaries of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: इदं वपुर निवचनं जनासश चरन्ति यन नद्यस तस्थुर आपः दवे यद ईम बिभ्र्तो मातुर अन्ये इहेह जाते यम्य्र सबन्धू |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ vapur nivacanaṃ janāsaś caranti yan nadyas tasthur āpaḥ dve yad īm bibhṛto mātur anye iheha jāte yamyṛ sabandhū

translations.griffith: Wondrous, O people, is the mystic knowledge that while the waters stand the streams are flowing:  That, separate from his Mother, Two support him, closely-united, twins, here made apparent.

verses.sanskrit: वि तन्वते धियो अस्मा अपांसि वस्त्रा पुत्राय मातरो वयन्ति उपप्रक्षे वर्षणो मोदमाना दिवस पथा वध्वो यन्त्य अछ |||
verses.transliteration: vi tanvate dhiyo asmā apāṃsi vastrā putrāya mātaro vayanti upaprakṣe vṛṣaṇo modamānā divas pathā vadhvo yanty acha

translations.griffith: For him they lenghten prayers and acts of worship: the Mothers weave garments for him their offspring.  Rejoicing, for the Steer's impregning contact, his Spouses move on paths or heaven to meet him.

verses.sanskrit: तद अस्तु मित्रावरुणा तद अग्ने शं योर अस्मभ्यम इदम अस्तु शस्तम अशीमहि गाधम उत परतिष्ठां नमो दिवे बर्हते सादनाय |||
verses.transliteration: tad astu mitrāvaruṇā tad aghne śaṃ yor asmabhyam idam astu śastam aśīmahi ghādham uta pratiṣṭhāṃ namo dive bṛhate sādanāya

translations.griffith: Be this our praise, O Varuṇa and Mitra may this be health and force to us, O Agni.  May we obtain firm ground and room for resting: Glory to Heaven, the lofty habitation!

verses.sanskrit: कद उ परियाय धाम्ने मनामहे सवक्षत्राय सवयशसे महे वयम आमेन्यस्य रजसो यद अभ्र आं अपो वर्णाना वितनोति मायिनी |||
verses.transliteration: kad u priyāya dhāmne manāmahe svakṣatrāya svayaśase mahe vayam āmenyasya rajaso yad abhra āṃ apo vṛṇānā vitanoti māyinī

translations.griffith: WHAT may we meditate for the beloved Power, mighty in native strength and glorious in itself,  Which as a magic energy seeking waters spreads even to theimmeasurable middle region's cloud?

verses.sanskrit: ता अत्नत वयुनं वीरवक्षणं समान्या वर्तया विश्वम आ रजः अपो अपाचीर अपरा अपेजते पर पूर्वाभिस तिरते देवयुर जनः |||
verses.transliteration: tā atnata vayunaṃ vīravakṣaṇaṃ samānyā vṛtayā viśvam ā rajaḥ apo apācīr aparā apejate pra pūrvābhis tirate devayur janaḥ

translations.griffith: O'er all the region with their uniform advance these have spread out the lore that giveth heroes strength.  Back, with their course reversed, the others pass away: the pious lengthens life with those that are before.

verses.sanskrit: आ गरावभिर अहन्येभिर अक्तुभिर वरिष्ठं वज्रम आ जिघर्ति मायिनि शतं वा यस्य परचरन सवे दमे संवर्तयन्तो वि च वर्तयन्न अहा |||
verses.transliteration: ā ghrāvabhir ahanyebhir aktubhir variṣṭhaṃ vajram ā jigharti māyini śataṃ vā yasya pracaran sve dame saṃvartayanto vi ca vartayann ahā

translations.griffith: With pressing-stones and with the bright beams of the day he hurls his broadest bolt against the Guileful One.  Even he whose hundred wander in his own abode, driving the days afar and bringing them again.

verses.sanskrit: ताम अस्य रीतिम परशोर इव परत्य अनीकम अख्यम भुजे अस्य वर्पसः सचा यदि पितुमन्तम इव कषयं रत्नं दधाति भरहूतये विशे |||
verses.transliteration: tām asya rītim paraśor iva praty anīkam akhyam bhuje asya varpasaḥ sacā yadi pitumantam iva kṣayaṃ ratnaṃ dadhāti bharahūtaye viśe

translations.griffith: I, to enjoy the beauty of his form, behold that rapid rush of his as ’twere an axe's edge,  What time he gives the man who calls on him in fight wealth like a dwelling-house filled full with store of food.

verses.sanskrit: स जिह्वया चतुरनीक रञ्जते चारु वसानो वरुणो यतन्न अरिम न तस्य विद्म पुरुषत्वता वयं यतो भगः सविता दाति वार्यम |||
verses.transliteration: sa jihvayā caturanīka ṛñjate cāru vasāno varuṇo yatann arim na tasya vidma puruṣatvatā vayaṃ yato bhaghaḥ savitā dāti vāryam

translations.griffith: Four-faced and nobly clad, Varuṇa, urging on the pious to his task, stirs himself with the tongue.  Naught by our human nature do we know of him, him from whom Bhaga Savitar bestows the boon.

verses.sanskrit: देवं वो अद्य सवितारम एषे भगं च रत्नं विभजन्तम आयोः आ वां नरा पुरुभुजा वव्र्त्यां दिवे-दिवे चिद अश्विना सखीयन |||
verses.transliteration: devaṃ vo adya savitāram eṣe bhaghaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ ā vāṃ narā purubhujā vavṛtyāṃ dive-dive cid aśvinā sakhīyan

translations.griffith: THIS day I bring God Savitar to meet you, and Bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals.  You, Aśvins, Heroes rich in treasures, daily seeking your friendship fain would I turn hither.

verses.sanskrit: परति परयाणम असुरस्य विद्वान सूक्तैर देवं सवितारं दुवस्य उप बरुवीत नमसा विजानञ जयेष्ठं च रत्नं विभजन्तम आयोः |||
verses.transliteration: prati prayāṇam asurasya vidvān sūktair devaṃ savitāraṃ duvasya upa bruvīta namasā vijānañ jyeṣṭhaṃ ca ratnaṃ vibhajantam āyoḥ

translations.griffith: Knowing full well the Asura's time of coming, worship God Savitar with hymns and praises.  Let him who rightly knoweth speak with homage to him who dealeth out man's noblest treasure.

verses.sanskrit: अदत्रया दयते वार्याणि पूषा भगो अदितिर वस्त उस्रः इन्द्रो विष्णुर वरुणो मित्रो अग्निर अहानि भद्रा जनयन्त दस्माः |||
verses.transliteration: adatrayā dayate vāryāṇi pūṣā bhagho aditir vasta usraḥ indro viṣṇur varuṇo mitro aghnir ahāni bhadrā janayanta dasmāḥ

translations.griffith: Not for reward doth Pūṣan send his blessings, Bhaga, or Aditi: his garb is splendour.  May Indra, Visniu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni produce auspicious days, the Wonder-Workers.

verses.sanskrit: तन नो अनर्वा सविता वरूथं तत सिन्धव इषयन्तो अनु गमन उप यद वोचे अध्वरस्य होता रायः सयाम पतयो वाजरत्नाः |||
verses.transliteration: tan no anarvā savitā varūthaṃ tat sindhava iṣayanto anu ghman upa yad voce adhvarasya hotā rāyaḥ syāma patayo vājaratnāḥ

translations.griffith: Sending the shelter which we ask, the foeless Savitar and the Rivers shall approach us.  When I, the sacrifice's priest, invite them, may we he lords of wealth and rich possessions.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये वसुभ्य ईवद आ नमो दुर ये मित्रे वरुणे सूक्तवाचः अवैत्व अभ्वं कर्णुता वरीयो दिवस्प्र्थिव्योर अवसा मदेम |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye vasubhya īvad ā namo dur ye mitre varuṇe sūktavācaḥ avaitv abhvaṃ kṛṇutā varīyo divaspṛthivyor avasā madema

translations.griffith: They who devote such worship to the Vasus, singing their hymns to Varuṇa and Mitra,  Vouchsafe them ample room, far off be danger. Through grace of Heaven and Earth may we be happy.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वो देवस्य नेतुर मर्तो वुरीत सख्यम विश्वो राय इषुध्यति दयुम्नं वर्णीत पुष्यसे |||
verses.transliteration: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase

translations.griffith: LET every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God.  Each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.

verses.sanskrit: ते ते देव नेतर ये चेमां अनुशसे ते राया ते हय रप्र्चे सचेमहि सचथ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: te te deva netar ye cemāṃ anuśase te rāyā te hy ṛpṛce sacemahi sacathyaḥ

translations.griffith: These, leading God, are thine, and these here ready to speak after us.  As such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.

verses.sanskrit: अतो न आ नञ्न अतिथीन अतः पत्नीर दशस्यत आरे विश्वम पथेष्ठां दविषो युयोतु यूयुविः |||
verses.transliteration: ato na ā nñn atithīn ataḥ patnīr daśasyata āre viśvam patheṣṭhāṃ dviṣo yuyotu yūyuviḥ

translations.griffith: So further honour as our guests the Hero Gods and then the Dames.  May he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.

verses.sanskrit: यत्र वह्निर अभिहितो दुद्रवद दरोण्यः पशुः नर्मणा वीरपस्त्यो ऽरणा धीरेव सनिता |||
verses.transliteration: yatra vahnir abhihito dudravad droṇyaḥ paśuḥ nṛmaṇā vīrapastyo 'rṇā dhīreva sanitā

translations.griffith: Where fire is set, and swiftly runs the victim dwelling in the trough,  He wins, with heroes in his home, friendly to man, like constant streams.

verses.sanskrit: एष ते देव नेता रथस्पतिः शं रयिः शं राये शं सवस्तय इषस्तुतो मनामहे देवस्तुतो मनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa te deva netā rathaspatiḥ śaṃ rayiḥ śaṃ rāye śaṃ svastaya iṣastuto manāmahe devastuto manāmahe

translations.griffith: May these thy riches, Leader God! that rule the car, be blest to us,  Yea, blest to us for wealth and weal. This will we ponder praising strength, this ponder as we praise the God.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने सुतस्य पीतये विश्वैर ऊमेभिर आ गहि देवेभिर हव्यदातये |||
verses.transliteration: aghne sutasya pītaye viśvair ūmebhir ā ghahi devebhir havyadātaye

translations.griffith: WITH all assistants, Agni, come hither to drink the Soma-juice;  With Gods unto our sacred gifts.

verses.sanskrit: रतधीतय आ गत सत्यधर्माणो अध्वरम अग्नेः पिबत जिह्वया |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtadhītaya ā ghata satyadharmāṇo adhvaram aghneḥ pibata jihvayā

translations.griffith: Come to the sacrifice, O ye whose ways are right, whose laws are true,  And drink the draught with Agni's tongue.

verses.sanskrit: विप्रेभिर विप्र सन्त्य परातर्यावभिर आ गहि देवेभिः सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: viprebhir vipra santya prātaryāvabhir ā ghahi devebhiḥ somapītaye

translations.griffith: O Singer, with the singers, O Gracious, with those who move at dawn,  Come to the Soma-draught with Gods.

verses.sanskrit: अयं सोमश चमू सुतो ऽमत्रे परि षिच्यते परिय इन्द्राय वायवे |||
verses.transliteration: ayaṃ somaś camū suto 'matre pari ṣicyate priya indrāya vāyave

translations.griffith: To Indra and to Vāyu dear, this Soma, by the mortar pressed,  Is now poured forth to fill the jar.

verses.sanskrit: वायव आ याहि वीतये जुषाणो हव्यदातये पिबा सुतस्यान्धसो अभि परयः |||
verses.transliteration: vāyav ā yāhi vītaye juṣāṇo havyadātaye pibā sutasyāndhaso abhi prayaḥ

translations.griffith: Vāyu, come hither to the feast, wellpleased unto our sacred gifts:  Drink of the Soma juice effused come to the food.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्रश च वायव एषां सुतानाम पीतिम अर्हथः ताञ जुषेथाम अरेपसाव अभि परयः |||
verses.transliteration: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ sutānām pītim arhathaḥ tāñ juṣethām arepasāv abhi prayaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye, Indra, Vāyu, well deserve to drink the juices pressed by us.  Gladly accept them, spotless Pair come to the food.

verses.sanskrit: सुता इन्द्राय वायवे सोमासो दध्याशिरः निम्नं न यन्ति सिन्धवो ऽभि परयः |||
verses.transliteration: sutā indrāya vāyave somāso dadhyāśiraḥ nimnaṃ na yanti sindhavo 'bhi prayaḥ

translations.griffith: For Indra and for Vāyu pressed are Soma juices blent with curd,  As rivers to the lowland flow: come to the food.

verses.sanskrit: सजूर विश्वेभिर देवेभिर अश्विभ्याम उषसा सजूः आ याह्य अग्ने अत्रिवत सुते रण |||
verses.transliteration: sajūr viśvebhir devebhir aśvibhyām uṣasā sajūḥ ā yāhy aghne atrivat sute raṇa

translations.griffith: Associate with all the Gods, come, with the Aśvins and with Dawn,  Agni, as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

verses.sanskrit: सजूर मित्रावरुणाभ्यां सजूः सोमेन विष्णुना आ याह्य अग्ने अत्रिवत सुते रण |||
verses.transliteration: sajūr mitrāvaruṇābhyāṃ sajūḥ somena viṣṇunā ā yāhy aghne atrivat sute raṇa

translations.griffith: Associate with Varuṇa, with Mitra, Soma, Viṣṇu, come,  Agni, as erstwith Atri, so enjoy the juice.

verses.sanskrit: सजूर आदित्यैर वसुभिः सजूर इन्द्रेण वायुना आ याह्य अग्ने अत्रिवत सुते रण |||
verses.transliteration: sajūr ādityair vasubhiḥ sajūr indreṇa vāyunā ā yāhy aghne atrivat sute raṇa

translations.griffith: Associate with Vasus, with Ādityas, Indra, Viyu, come, Agni as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्ति नो मिमीताम अश्विना भगः सवस्ति देव्य अदितिर अनर्वणः सवस्ति पूषा असुरो दधातु नः सवस्ति दयावाप्र्थिवी सुचेतुना |||
verses.transliteration: svasti no mimītām aśvinā bhaghaḥ svasti devy aditir anarvaṇaḥ svasti pūṣā asuro dadhātu naḥ svasti dyāvāpṛthivī sucetunā

translations.griffith: May Bhaga and the Aśvins grant us health and wealth, and Goddess Adid and he whom none resist.  The Asura Pūṣan grant us all prosperity, and Heaven and Earth most wise vouchsafe us happiness.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्तये वायुम उप बरवामहै सोमं सवस्ति भुवनस्य यस पतिः बर्हस्पतिं सर्वगणं सवस्तये सवस्तय आदित्यासो भवन्तु नः |||
verses.transliteration: svastaye vāyum upa bravāmahai somaṃ svasti bhuvanasya yas patiḥ bṛhaspatiṃ sarvaghaṇaṃ svastaye svastaya ādityāso bhavantu naḥ

translations.griffith: Let us solicit Vāyu for prosperity, and Soma who is Lord of all the world for weal;  For weal Bṛhaspati with all his company. May the Ādityas bring us health and happiness.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे देवा नो अद्या सवस्तये वैश्वानरो वसुर अग्निः सवस्तये देवा अवन्त्व रभवः सवस्तये सवस्ति नो रुद्रः पात्व अंहसः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve devā no adyā svastaye vaiśvānaro vasur aghniḥ svastaye devā avantv ṛbhavaḥ svastaye svasti no rudraḥ pātv aṃhasaḥ

translations.griffith: May all the Gods, may Agni the beneficent, God of all men, this day be with us for our weal.  Help us the Ṛbhus, the Divine Ones, for our good. May Rudra bless and keep us from calamity.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्ति मित्रावरुणा सवस्ति पथ्ये रेवति सवस्ति न इन्द्रश चाग्निश च सवस्ति नो अदिते कर्धि |||
verses.transliteration: svasti mitrāvaruṇā svasti pathye revati svasti na indraś cāghniś ca svasti no adite kṛdhi

translations.griffith: Prosper us, Mitra, Varuṇa. O wealthy Pathya, prosper us.  Indra and Agni, prosper us; prosper us thou, O Aditi.

verses.sanskrit: सवस्ति पन्थाम अनु चरेम सूर्याचन्द्रमसाव इव पुनर ददताघ्नता जानता सं गमेमहि |||
verses.transliteration: svasti panthām anu carema sūryācandramasāv iva punar dadatāghnatā jānatā saṃ ghamemahi

translations.griffith: Like Sun and Moon may we pursue in full prosperity our path,  And meet with one who gives again, -who knows us well and slays us not.

verses.sanskrit: पर शयावाश्व धर्ष्णुयार्चा मरुद्भिर रक्वभिः ये अद्रोघम अनुष्वधं शरवो मदन्ति यज्ञियाः |||
verses.transliteration: pra śyāvāśva dhṛṣṇuyārcā marudbhir ṛkvabhiḥ ye adrogham anuṣvadhaṃ śravo madanti yajñiyāḥ

translations.griffith: SING boldly forth, Śyāvāśva, with the Maruts who are loud in song,  Who, holy, as their wont is, joy in glory that is free from guile.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि सथिरस्य शवसः सखायः सन्ति धर्ष्णुया ते यामन्न आ धर्षद्विनस तमना पान्ति शश्वतः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi sthirasya śavasaḥ sakhāyaḥ santi dhṛṣṇuyā te yāmann ā dhṛṣadvinas tmanā pānti śaśvataḥ

translations.griffith: For in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength.  They in their course, bold-spirited, guard all men of their own accord.

verses.sanskrit: ते सयन्द्रासो नोक्षणो ऽति षकन्दन्ति शर्वरीः मरुताम अधा महो दिवि कषमा च मन्महे |||
verses.transliteration: te syandrāso nokṣaṇo 'ti ṣkandanti śarvarīḥ marutām adhā maho divi kṣamā ca manmahe

translations.griffith: Like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights;  And thus the Maruts’ power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.

verses.sanskrit: मरुत्सु वो दधीमहि सतोमं यज्ञं च धर्ष्णुया विश्वे ये मानुषा युगा पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः |||
verses.transliteration: marutsu vo dadhīmahi stomaṃ yajñaṃ ca dhṛṣṇuyā viśve ye mānuṣā yughā pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ

translations.griffith: With boldness to your Maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice:  Who all, through ages of mankind, guard mortal man from injury.

verses.sanskrit: अर्हन्तो ये सुदानवो नरो असामिशवसः पर यज्ञं यज्ञियेभ्यो दिवो अर्चा मरुद्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: arhanto ye sudānavo naro asāmiśavasaḥ pra yajñaṃ yajñiyebhyo divo arcā marudbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Praiseworthy, givers of good gifts, Heroes with full and perfect strength -  To Maruts, Holy Ones of heaven, will I extol the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: आ रुक्मैर आ युधा नर रष्वा रष्टीर अस्र्क्षत अन्व एनां अह विद्युतो मरुतो जज्झतीर इव भानुर अर्त तमना दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: ā rukmair ā yudhā nara ṛṣvā ṛṣṭīr asṛkṣata anv enāṃ aha vidyuto maruto jajjhatīr iva bhānur arta tmanā divaḥ

translations.griffith: The lofty Heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold.  After these Maruts followed close, like laughing lightning from the sky, a splendour of its own accord.

verses.sanskrit: ये वाव्र्धन्त पार्थिवा य उराव अन्तरिक्ष आ वर्जने वा नदीनां सधस्थे वा महो दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: ye vāvṛdhanta pārthivā ya urāv antarikṣa ā vṛjane vā nadīnāṃ sadhasthe vā maho divaḥ

translations.griffith: They who waxed mighty, of the earth, they who are in the wide mid-air,  Or in the rivers’ compass, or in the abode of ample heaven.

verses.sanskrit: शर्धो मारुतम उच छंस सत्यशवसम रभ्वसम उत सम ते शुभे नरः पर सयन्द्रा युजत तमना |||
verses.transliteration: śardho mārutam uc chaṃsa satyaśavasam ṛbhvasam uta sma te śubhe naraḥ pra syandrā yujata tmanā

translations.griffith: Praise thou the Maruts’ company, the valorous and truly strong,  The Heroes, hasting, by themselves have yoked their deer for victory.

verses.sanskrit: उत सम ते परुष्ण्याम ऊर्णा वसत शुन्ध्यवः उत पव्या रथानाम अद्रिम भिन्दन्त्य ओजसा |||
verses.transliteration: uta sma te paruṣṇyām ūrṇā vasata śundhyavaḥ uta pavyā rathānām adrim bhindanty ojasā

translations.griffith: Fair-gleaming, on Paruṣṇī they have clothed themselves in robes of wool,  And with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might.

verses.sanskrit: आपथयो विपथयो ऽनतस्पथा अनुपथाः एतेभिर मह्यं नामभिर यज्ञं विष्टार ओहते |||
verses.transliteration: āpathayo vipathayo 'ntaspathā anupathāḥ etebhir mahyaṃ nāmabhir yajñaṃ viṣṭāra ohate

translations.griffith: Whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path,  Under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me.

verses.sanskrit: अधा नरो नय ओहते ऽधा नियुत ओहते अधा पारावता इति चित्रा रूपाणि दर्श्या |||
verses.transliteration: adhā naro ny ohate 'dhā niyuta ohate adhā pārāvatā iti citrā rūpāṇi darśyā

translations.griffith: To this the Heroes well attend, well do their teams attend to this.  Visible are their varied forms. Behold, they are Paravatas.

verses.sanskrit: छन्दस्तुभः कुभन्यव उत्सम आ कीरिणो नर्तुः ते मे के चिन न तायव ऊमा आसन दर्शि तविषे |||
verses.transliteration: chandastubhaḥ kubhanyava utsam ā kīriṇo nṛtuḥ te me ke cin na tāyava ūmā āsan dṛśi tviṣe

translations.griffith: Hymn-singing, seeking water, they, praising, have danced about the spring.  What are they unto me? No thieves, but helpers, splendid to behold.

verses.sanskrit: य रष्वा रष्टिविद्युतः कवयः सन्ति वेधसः तम रषे मारुतं गणं नमस्या रमया गिरा |||
verses.transliteration: ya ṛṣvā ṛṣṭividyutaḥ kavayaḥ santi vedhasaḥ tam ṛṣe mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ namasyā ramayā ghirā

translations.griffith: Sublime, with lightnings for their spears, Sages and Orderers are they.  Ṛṣi, adore that Marut host, and make them happy with thy song.

verses.sanskrit: अछ रषे मारुतं गणं दाना मित्रं न योषणा दिवो वा धर्ष्णव ओजसा सतुता धीभिर इषण्यत |||
verses.transliteration: acha ṛṣe mārutaṃ ghaṇaṃ dānā mitraṃ na yoṣaṇā divo vā dhṛṣṇava ojasā stutā dhībhir iṣaṇyata

translations.griffith: Ṛṣi, invite the Marut band with offerings, as a maid her friend.  From heaven, too, Bold Ones, in your might haste hither glorified with songs.

verses.sanskrit: नू मन्वान एषां देवां अछा न वक्षणा दाना सचेत सूरिभिर यामश्रुतेभिर अञ्जिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: nū manvāna eṣāṃ devāṃ achā na vakṣaṇā dānā saceta sūribhir yāmaśrutebhir añjibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Thinking of these now let him come, as with the escort of the Gods,  And with the splendid Princes, famed for rapid courses, to the gifts.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये मे बन्ध्वेषे गां वोचन्त सूरयः पर्श्निं वोचन्त मातरम अधा पितरम इष्मिणं रुद्रं वोचन्त शिक्वसः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye me bandhveṣe ghāṃ vocanta sūrayaḥ pṛśniṃ vocanta mātaram adhā pitaram iṣmiṇaṃ rudraṃ vocanta śikvasaḥ

translations.griffith: Princes, who, when I asked their kin, named Pṛśni as their Mother-cow,  And the impetuous Rudra they, the Mighty Ones, declared their Sire.

verses.sanskrit: सप्त मे सप्त शाकिन एकम-एका शता ददुः यमुनायाम अधि शरुतम उद राधो गव्यम मर्जे नि राधो अश्व्यम मर्जे |||
verses.transliteration: sapta me sapta śākina ekam-ekā śatā daduḥ yamunāyām adhi śrutam ud rādho ghavyam mṛje ni rādho aśvyam mṛje

translations.griffith: The mighty ones, the seven times seven, have singly given me hundred gifts.  I have obtained on Yamuna famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds.

verses.sanskrit: को वेद जानम एषां को वा पुरा सुम्नेष्व आस मरुताम यद युयुज्रे किलास्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ko veda jānam eṣāṃ ko vā purā sumneṣv āsa marutām yad yuyujre kilāsyaḥ

translations.griffith: Who knows the birth of these, or who lived in the Maruts’ favour in the days of old  What time their spotted deer were yoked?

verses.sanskrit: ऐतान रथेषु तस्थुषः कः शुश्राव कथा ययुः कस्मै सस्रुः सुदासे अन्व आपय इळाभिर वर्ष्टयः सह |||
verses.transliteration: aitān ratheṣu tasthuṣaḥ kaḥ śuśrāva kathā yayuḥ kasmai sasruḥ sudāse anv āpaya iḷābhir vṛṣṭayaḥ saha

translations.griffith: Who, when they stood upon their cars, hath heard them tell the way they went?  Who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?

verses.sanskrit: ते म आहुर य आययुर उप दयुभिर विभिर मदे नरो मर्या अरेपस इमान पश्यन्न इति षटुहि |||
verses.transliteration: te ma āhur ya āyayur upa dyubhir vibhir made naro maryā arepasa imān paśyann iti ṣṭuhi

translations.griffith: To me they told it, and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught,  Youths, Heroes free from spot or stain: Behold us here and praise thou us;

verses.sanskrit: ये अञ्जिषु ये वाशीषु सवभानवः सरक्षु रुक्मेषु खादिषु शराया रथेषु धन्वसु |||
verses.transliteration: ye añjiṣu ye vāśīṣu svabhānavaḥ srakṣu rukmeṣu khādiṣu śrāyā ratheṣu dhanvasu

translations.griffith: Who shine self-luminous with ornaments and swords, with breastplates, armlets, and with wreaths,  Arrayed on chariots and with bows.

verses.sanskrit: युष्माकं समा रथां अनु मुदे दधे मरुतो जीरदानवः वर्ष्टी दयावो यतीर इव |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣmākaṃ smā rathāṃ anu mude dadhe maruto jīradānavaḥ vṛṣṭī dyāvo yatīr iva

translations.griffith: O swift to pour your bounties down, ye Maruts, with delight I look upon your cars,  Like splendours coming through the rain.

verses.sanskrit: आ यं नरः सुदानवो ददाशुषे दिवः कोशम अचुच्यवुः वि पर्जन्यं सर्जन्ति रोदसी अनु धन्वना यन्ति वर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yaṃ naraḥ sudānavo dadāśuṣe divaḥ kośam acucyavuḥ vi parjanyaṃ sṛjanti rodasī anu dhanvanā yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Munificent Heroes, they have cast heaven's treasury down for the worshipper's behoof:  They set the storm-cloud free to stream through both the worlds, and rainfloods flow o’er desert spots.

verses.sanskrit: तत्र्दानाः सिन्धवः कषोदसा रजः पर सस्रुर धेनवो यथा सयन्ना अश्वा इवाध्वनो विमोचने वि यद वर्तन्त एन्यः |||
verses.transliteration: tatṛdānāḥ sindhavaḥ kṣodasā rajaḥ pra sasrur dhenavo yathā syannā aśvā ivādhvano vimocane vi yad vartanta enyaḥ

translations.griffith: The bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad, like milch-kine, o’er the firmament.  Like swift steeds hasting to their journey's resting-place, to every side run glittering brooks.

verses.sanskrit: आ यात मरुतो दिव आन्तरिक्षाद अमाद उत माव सथात परावतः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yāta maruto diva āntarikṣād amād uta māva sthāta parāvataḥ

translations.griffith: Hither, O Maruts, come from heaven, from mid-air, or from near at hand  Tarry not far away from us.

verses.sanskrit: मा वो रसानितभा कुभा करुमुर मा वः सिन्धुर नि रीरमत मा वः परि षठात सरयुः पुरीषिण्य अस्मे ईत सुम्नम अस्तु वः |||
verses.transliteration: mā vo rasānitabhā kubhā krumur mā vaḥ sindhur ni rīramat mā vaḥ pari ṣṭhāt sarayuḥ purīṣiṇy asme īt sumnam astu vaḥ

translations.griffith: So let not Rasā, Krumu, or Anitabha, Kubha, or Sindhu hold you back.  Let not the watery Sarayti obstruct your way. With us be all the bliss ye give.

verses.sanskrit: तं वः शर्धं रथानां तवेषं गणम मारुतं नव्यसीनाम अनु पर यन्ति वर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ rathānāṃ tveṣaṃ ghaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām anu pra yanti vṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: That brilliant gathering of your cars, the company of Maruts, of the Youthful Ones,  The rain-showers, speeding on, attend.

verses.sanskrit: शर्धं-शर्धं व एषां वरातं-वरातं गणं-गणं सुशस्तिभिः अनु करामेम धीतिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: śardhaṃ-śardhaṃ va eṣāṃ vrātaṃ-vrātaṃ ghaṇaṃ-ghaṇaṃ suśastibhiḥ anu krāmema dhītibhiḥ

translations.griffith: With eulogies and hymns may we follow your army, troop by troop, and band by band,  And company by company.

verses.sanskrit: कस्मा अद्य सुजाताय रातहव्याय पर ययुः एना यामेन मरुतः |||
verses.transliteration: kasmā adya sujātāya rātahavyāya pra yayuḥ enā yāmena marutaḥ

translations.griffith: To what oblation-giver, sprung of noble ancestry, have sped  The Maruts on this course to-day?

verses.sanskrit: येन तोकाय तनयाय धान्यम बीजं वहध्वे अक्षितम अस्मभ्यं तद धत्तन यद व ईमहे राधो विश्वायु सौभगम |||
verses.transliteration: yena tokāya tanayāya dhānyam bījaṃ vahadhve akṣitam asmabhyaṃ tad dhattana yad va īmahe rādho viśvāyu saubhagham

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe to us the bounty, that which we implore, through which, for child and progeny,  Ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away, and bliss that reacheth to all life.

verses.sanskrit: अतीयाम निदस तिरः सवस्तिभिर हित्वावद्यम अरातीः वर्ष्ट्वी शं योर आप उस्रि भेषजं सयाम मरुतः सह |||
verses.transliteration: atīyāma nidas tiraḥ svastibhir hitvāvadyam arātīḥ vṛṣṭvī śaṃ yor āpa usri bheṣajaṃ syāma marutaḥ saha

translations.griffith: May we in safety pass by those who slander us, leaving behind disgrace and hate.  Maruts, may we be there when ye, at dawn, in rest and toil, rain waters down and balm.

verses.sanskrit: सुदेवः समहासति सुवीरो नरो मरुतः स मर्त्यः यं तरायध्वे सयाम ते |||
verses.transliteration: sudevaḥ samahāsati suvīro naro marutaḥ sa martyaḥ yaṃ trāyadhve syāma te

translations.griffith: Favoured by Gods shall he the man, O Heroes, Marutr! and possessed of noble sons,  Whom ye protect. Such may we be.

verses.sanskrit: सतुहि भोजान सतुवतो अस्य यामनि रणन गावो न यवसे यतः पूर्वां इव सखींर अनु हवय गिरा गर्णीहि कामिनः |||
verses.transliteration: stuhi bhojān stuvato asya yāmani raṇan ghāvo na yavase yataḥ pūrvāṃ iva sakhīṃr anu hvaya ghirā ghṛṇīhi kāminaḥ

translations.griffith: Praise the Free-givers. At this liberal patron's rite they joy like cattle in the mead.  So call thou unto them who come as ancient Friends: hymn those who love thee with a song.

verses.sanskrit: पर शर्धाय मारुताय सवभानव इमां वाचम अनजा पर्वतच्युते घर्मस्तुभे दिव आ पर्ष्ठयज्वने दयुम्नश्रवसे महि नर्म्णम अर्चत |||
verses.transliteration: pra śardhāya mārutāya svabhānava imāṃ vācam anajā parvatacyute gharmastubhe diva ā pṛṣṭhayajvane dyumnaśravase mahi nṛmṇam arcata

translations.griffith: THIS hymn will I make for the Marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down.  Sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown, who stay the heat, who sacrifice on heights of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो मरुतस तविषा उदन्यवो वयोव्र्धो अश्वयुजः परिज्रयः सं विद्युता दधति वाशति तरितः सवरन्त्य आपो ऽवना परिज्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo marutas taviṣā udanyavo vayovṛdho aśvayujaḥ parijrayaḥ saṃ vidyutā dadhati vāśati tritaḥ svaranty āpo 'vanā parijrayaḥ

translations.griffith: O Maruts, rich in water, strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds, that wander far.  Trita roars out at him who aims the lightning-flash. The waters sweeping round are thundering on their way.

verses.sanskrit: विद्युन्महसो नरो अश्मदिद्यवो वातत्विषो मरुतः पर्वतच्युतः अब्दया चिन मुहुर आ हरादुनीव्र्त सतनयदमा रभसा उदोजसः |||
verses.transliteration: vidyunmahaso naro aśmadidyavo vātatviṣo marutaḥ parvatacyutaḥ abdayā cin muhur ā hrādunīvṛta stanayadamā rabhasā udojasaḥ

translations.griffith: They gleam with lightning, Heroes, Casters of the Stone, wind-rapid Maruts, overthrowers of the bills,  Oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail, roaring in onset, violent and exceeding strong.

verses.sanskrit: वय अक्तून रुद्रा वय अहानि शिक्वसो वय अन्तरिक्षं वि रजांसि धूतयः वि यद अज्रां अजथ नाव ईं यथा वि दुर्गाणि मरुतो नाह रिष्यथ |||
verses.transliteration: vy aktūn rudrā vy ahāni śikvaso vy antarikṣaṃ vi rajāṃsi dhūtayaḥ vi yad ajrāṃ ajatha nāva īṃ yathā vi durghāṇi maruto nāha riṣyatha

translations.griffith: When, mighty Rudras, through the nights and through the days, when through the sky and realms of air, shakers of all,  When over the broad fields ye drive along like ships, e’en to strongholds ye come, Maruts, but are not harmed.

verses.sanskrit: तद वीर्यं वो मरुतो महित्वनं दीर्घं ततान सूर्यो न योजनम एता न यामे अग्र्भीतशोचिषो ऽनश्वदां यन नय अयातना गिरिम |||
verses.transliteration: tad vīryaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ dīrghaṃ tatāna sūryo na yojanam etā na yāme aghṛbhītaśociṣo 'naśvadāṃ yan ny ayātanā ghirim

translations.griffith: Maruts, this hero strength and majesty of yours hath, like the Sun, extended o’er a lengthened way,  When in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.

verses.sanskrit: अभ्राजि शर्धो मरुतो यद अर्णसम मोषथा वर्क्षं कपनेव वेधसः अध समा नो अरमतिं सजोषसश चक्षुर इव यन्तम अनु नेषथा सुगम |||
verses.transliteration: abhrāji śardho maruto yad arṇasam moṣathā vṛkṣaṃ kapaneva vedhasaḥ adha smā no aramatiṃ sajoṣasaś cakṣur iva yantam anu neṣathā sugham

translations.griffith: Bright shone your host, ye Sages, Maruts, when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it.  Accordant, as the eye guides him who walks, have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.

verses.sanskrit: न स जीयते मरुतो न हन्यते न सरेधति न वयथते न रिष्यति नास्य राय उप दस्यन्ति नोतय रषिं वा यं राजानं वा सुषूदथ |||
verses.transliteration: na sa jīyate maruto na hanyate na sredhati na vyathate na riṣyati nāsya rāya upa dasyanti notaya ṛṣiṃ vā yaṃ rājānaṃ vā suṣūdatha

translations.griffith: Never is he, O Maruts, slain or overcome, never doth he decay ne’er is distressed or harmed;  His treasures, his resources, never waste away, whom. whether he be prince or Ṛṣi, ye direct.

verses.sanskrit: नियुत्वन्तो गरामजितो यथा नरो ऽरयमणो न मरुतः कबन्धिनः पिन्वन्त्य उत्सं यद इनासो अस्वरन वय उन्दन्ति पर्थिवीम मध्वो अन्धसा |||
verses.transliteration: niyutvanto ghrāmajito yathā naro 'ryamaṇo na marutaḥ kabandhinaḥ pinvanty utsaṃ yad ināso asvaran vy undanti pṛthivīm madhvo andhasā

translations.griffith: With harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops, the friendly Maruts, laden with their water-casks,  Let the spring flow, and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath.

verses.sanskrit: परवत्वतीयम पर्थिवी मरुद्भ्यः परवत्वती दयौर भवति परयद्भ्यः परवत्वतीः पथ्य्र अन्तरिक्ष्याः परवत्वन्तः पर्वता जीरदानवः |||
verses.transliteration: pravatvatīyam pṛthivī marudbhyaḥ pravatvatī dyaur bhavati prayadbhyaḥ pravatvatīḥ pathyṛ antarikṣyāḥ pravatvantaḥ parvatā jīradānavaḥ

translations.griffith: Free for the Maruts is the earth with sloping ways, free for the rushing Ones is heaven with steep descents.  The paths of air's mid-region are precipitous, precipitous the mountains with their running streams.

verses.sanskrit: यन मरुतः सभरसः सवर्णरः सूर्य उदिते मदथा दिवो नरः न वो ऽशवाः शरथयन्ताह सिस्रतः सद्यो अस्याध्वनः पारम अश्नुथ |||
verses.transliteration: yan marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ sūrya udite madathā divo naraḥ na vo 'śvāḥ śrathayantāha sisrataḥ sadyo asyādhvanaḥ pāram aśnutha

translations.griffith: When, as the Sun hath risen up, ye take delight, O bounteous radiant Maruts, Heroes of the sky,  Your coursers weary not when speeding onṭheir way, and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.

verses.sanskrit: अंसेषु व रष्टयः पत्सु खादयो वक्षस्सु रुक्मा मरुतो रथे शुभः अग्निभ्राजसो विद्युतो गभस्त्योः शिप्राः शीर्षसु वितता हिरण्ययीः |||
verses.transliteration: aṃseṣu va ṛṣṭayaḥ patsu khādayo vakṣassu rukmā maruto rathe śubhaḥ aghnibhrājaso vidyuto ghabhastyoḥ śiprāḥ śīrṣasu vitatā hiraṇyayīḥ

translations.griffith: Lances are on your shoulders, anklets on your feet, gold chains are on your breasts, gems, Maruts, on your car.  Lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands, and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your heads.

verses.sanskrit: तं नाकम अर्यो अग्र्भीतशोचिषं रुशत पिप्पलम मरुतो वि धूनुथ सम अच्यन्त वर्जनातित्विषन्त यत सवरन्ति घोषं विततम रतायवः |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ nākam aryo aghṛbhītaśociṣaṃ ruśat pippalam maruto vi dhūnutha sam acyanta vṛjanātitviṣanta yat svaranti ghoṣaṃ vitatam ṛtāyavaḥ

translations.griffith: Maruts, in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven, splendid beyond conception, for its shining fruit.  They gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth. The Pious Ones send forth a far-resounding shout.

verses.sanskrit: युष्मादत्तस्य मरुतो विचेतसो रायः सयाम रथ्यो वयस्वतः न यो युछति तिष्यो यथा दिवो ऽसमे रारन्त मरुतः सहस्रिणम |||
verses.transliteration: yuṣmādattasya maruto vicetaso rāyaḥ syāma rathyo vayasvataḥ na yo yuchati tiṣyo yathā divo 'sme rāranta marutaḥ sahasriṇam

translations.griffith: Sage Maruts, may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful I of life that have been given by you.  O Maruts, let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like Tisya from the sky.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं रयिम मरुत सपार्हवीरं यूयम रषिम अवथ सामविप्रम यूयम अर्वन्तम भरताय वाजं यूयं धत्थ राजानं शरुष्टिमन्तम |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ rayim maruta spārhavīraṃ yūyam ṛṣim avatha sāmavipram yūyam arvantam bharatāya vājaṃ yūyaṃ dhattha rājānaṃ śruṣṭimantam

translations.griffith: Maruts, ye further wealth with longedfor heroes, further the Ṛṣi skilled in chanted verses.  Ye give the Bhārata as his strength, a charger, and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.

verses.sanskrit: तद वो यामि दरविणं सद्यूतयो येना सवर ण ततनाम नॄंर अभि इदं सु मे मरुतो हर्यता वचो यस्य तरेम तरसा शतं हिमाः |||
verses.transliteration: tad vo yāmi draviṇaṃ sadyaūtayo yenā svar ṇa tatanāma nṝṃr abhi idaṃ su me maruto haryatā vaco yasya tarema tarasā śataṃ himāḥ

translations.griffith: Of you, most swift to succour! I solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the Sun.  Accept, O Maruts, graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.

verses.sanskrit: परयज्यवो मरुतो भराजद्र्ष्टयो बर्हद वयो दधिरे रुक्मवक्षसः ईयन्ते अश्वैः सुयमेभिर आशुभिः शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: prayajyavo maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayo bṛhad vayo dadhire rukmavakṣasaḥ īyante aśvaiḥ suyamebhir āśubhiḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: WITH gleaming lances, with their breasts adorned with gold, the Maruts, rushing onward, hold high power of life.  They hasten with swift steeds easy to be controlled. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: सवयं दधिध्वे तविषीं यथा विद बर्हन महान्त उर्विया वि राजथ उतान्तरिक्षम ममिरे वय ओजसा शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: svayaṃ dadhidhve taviṣīṃ yathā vida bṛhan mahānta urviyā vi rājatha utāntarikṣam mamire vy ojasā śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: Ye, as ye wist, have gained of your own selves your power: high, O ye Mighty Ones, and wide ye shine abroad.  They with their strength have even measured out the sky.  Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: साकं जाताः सुभ्वः साकम उक्षिताः शरिये चिद आ परतरं वाव्र्धुर नरः विरोकिणः सूर्यस्येव रश्मयः शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: sākaṃ jātāḥ subhvaḥ sākam ukṣitāḥ śriye cid ā prataraṃ vāvṛdhur naraḥ virokiṇaḥ sūryasyeva raśmayaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: Strong, born together, they together have waxed great: the Heroes more and more have grown to majesty  Resplendent as the Sun's beams in their light are they. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: आभूषेण्यं वो मरुतो महित्वनं दिद्र्क्षेण्यं सूर्यस्येव चक्षणम उतो अस्मां अम्र्तत्वे दधातन शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: ābhūṣeṇyaṃ vo maruto mahitvanaṃ didṛkṣeṇyaṃ sūryasyeva cakṣaṇam uto asmāṃ amṛtatve dadhātana śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: Maruts, your mightiness deserves to be adored, sight to be longed for like the shining of the Sun.  So lead us with your aid to immortality.  Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: उद ईरयथा मरुतः समुद्रतो यूयं वर्ष्टिं वर्षयथा पुरीषिणः न वो दस्रा उप दस्यन्ति धेनवः शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: ud īrayathā marutaḥ samudrato yūyaṃ vṛṣṭiṃ varṣayathā purīṣiṇaḥ na vo dasrā upa dasyanti dhenavaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: O Maruts, from the Ocean ye uplift the rain, and fraught with vaporous moisture pour the torrents down.  Never, ye Wonder-Workers, are your Milch-kine dry. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: यद अश्वान धूर्षु पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वं हिरण्ययान परत्य अत्कां अमुग्ध्वम विश्वा इत सप्र्धो मरुतो वय अस्यथ शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: yad aśvān dhūrṣu pṛṣatīr ayughdhvaṃ hiraṇyayān praty atkāṃ amughdhvam viśvā it spṛdho maruto vy asyatha śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: When to your car-poles ye have yoked your spotted deer to be your steeds, and put your golden mantles on,  O Maruts, ye disperse all enemies abroad. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: न पर्वता न नद्यो वरन्त वो यत्राचिध्वम मरुतो गछथेद उ तत उत दयावाप्र्थिवी याथना परि शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: na parvatā na nadyo varanta vo yatrācidhvam maruto ghachathed u tat uta dyāvāpṛthivī yāthanā pari śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: Neither the mountains nor the rivers keep you back: whither ye have resolved thither ye, Maruts, go.  Ye compass round about even the heaven and earth. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.  Whate’er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate’er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth,  They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: यत पूर्व्यम मरुतो यच च नूतनं यद उद्यते वसवो यच च शस्यते विश्वस्य तस्य भवथा नवेदसः शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: yat pūrvyam maruto yac ca nūtanaṃ yad udyate vasavo yac ca śasyate viśvasya tasya bhavathā navedasaḥ śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: Be gracious unto us, ye Maruts, slay us not extend ye unto us shelter of many a sort.  Pay due regard unto our friendship and our praise. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit: मर्ळत नो मरुतो मा वधिष्टनास्मभ्यं शर्म बहुलं वि यन्तन अधि सतोत्रस्य सख्यस्य गातन शुभं याताम अनु रथा अव्र्त्सत |||
verses.transliteration: mṛḷata no maruto mā vadhiṣṭanāsmabhyaṃ śarma bahulaṃ vi yantana adhi stotrasya sakhyasya ghātana śubhaṃ yātām anu rathā avṛtsata

translations.griffith: O Maruts, lead us on to higher fortune deliver us, when lauded, from afflictions.  Accept, ye Holy Ones, the gifts we bring you. May we be masters of abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit: यूयम अस्मान नयत वस्यो अछा निर अंहतिभ्यो मरुतो गर्णानाः जुषध्वं नो हव्यदातिं यजत्रा वयं सयाम पतयो रयीणाम |||
verses.transliteration: yūyam asmān nayata vasyo achā nir aṃhatibhyo maruto ghṛṇānāḥ juṣadhvaṃ no havyadātiṃ yajatrā vayaṃ syāma patayo rayīṇām

translations.griffith: Missing line from Griffith.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने शर्धन्तम आ गणम पिष्टं रुक्मेभिर अञ्जिभिः विशो अद्य मरुताम अव हवये दिवश चिद रोचनाद अधि |||
verses.transliteration: aghne śardhantam ā ghaṇam piṣṭaṃ rukmebhir añjibhiḥ viśo adya marutām ava hvaye divaś cid rocanād adhi

translations.griffith: AGNI, that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold,  The people of the Maruts, I call down to-day even from the luminous realm of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: यथा चिन मन्यसे हर्दा तद इन मे जग्मुर आशसः ये ते नेदिष्ठं हवनान्य आगमन तान वर्ध भीमसंद्र्शः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā cin manyase hṛdā tad in me jaghmur āśasaḥ ye te nediṣṭhaṃ havanāny āghaman tān vardha bhīmasaṃdṛśaḥ

translations.griffith: Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, thither my wishes also tend.  Those who have come most near to thine invoking calls, strengthen them fearful to behold.

verses.sanskrit: मीळ्हुष्मतीव पर्थिवी पराहता मदन्त्य एत्य अस्मद आ रक्षो न वो मरुतः शिमीवां अमो दुध्रो गौर इव भीमयुः |||
verses.transliteration: mīḷhuṣmatīva pṛthivī parāhatā madanty ety asmad ā ṛkṣo na vo marutaḥ śimīvāṃ amo dudhro ghaur iva bhīmayuḥ

translations.griffith: Earth, like a bounteous lady, liberal of her gifts, struck down and shaken, yet exultant, comes to us.  Impetuous as a bear, O Maruts, is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull..

verses.sanskrit: नि ये रिणन्त्य ओजसा वर्था गावो न दुर्धुरः अश्मानं चित सवर्यम पर्वतं गिरिम पर चयावयन्ति यामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: ni ye riṇanty ojasā vṛthā ghāvo na durdhuraḥ aśmānaṃ cit svaryam parvataṃ ghirim pra cyāvayanti yāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: They who with mighty strength o’erthrow like oxen difficult to yoke,  Cause e’en the heavenly stone to shake ' yea, shake the rocky mountain as they race along.

verses.sanskrit: उत तिष्ठ नूनम एषां सतोमैः समुक्षितानाम मरुताम पुरुतमम अपूर्व्यं गवां सर्गम इव हवये |||
verses.transliteration: ut tiṣṭha nūnam eṣāṃ stomaiḥ samukṣitānām marutām purutamam apūrvyaṃ ghavāṃ sargham iva hvaye

translations.griffith: Rise up! even now with lauds I call the very numerous company,  Unequalled, of these Maruts, like a herd of kine, grown up together in their strength.

verses.sanskrit: युङगध्वं हय अरुषी रथे युङगध्वं रथेषु रोहितः युङगध्वं हरी अजिरा धुरि वोळ्हवे वहिष्ठा धुरि वोळ्हवे |||
verses.transliteration: yuṅghdhvaṃ hy aruṣī rathe yuṅghdhvaṃ ratheṣu rohitaḥ yuṅghdhvaṃ harī ajirā dhuri voḷhave vahiṣṭhā dhuri voḷhave

translations.griffith: Bind to your car the bright red mares, yoke the red coursers to your car.  Bind to the pole, to draw, the fleet-foot tawny steeds, the best at drawing, to the pole.

verses.sanskrit: उत सय वाज्य अरुषस तुविष्वणिर इह सम धायि दर्शतः मा वो यामेषु मरुतश चिरं करत पर तं रथेषु चोदत |||
verses.transliteration: uta sya vājy aruṣas tuviṣvaṇir iha sma dhāyi darśataḥ mā vo yāmeṣu marutaś ciraṃ karat pra taṃ ratheṣu codata

translations.griffith: Yea, and this loudly-neighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned, fair to see,  Let him not cause delay, O Maruts,, in your course, urge ye him onward in your cars.

verses.sanskrit: रथं नु मारुतं वयं शरवस्युम आ हुवामहे आ यस्मिन तस्थौ सुरणानि बिभ्रती सचा मरुत्सु रोदसी |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ nu mārutaṃ vayaṃ śravasyum ā huvāmahe ā yasmin tasthau suraṇāni bibhratī sacā marutsu rodasī

translations.griffith: The Maruts’ chariot, ever fain to gather glory, we invoke,  Which Rodasī hath mounted, bringing pleasant gifts, with Maruts in her company.

verses.sanskrit: तं वः शर्धं रथेशुभं तवेषम पनस्युम आ हुवे यस्मिन सुजाता सुभगा महीयते सचा मरुत्सु मीळ्हुषी |||
verses.transliteration: taṃ vaḥ śardhaṃ ratheśubhaṃ tveṣam panasyum ā huve yasmin sujātā subhaghā mahīyate sacā marutsu mīḷhuṣī

translations.griffith: I call that brilliant band of yours, adorable, rapid on the car  Whereon the bounteous Dame, auspicious, nobly born, shows glorious with the Marut host.

verses.sanskrit: आ रुद्रास इन्द्रवन्तः सजोषसो हिरण्यरथाः सुविताय गन्तन इयं वो अस्मत परति हर्यते मतिस तर्ष्णजे न दिव उत्सा उदन्यवे |||
verses.transliteration: ā rudrāsa indravantaḥ sajoṣaso hiraṇyarathāḥ suvitāya ghantana iyaṃ vo asmat prati haryate matis tṛṣṇaje na diva utsā udanyave

translations.griffith: OF one accord, with Indra, O ye Rudras, come borne on your golden car for our prosperity.  An offering from us, this hymn is brought to you, as, unto one who th irsts for water, heavenly springs.

verses.sanskrit: वाशीमन्त रष्टिमन्तो मनीषिणः सुधन्वान इषुमन्तो निषङगिणः सवश्वा सथ सुरथाः पर्श्निमातरः सवायुधा मरुतो याथना शुभम |||
verses.transliteration: vāśīmanta ṛṣṭimanto manīṣiṇaḥ sudhanvāna iṣumanto niṣaṅghiṇaḥ svaśvā stha surathāḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ svāyudhā maruto yāthanā śubham

translations.griffith: Armed with your daggers, full of wisdom, armed with spears, armed with your quivers, armed with arrows, with good bows,  Good horses and good cars have ye, O Pṛśni's Sons: ye, Maruts, with good weapons go to victory.

verses.sanskrit: धूनुथ दयाम पर्वतान दाशुषे वसु नि वो वना जिहते यामनो भिया कोपयथ पर्थिवीम पर्श्निमातरः शुभे यद उग्राः पर्षतीर अयुग्ध्वम |||
verses.transliteration: dhūnutha dyām parvatān dāśuṣe vasu ni vo vanā jihate yāmano bhiyā kopayatha pṛthivīm pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhe yad ughrāḥ pṛṣatīr ayughdhvam

translations.griffith: From hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper: in terror at your coming low the woods bow down.  Ye make the earth to tremble, Sons of Pṛśni, when for victory ye have yoked, fierce Ones! your spotted deer.

verses.sanskrit: वातत्विषो मरुतो वर्षनिर्णिजो यमा इव सुसद्र्शः सुपेशसः पिशङगाश्वा अरुणाश्वा अरेपसः परत्वक्षसो महिना दयौर इवोरवः |||
verses.transliteration: vātatviṣo maruto varṣanirṇijo yamā iva susadṛśaḥ supeśasaḥ piśaṅghāśvā aruṇāśvā arepasaḥ pratvakṣaso mahinā dyaur ivoravaḥ

translations.griffith: Bright with the blasts of wind, wrapped in their robes of rain, like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form,  The Maruts, spotless, with steeds tawnyhued and red, strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven.

verses.sanskrit: पुरुद्रप्सा अञ्जिमन्तः सुदानवस तवेषसंद्र्शो अनवभ्रराधसः सुजातासो जनुषा रुक्मवक्षसो दिवो अर्का अम्र्तं नाम भेजिरे |||
verses.transliteration: purudrapsā añjimantaḥ sudānavas tveṣasaṃdṛśo anavabhrarādhasaḥ sujātāso januṣā rukmavakṣaso divo arkā amṛtaṃ nāma bhejire

translations.griffith: Rich in adornment, rich in drops, munificent, bright in their aspect, yielding bounties that endure,  Noble by birth, adorned with gold upon their breasts, the Singers of the sky have won immortal fame.

verses.sanskrit: रष्टयो वो मरुतो अंसयोर अधि सह ओजो बाह्वोर वो बलं हितम नर्म्णा शीर्षस्व आयुधा रथेषु वो विश्वा वः शरीर अधि तनूषु पिपिशे |||
verses.transliteration: ṛṣṭayo vo maruto aṃsayor adhi saha ojo bāhvor vo balaṃ hitam nṛmṇā śīrṣasv āyudhā ratheṣu vo viśvā vaḥ śrīr adhi tanūṣu pipiśe

translations.griffith: Borne on both shoulders, O ye Maruts, are your spears: within your arms is laid your energy and 3trength.  Bold thoughts are in your heads, your weapons in your cars, all glorious majesty is moulded on your forms.

verses.sanskrit: गोमद अश्वावद रथवत सुवीरं चन्द्रवद राधो मरुतो ददा नः परशस्तिं नः कर्णुत रुद्रियासो भक्षीय वो ऽवसो दैव्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: ghomad aśvāvad rathavat suvīraṃ candravad rādho maruto dadā naḥ praśastiṃ naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāso bhakṣīya vo 'vaso daivyasya

translations.griffith: Vouchsafe to us, O Maruts, splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds, in cars and heroes.  Children of Rudra, give us high distinction: may I enjoy your Godlike help and favour.

verses.sanskrit: हये नरो मरुतो मर्ळता नस तुवीमघासो अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः सत्यश्रुतः कवयो युवानो बर्हद्गिरयो बर्हद उक्षमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadghirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures,  Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

verses.sanskrit: तम उ नूनं तविषीमन्तम एषां सतुषे गणम मारुतं नव्यसीनाम य आश्वश्वा अमवद वहन्त उतेशिरे अम्र्तस्य सवराजः |||
verses.transliteration: tam u nūnaṃ taviṣīmantam eṣāṃ stuṣe ghaṇam mārutaṃ navyasīnām ya āśvaśvā amavad vahanta uteśire amṛtasya svarājaḥ

translations.griffith: Now do I glorify their mighty cohort, the company of these the youthful Maruts,  Who ride impetuous on with rapid horses, and radiant in themselves, are Lords of Amṛta.

verses.sanskrit: तवेषं गणं तवसं खादिहस्तं धुनिव्रतम मायिनं दातिवारम मयोभुवो ये अमिता महित्वा वन्दस्व विप्र तुविराधसो नॄन |||
verses.transliteration: tveṣaṃ ghaṇaṃ tavasaṃ khādihastaṃ dhunivratam māyinaṃ dātivāram mayobhuvo ye amitā mahitvā vandasva vipra tuvirādhaso nṝn

translations.griffith: The mighty glittering band, arm-bound with bracelets, givers of bliss, unmeasured in their greatness,  With magical powers, bountiful, ever-roaring,—these, liberal Heroes, venerate thou singer.

verses.sanskrit: आ वो यन्तूदवाहासो अद्य वर्ष्टिं ये विश्वे मरुतो जुनन्ति अयं यो अग्निर मरुतः समिद्ध एतं जुषध्वं कवयो युवानः |||
verses.transliteration: ā vo yantūdavāhāso adya vṛṣṭiṃ ye viśve maruto junanti ayaṃ yo aghnir marutaḥ samiddha etaṃ juṣadhvaṃ kavayo yuvānaḥ

translations.griffith: This day may all your water-bringers, Maruts, they who impel the falling rain, approach us.  This fire, O Maruts, hath been duly kindled; let it find favour with you, youthful Sages.

verses.sanskrit: यूयं राजानम इर्यं जनाय विभ्वतष्टं जनयथा यजत्राः युष्मद एति मुष्टिहा बाहुजूतो युष्मद सदश्वो मरुतः सुवीरः |||
verses.transliteration: yūyaṃ rājānam iryaṃ janāya vibhvataṣṭaṃ janayathā yajatrāḥ yuṣmad eti muṣṭihā bāhujūto yuṣmad sadaśvo marutaḥ suvīraḥ

translations.griffith: Ye raise up for the folk an active ruler whom, Holy Ones! a Master's hand hath fashioned.  Ye send the fighter hand to hand, armmighty, and the brave hero, Maruts with good horses.

verses.sanskrit: अरा इवेद अचरमा अहेव पर-पर जायन्ते अकवा महोभिः पर्श्नेः पुत्रा उपमासो रभिष्ठाः सवया मत्या मरुतः सम मिमिक्षुः |||
verses.transliteration: arā ived acaramā aheva pra-pra jāyante akavā mahobhiḥ pṛśneḥ putrā upamāso rabhiṣṭhāḥ svayā matyā marutaḥ sam mimikṣuḥ

translations.griffith: They spring forth more and more, strong in their glories, like days, like spokes where none are last in order.  Highest and mightiest are the Sons of Pṛśni. Firm to their own intention cling the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit: यत परायासिष्ट पर्षतीभिर अश्वैर वीळुपविभिर मरुतो रथेभिः कषोदन्त आपो रिणते वनान्य अवोस्रियो वर्षभः करन्दतु दयौः |||
verses.transliteration: yat prāyāsiṣṭa pṛṣatībhir aśvair vīḷupavibhir maruto rathebhiḥ kṣodanta āpo riṇate vanāny avosriyo vṛṣabhaḥ krandatu dyauḥ

translations.griffith: When ye have hastened on with spotted coursers, O Maruts, on your cars with strong-wrought fellies,  The waters are disturbed, the woods are shattered. Let Dyaus the Red Steer send his thunder downward.

verses.sanskrit: परथिष्ट यामन पर्थिवी चिद एषाम भर्तेव गर्भं सवम इच छवो धुः वातान हय अश्वान धुर्य रयुयुज्रे वर्षं सवेदं चक्रिरे रुद्रियासः |||
verses.transliteration: prathiṣṭa yāman pṛthivī cid eṣām bharteva gharbhaṃ svam ic chavo dhuḥ vātān hy aśvān dhury ṛyuyujre varṣaṃ svedaṃ cakrire rudriyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: Even Earth hath spread herself wide at their coming, and they as husbands have with power impregned her.  They to the pole have yoked the winds for coursers: their sweat have they made rain, these Sons of Rudra.

verses.sanskrit: हये नरो मरुतो मर्ळता नस तुवीमघासो अम्र्ता रतज्ञाः सत्यश्रुतः कवयो युवानो बर्हद्गिरयो बर्हद उक्षमाणाः |||
verses.transliteration: haye naro maruto mṛḷatā nas tuvīmaghāso amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yuvāno bṛhadghirayo bṛhad ukṣamāṇāḥ

translations.griffith: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures,  Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

verses.sanskrit: पर व सपळ अक्रन सुविताय दावने ऽरचा दिवे पर पर्थिव्या रतम भरे उक्षन्ते अश्वान तरुषन्त आ रजो ऽनु सवम भानुं शरथयन्ते अर्णवैः |||
verses.transliteration: pra va spaḷ akran suvitāya dāvane 'rcā dive pra pṛthivyā ṛtam bhare ukṣante aśvān taruṣanta ā rajo 'nu svam bhānuṃ śrathayante arṇavaiḥ

translations.griffith: YOUR spy hath called to you to give prosperity. I sing to Heaven and Earth and offer sacrifice.  They bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament: they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud.

verses.sanskrit: अमाद एषाम भियसा भूमिर एजति नौर न पूर्णा कषरति वयथिर यती दूरेद्र्शो ये चितयन्त एमभिर अन्तर महे विदथे येतिरे नरः |||
verses.transliteration: amād eṣām bhiyasā bhūmir ejati naur na pūrṇā kṣarati vyathir yatī dūredṛśo ye citayanta emabhir antar mahe vidathe yetire naraḥ

translations.griffith: Earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush, like a full ship which, quivering, lets the water in.  Marked on their ways are they, visible from afar: the Heroes press between in mighty armament.

verses.sanskrit: गवाम इव शरियसे शर्ङगम उत्तमं सूर्यो न चक्षू रजसो विसर्जने अत्या इव सुभ्वश चारव सथन मर्या इव शरियसे चेतथा नरः |||
verses.transliteration: ghavām iva śriyase śṛṅgham uttamaṃ sūryo na cakṣū rajaso visarjane atyā iva subhvaś cārava sthana maryā iva śriyase cetathā naraḥ

translations.griffith: As the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might, as the Sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse,  Like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold, and for your glory show like bridegrooms, O ye Men.

verses.sanskrit: को वो महान्ति महताम उद अश्नवत कस काव्या मरुतः को ह पौंस्या यूयं ह भूमिं किरणं न रेजथ पर यद भरध्वे सुविताय दावने |||
verses.transliteration: ko vo mahānti mahatām ud aśnavat kas kāvyā marutaḥ ko ha pauṃsyā yūyaṃ ha bhūmiṃ kiraṇaṃ na rejatha pra yad bharadhve suvitāya dāvane

translations.griffith: Who, O ye Maruts, may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty, who may reach your manly deeds?  Ye, verily, make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity,

verses.sanskrit: अश्वा इवेद अरुषासः सबन्धवः शूरा इव परयुधः परोत युयुधुः मर्या इव सुव्र्धो वाव्र्धुर नरः सूर्यस्य चक्षुः पर मिनन्ति वर्ष्टिभिः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvā ived aruṣāsaḥ sabandhavaḥ śūrā iva prayudhaḥ prota yuyudhuḥ maryā iva suvṛdho vāvṛdhur naraḥ sūryasya cakṣuḥ pra minanti vṛṣṭibhiḥ

translations.griffith: Like steeds of ruddy colour, scions of one race, as foremost champions they have battled in the van.  The Heroes have waxed strong like we.1grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the Sun's eye fade away,

verses.sanskrit: ते अज्येष्ठा अकनिष्ठास उद्भिदो ऽमध्यमासो महसा वि वाव्र्धुः सुजातासो जनुषा पर्श्निमातरो दिवो मर्या आ नो अछा जिगातन |||
verses.transliteration: te ajyeṣṭhā akaniṣṭhāsa udbhido 'madhyamāso mahasā vi vāvṛdhuḥ sujātāso januṣā pṛśnimātaro divo maryā ā no achā jighātana

translations.griffith: Having no eldest and no youngest in their band, no middlomost, preeminent they have waxed in might,  These Sons of Pṛśni, sprung of noble ancestry: come hitberward to us, ye bridegrooms of the sky.

verses.sanskrit: वयो न ये शरेणीः पप्तुर ओजसान्तान दिवो बर्हतः सानुनस परि अश्वास एषाम उभये यथा विदुः पर पर्वतस्य नभनूंर अचुच्यवुः |||
verses.transliteration: vayo na ye śreṇīḥ paptur ojasāntān divo bṛhataḥ sānunas pari aśvāsa eṣām ubhaye yathā viduḥ pra parvatasya nabhanūṃr acucyavuḥ

translations.griffith: Like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the sky.  The steeds who carry them, as Gods and mortals know, have caused the waters of the mounuains to desGend.

verses.sanskrit: मिमातु दयौर अदितिर वीतये नः सं दानुचित्रा उषसो यतन्ताम आचुच्यवुर दिव्यं कोशम एत रषे रुद्रस्य मरुतो गर्णानाः |||
verses.transliteration: mimātu dyaur aditir vītaye naḥ saṃ dānucitrā uṣaso yatantām ācucyavur divyaṃ kośam eta ṛṣe rudrasya maruto ghṛṇānāḥ

translations.griffith: May Dyaus, the Infinite, roar for our banquet: may Dawns toil for us, glittering with moisture.  Lauded by thee, these Maruts, Sons o Rudra, O Ṛṣi, have sent down the heavenly treasure.

verses.sanskrit: ईळे अग्निं सववसं नमोभिर इह परसत्तो वि चयत कर्तं नः रथैर इव पर भरे वाजयद्भिः परदक्षिणिन मरुतां सतोमम रध्याम |||
verses.transliteration: īḷe aghniṃ svavasaṃ namobhir iha prasatto vi cayat kṛtaṃ naḥ rathair iva pra bhare vājayadbhiḥ pradakṣiṇin marutāṃ stomam ṛdhyām

translations.griffith: I LAUD with reverence the gracious Agni: here may he sit and part our meed among us.  As with spoil-seeking cars I bring oblation: turned rightward I will swell the Marut's, praise-song.

verses.sanskrit: आ ये तस्थुः पर्षतीषु शरुतासु सुखेषु रुद्रा मरुतो रथेषु वना चिद उग्रा जिहते नि वो भिया पर्थिवी चिद रेजते पर्वतश चित |||
verses.transliteration: ā ye tasthuḥ pṛṣatīṣu śrutāsu sukheṣu rudrā maruto ratheṣu vanā cid ughrā jihate ni vo bhiyā pṛthivī cid rejate parvataś cit

translations.griffith: The Maruts, yea, the Rudras, who have mounted their famous spotted deer and cars swift-moving,—  Before you, fierce Ones! woods bow down in terror: Earth, even the mountain, trembles at your coming.

verses.sanskrit: पर्वतश चिन महि वर्द्धो बिभाय दिवश चित सानु रेजत सवने वः यत करीळथ मरुत रष्टिमन्त आप इव सध्र्यञ्चो धवध्वे |||
verses.transliteration: parvataś cin mahi vṛddho bibhāya divaś cit sānu rejata svane vaḥ yat krīḷatha maruta ṛṣṭimanta āpa iva sadhryañco dhavadhve

translations.griffith: Though vast and tall, the mountain is affrighted, the height of heaven is shaken at your roaring  When, armed with lances, ye are sporting, Maruts, and rush along together like the waters.

verses.sanskrit: वरा इवेद रैवतासो हिरण्यैर अभि सवधाभिस तन्वः पिपिश्रे शरिये शरेयांसस तवसो रथेषु सत्रा महांसि चक्रिरे तनूषु |||
verses.transliteration: varā ived raivatāso hiraṇyair abhi svadhābhis tanvaḥ pipiśre śriye śreyāṃsas tavaso ratheṣu satrā mahāṃsi cakrire tanūṣu

translations.griffith: They, like young suitors, sons of wealthy houses, have with their golden natures decked their bodies.  Strong on their cars, the lordly Ones, for glory, have set their splendours on their forms for ever.

verses.sanskrit: अज्येष्ठासो अकनिष्ठास एते सम भरातरो वाव्र्धुः सौभगाय युवा पिता सवपा रुद्र एषां सुदुघा पर्श्निः सुदिना मरुद्भ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: ajyeṣṭhāso akaniṣṭhāsa ete sam bhrātaro vāvṛdhuḥ saubhaghāya yuvā pitā svapā rudra eṣāṃ sudughā pṛśniḥ sudinā marudbhyaḥ

translations.griffith: None being eldest, none among them youngest, as brothers they have grown to happy fortune.  May their Sire Rudra, young and deft, and Pṛśni pouring much milk, bring fair days to the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit: यद उत्तमे मरुतो मध्यमे वा यद वावमे सुभगासो दिवि षठ अतो नो रुद्रा उत वा नव अस्याग्ने वित्ताद धविषो यद यजाम |||
verses.transliteration: yad uttame maruto madhyame vā yad vāvame subhaghāso divi ṣṭha ato no rudrā uta vā nv asyāghne vittād dhaviṣo yad yajāma

translations.griffith: Whether, O blessed Maruts, ye be dwelling in highest, midmost, or in lowest heaven,  Thence, O ye Rudras, and thou also, Agni, notice the sacrificial food we offer.

verses.sanskrit: अग्निश च यन मरुतो विश्ववेदसो दिवो वहध्व उत्तराद अधि षणुभिः ते मन्दसाना धुनयो रिशादसो वामं धत्त यजमानाय सुन्वते |||
verses.transliteration: aghniś ca yan maruto viśvavedaso divo vahadhva uttarād adhi ṣṇubhiḥ te mandasānā dhunayo riśādaso vāmaṃ dhatta yajamānāya sunvate

translations.griffith: O Maruts, Lords of all, when Agni and when ye drive downward from sublimest heaven along the heights,  Shakers of all, rejoicing, slayers of the foe, give riches to the Soma-pressing worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: अग्ने मरुद्भिः शुभयद्भिर रक्वभिः सोमम पिब मन्दसानो गणश्रिभिः पावकेभिर विश्वमिन्वेभिर आयुभिर वैश्वानर परदिवा केतुना सजूः |||
verses.transliteration: aghne marudbhiḥ śubhayadbhir ṛkvabhiḥ somam piba mandasāno ghaṇaśribhiḥ pāvakebhir viśvaminvebhir āyubhir vaiśvānara pradivā ketunā sajūḥ

translations.griffith: O Agni, with the Maruts as they gleam and sing, gathered in troop, rejoicing drink the Soma juice;  With these the living ones who cleanse and further all, joined with thy banner, O Vaiśvānara, from of old.

verses.sanskrit: के षठा नरः शरेष्ठतमा य एक-एक आयय परमस्याः परावतः |||
verses.transliteration: ke ṣṭhā naraḥ śreṣṭhatamā ya eka-eka āyaya paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ

translations.griffith: O HEROES lordliest of all, who are ye that have singly come  Forth from a region most remote?

verses.sanskrit: कव वो ऽशवाः कव्र्भीशवः कथं शेक कथा यय पर्ष्ठे सदो नसोर यमः |||
verses.transliteration: kva vo 'śvāḥ kvṛbhīśavaḥ kathaṃ śeka kathā yaya pṛṣṭhe sado nasor yamaḥ

translations.griffith: Where are your horses, where the reins? How came ye? how had ye the power?  Rein was on nose and seat on back.

verses.sanskrit: जघने चोद एषां वि सक्थानि नरो यमुः पुत्रक्र्थे न जनयः |||
verses.transliteration: jaghane coda eṣāṃ vi sakthāni naro yamuḥ putrakṛthe na janayaḥ

translations.griffith: The whip is laid upon the flank. The heroes stretch their thighs apart,  Like women when the babe is born.

verses.sanskrit: परा वीरास एतन मर्यासो भद्रजानयः अग्नितपो यथासथ |||
verses.transliteration: parā vīrāsa etana maryāso bhadrajānayaḥ aghnitapo yathāsatha

translations.griffith: Go ye, O Heroes, far away, ye bridegrooms with a lovely Spouse  That ye may warm you at the fire.

verses.sanskrit: सनत साश्व्यम पशुम उत गव्यं शतावयम शयावाश्वस्तुताय या दोर वीरायोपबर्ब्र्हत |||
verses.transliteration: sanat sāśvyam paśum uta ghavyaṃ śatāvayam śyāvāśvastutāya yā dor vīrāyopabarbṛhat

translations.griffith: May she gain cattle for her meed, hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine,  Who threw embracing arms around the hero whom gyavaiva praised.

verses.sanskrit: उत तवा सत्री शशीयसी पुंसो भवति वस्यसी अदेवत्राद अराधसः |||
verses.transliteration: uta tvā strī śaśīyasī puṃso bhavati vasyasī adevatrād arādhasaḥ

translations.griffith: Yea, many a woman is more firm and better than the man who turns  Away from Gods, andoffers not.

verses.sanskrit: वि या जानाति जसुरिं वि तर्ष्यन्तं वि कामिनम देवत्रा कर्णुते मनः |||
verses.transliteration: vi yā jānāti jasuriṃ vi tṛṣyantaṃ vi kāminam devatrā kṛṇute manaḥ

translations.griffith: She who discerns the weak and worn, the man who thirsts and is in want  She sets her mind upon the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: उत घा नेमो अस्तुतः पुमां इति बरुवे पणिः स वैरदेय इत समः |||
verses.transliteration: uta ghā nemo astutaḥ pumāṃ iti bruve paṇiḥ sa vairadeya it samaḥ

translations.griffith: And yet full many a one, unpraised, mean niggard, is entitled man:  Only in weregild is he such.

verses.sanskrit: उत मे ऽरपद युवतिर ममन्दुषी परति शयावाय वर्तनिम वि रोहिता पुरुमीळ्हाय येमतुर विप्राय दीर्घयशसे |||
verses.transliteration: uta me 'rapad yuvatir mamanduṣī prati śyāvāya vartanim vi rohitā purumīḷhāya yematur viprāya dīrghayaśase

translations.griffith: And she, the young, the joyous-spirited, divulged the path to Śyāva, yea, to me.  Two red steeds carried me to Purumīlha's side, that sage of far-extended fame,

verses.sanskrit: यो मे धेनूनां शतं वैददश्विर यथा ददत तरन्त इव मंहना |||
verses.transliteration: yo me dhenūnāṃ śataṃ vaidadaśvir yathā dadat taranta iva maṃhanā

translations.griffith: Him who, like Vaidadasvi, like Taranta, hath bestowed on me  A hundred cows in liberal gift.
