verses.sanskrit: य ईं वहन्त आशुभिः पिबन्तो मदिरम मधु अत्र शरवांसि दधिरे |||
verses.transliteration: ya īṃ vahanta āśubhiḥ pibanto madiram madhu atra śravāṃsi dadhire

translations.griffith: They who are borne by rapid steeds, drinking the meath that gives delight,  They have attained high glories here.

verses.sanskrit: येषां शरियाधि रोदसी विभ्राजन्ते रथेष्व आ दिवि रुक्म इवोपरि |||
verses.transliteration: yeṣāṃ śriyādhi rodasī vibhrājante ratheṣv ā divi rukma ivopari

translations.griffith: They by whose splendour both the worlds are over-spread they shine on cars  As the gold gleams above in heaven.

verses.sanskrit: युवा स मारुतो गणस तवेषरथो अनेद्यः शुभंयावाप्रतिष्कुतः |||
verses.transliteration: yuvā sa māruto ghaṇas tveṣaratho anedyaḥ śubhaṃyāvāpratiṣkutaḥ

translations.griffith: That Marut band is ever young, borne on bright cars, unblamable,  Moving to victory, checked by none.

verses.sanskrit: को वेद नूनम एषां यत्रा मदन्ति धूतयः रतजाता अरेपसः |||
verses.transliteration: ko veda nūnam eṣāṃ yatrā madanti dhūtayaḥ ṛtajātā arepasaḥ

translations.griffith: Who knoweth, verily, of these where the All-shakers take delight,  Born, spotless, after sacred Law?

verses.sanskrit: यूयम मर्तं विपन्यवः परणेतार इत्था धिया शरोतारो यामहूतिषु |||
verses.transliteration: yūyam martaṃ vipanyavaḥ praṇetāra itthā dhiyā śrotāro yāmahūtiṣu

translations.griffith: Guides are ye, lovers of the song to mortal man through holy hymn,  And hearers when he cries for help.

verses.sanskrit: ते नो वसूनि काम्या पुरुश्चन्द्रा रिशादसः आ यज्ञियासो वव्र्त्तन |||
verses.transliteration: te no vasūni kāmyā puruścandrā riśādasaḥ ā yajñiyāso vavṛttana

translations.griffith: Do ye, destroyers of the foe, worshipful and exceeding bright,  Send down the treasures that we crave.

verses.sanskrit: एतम मे सतोमम ऊर्म्ये दार्भ्याय परा वह गिरो देवि रथीर इव |||
verses.transliteration: etam me stomam ūrmye dārbhyāya parā vaha ghiro devi rathīr iva

translations.griffith: OUrmya, bear thou far away to Darbhya this my hymn of praise,  Songs, Goddess, as if chariot-borne.

verses.sanskrit: उत मे वोचताद इति सुतसोमे रथवीतौ न कामो अप वेति मे |||
verses.transliteration: uta me vocatād iti sutasome rathavītau na kāmo apa veti me

translations.griffith: From me to Rathaviti say, when he hath pressed the Soma juice,  The wish I had departeth not.

verses.sanskrit: एष कषेति रथवीतिर मघवा गोमतीर अनु पर्वतेष्व अपश्रितः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣa kṣeti rathavītir maghavā ghomatīr anu parvateṣv apaśritaḥ

translations.griffith: This wealthy Rathaviti dwells among the people rich in kine,  Among the mountains, far withdrawn.

verses.sanskrit: रतेन रतम अपिहितं धरुवं वां सूर्यस्य यत्र विमुचन्त्य अश्वान दश शता सह तस्थुस तद एकं देवानां शरेष्ठं वपुषाम अपश्यम |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtena ṛtam apihitaṃ dhruvaṃ vāṃ sūryasya yatra vimucanty aśvān daśa śatā saha tasthus tad ekaṃ devānāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ vapuṣām apaśyam

translations.griffith: BY your high Law firm order is established there where they loose for travel Sūrya's horses.  Ten hundred stood together: there I looked on this the most marvellous Deities' one chief glory.

verses.sanskrit: तत सु वाम मित्रावरुणा महित्वम ईर्मा तस्थुषीर अहभिर दुदुह्रे विश्वाः पिन्वथः सवसरस्य धेना अनु वाम एकः पविर आ ववर्त |||
verses.transliteration: tat su vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvam īrmā tasthuṣīr ahabhir duduhre viśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svasarasya dhenā anu vām ekaḥ pavir ā vavarta

translations.griffith: This, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your special greatness: floods that stood there they with the days attracted.  Ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen: your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.

verses.sanskrit: अधारयतम पर्थिवीम उत दयाम मित्रराजाना वरुणा महोभिः वर्धयतम ओषधीः पिन्वतं गा अव वर्ष्टिं सर्जतं जीरदानू |||
verses.transliteration: adhārayatam pṛthivīm uta dyām mitrarājānā varuṇā mahobhiḥ vardhayatam oṣadhīḥ pinvataṃ ghā ava vṛṣṭiṃ sṛjataṃ jīradānū

translations.griffith: O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye by your greatness, both Kings, have firmly stablished earth and heaven,  Ye caused the cows to stream, the plants to flourish, and, scattering swift drops, sent down the rain-flood.

verses.sanskrit: आ वाम अश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्तु यतरश्मय उप यन्त्व अर्वाक घर्तस्य निर्णिग अनु वर्तते वाम उप सिन्धवः परदिवि कषरन्ति |||
verses.transliteration: ā vām aśvāsaḥ suyujo vahantu yataraśmaya upa yantv arvāk ghṛtasya nirṇigh anu vartate vām upa sindhavaḥ pradivi kṣaranti

translations.griffith: Let your well-harnessed horses bear you hither: hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly.  A covering cloud of sacred oil attends you, and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.

verses.sanskrit: अनु शरुताम अमतिं वर्धद उर्वीम बर्हिर इव यजुषा रक्षमाणा नमस्वन्ता धर्तदक्षाधि गर्ते मित्रासाथे वरुणेळास्व अन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: anu śrutām amatiṃ vardhad urvīm barhir iva yajuṣā rakṣamāṇā namasvantā dhṛtadakṣādhi gharte mitrāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ

translations.griffith: To make the lustre wider and more famous, guarding the sacred grass with veneration,  Ye, Mitra-Varuṇa, firm, strong, awe-inspiring, are seated on a throne amid oblations.

verses.sanskrit: अक्रविहस्ता सुक्र्ते परस्पा यं तरासाथे वरुणेळास्व अन्तः राजाना कषत्रम अह्र्णीयमाना सहस्रस्थूणम बिभ्र्थः सह दवौ |||
verses.transliteration: akravihastā sukṛte paraspā yaṃ trāsāthe varuṇeḷāsv antaḥ rājānā kṣatram ahṛṇīyamānā sahasrasthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ saha dvau

translations.griffith: With hands that shed no blood, guarding the pious, whom, Varuni3, ye save amid oblations.  Ye Twain, together, Kings of willing spirit, uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यनिर्णिग अयो अस्य सथूणा वि भराजते दिव्य अश्वाजनीव भद्रे कषेत्रे निमिता तिल्विले वा सनेम मध्वो अधिगर्त्यस्य |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyanirṇigh ayo asya sthūṇā vi bhrājate divy aśvājanīva bhadre kṣetre nimitā tilvile vā sanema madhvo adhighartyasya

translations.griffith: Adorned with gold, its columns are of iron. in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses;  Or stablished on a field deep-spoiled and fruitful. So may we share the meath that loads your car-seat.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यरूपम उषसो वयुष्टाव अयस्थूणम उदिता सूर्यस्य आ रोहथो वरुण मित्र गर्तम अतश चक्षाथे अदितिं दितिं च |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyarūpam uṣaso vyuṣṭāv ayasthūṇam uditā sūryasya ā rohatho varuṇa mitra ghartam ataś cakṣāthe aditiṃ ditiṃ ca

translations.griffith: Ye mount your car gold-hued at break of morning, and iron-pillared when the Sun is setting,  And from that place, O Varuṇa and Mitra, behold infinity and limit~tion.

verses.sanskrit: यद बंहिष्ठं नातिविधे सुदानू अछिद्रं शर्म भुवनस्य गोपा तेन नो मित्रावरुणाव अविष्टं सिषासन्तो जिगीवांसः सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: yad baṃhiṣṭhaṃ nātividhe sudānū achidraṃ śarma bhuvanasya ghopā tena no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭaṃ siṣāsanto jighīvāṃsaḥ syāma

translations.griffith: Bountiful guardians of the world! the shelter that is impenetrable, strongest, flawless,  Aid us with that, O Varuṇa and Mitra, and when we long to win may we be victors.

verses.sanskrit: रतस्य गोपाव अधि तिष्ठथो रथं सत्यधर्माणा परमे वयोमनि यम अत्र मित्रावरुणावथो युवं तस्मै वर्ष्टिर मधुमत पिन्वते दिवः |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtasya ghopāv adhi tiṣṭhatho rathaṃ satyadharmāṇā parame vyomani yam atra mitrāvaruṇāvatho yuvaṃ tasmai vṛṣṭir madhumat pinvate divaḥ

translations.griffith: GUARDIANS of Order, ye whose Laws are ever true, in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend.  O Mitra-Varuṇa whomsoe’er ye: favour, here, to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.

verses.sanskrit: सम्राजाव अस्य भुवनस्य राजथो मित्रावरुणा विदथे सवर्द्र्शा वर्ष्टिं वां राधो अम्र्तत्वम ईमहे दयावाप्र्थिवी वि चरन्ति तन्यवः |||
verses.transliteration: samrājāv asya bhuvanasya rājatho mitrāvaruṇā vidathe svardṛśā vṛṣṭiṃ vāṃ rādho amṛtatvam īmahe dyāvāpṛthivī vi caranti tanyavaḥ

translations.griffith: This world's imperial Kings, O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye rule in holy synod, looking on the light.  We pray for rain, your boon, and immortality. Through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way.

verses.sanskrit: सम्राजा उग्रा वर्षभा दिवस पती पर्थिव्या मित्रावरुणा विचर्षणी चित्रेभिर अभ्रैर उप तिष्ठथो रवं दयां वर्षयथो असुरस्य मायया |||
verses.transliteration: samrājā ughrā vṛṣabhā divas patī pṛthivyā mitrāvaruṇā vicarṣaṇī citrebhir abhrair upa tiṣṭhatho ravaṃ dyāṃ varṣayatho asurasya māyayā

translations.griffith: Imperial Kings, strong, Heroes, Lords of earth and heaven, Mitra and Varuṇa, ye ever active Ones,  Ye wait on thunder with the many-tinted clouds, and by the Asura's magic power cause Heaven to rain.

verses.sanskrit: माया वाम मित्रावरुणा दिवि शरिता सूर्यो जयोतिश चरति चित्रम आयुधम तम अभ्रेण वर्ष्ट्या गूहथो दिवि पर्जन्य दरप्सा मधुमन्त ईरते |||
verses.transliteration: māyā vām mitrāvaruṇā divi śritā sūryo jyotiś carati citram āyudham tam abhreṇa vṛṣṭyā ghūhatho divi parjanya drapsā madhumanta īrate

translations.griffith: Your magic, Mitra-Varuṇa, resteth in the heaven. The Sun, the wondrous weapon, cometh forth as light.  Ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain, and water-drops, Parjanya! full of sweetness flow.

verses.sanskrit: रथं युञ्जते मरुतः शुभे सुखं शूरो न मित्रावरुणा गविष्टिषु रजांसि चित्रा वि चरन्ति तन्यवो दिवः सम्राजा पयसा न उक्षतम |||
verses.transliteration: rathaṃ yuñjate marutaḥ śubhe sukhaṃ śūro na mitrāvaruṇā ghaviṣṭiṣu rajāṃsi citrā vi caranti tanyavo divaḥ samrājā payasā na ukṣatam

translations.griffith: The Maruts yoke their easy car for victory, O Mitra-Varuṇa, as a hero in the wars.  The thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues. Imperial Kings, bedew us with the milk of heaven.

verses.sanskrit: वाचं सु मित्रावरुणाव इरावतीम पर्जन्यश चित्रां वदति तविषीमतीम अभ्रा वसत मरुतः सु मायया दयां वर्षयतम अरुणाम अरेपसम |||
verses.transliteration: vācaṃ su mitrāvaruṇāv irāvatīm parjanyaś citrāṃ vadati tviṣīmatīm abhrā vasata marutaḥ su māyayā dyāṃ varṣayatam aruṇām arepasam

translations.griffith: Refreshing is your voice, O Mitra-Varuṇa: Parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice.  With magic power the Maruts clothe them with the clouds. Ye Two cause Heaven to rain, the red, the spotless One.

verses.sanskrit: धर्मणा मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता वरता रक्षेथे असुरस्य मायया रतेन विश्वम भुवनं वि राजथः सूर्यम आ धत्थो दिवि चित्र्यं रथम |||
verses.transliteration: dharmaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vratā rakṣethe asurasya māyayā ṛtena viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājathaḥ sūryam ā dhattho divi citryaṃ ratham

translations.griffith: Wise, with your Law and through the Asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances, Mitra-Varuṇa.  Ye by eternal Order govern all the world. Ye set the Sun in heaven as a refulgent car.

verses.sanskrit: वरुणं वो रिशादसम रचा मित्रं हवामहे परि वरजेव बाह्वोर जगन्वांसा सवर्णरम |||
verses.transliteration: varuṇaṃ vo riśādasam ṛcā mitraṃ havāmahe pari vrajeva bāhvor jaghanvāṃsā svarṇaram

translations.griffith: You, foeman-slaying Varuṇa and Mitra, we invoke with song,  Who, as with penfold of your arms, encompass round the realm of light.

verses.sanskrit: ता बाहवा सुचेतुना पर यन्तम अस्मा अर्चते शेवं हि जार्यं वां विश्वासु कषासु जोगुवे |||
verses.transliteration: tā bāhavā sucetunā pra yantam asmā arcate śevaṃ hi jāryaṃ vāṃ viśvāsu kṣāsu joghuve

translations.griffith: Stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns,  For in all places is sung forth your evergracious friendliness.

verses.sanskrit: यन नूनम अश्यां गतिम मित्रस्य यायाम पथा अस्य परियस्य शर्मण्य अहिंसानस्य सश्चिरे |||
verses.transliteration: yan nūnam aśyāṃ ghatim mitrasya yāyām pathā asya priyasya śarmaṇy ahiṃsānasya saścire

translations.griffith: That I may gain a refuge now, may my steps be on Mitra's path.  Men go protected in the charge of this dear Friend who harms us not.

verses.sanskrit: युवाभ्याम मित्रावरुणोपमं धेयाम रचा यद ध कषये मघोनां सतोत्णां च सपूर्धसे |||
verses.transliteration: yuvābhyām mitrāvaruṇopamaṃ dheyām ṛcā yad dha kṣaye maghonāṃ stotṇāṃ ca spūrdhase

translations.griffith: Mitra and Varuṇa, from you may I, by song, win noblest meed.  That shall stir envy in the homes of wealthy chiefs and those who praise.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो मित्र सुदीतिभिर वरुणश च सधस्थ आ सवे कषये मघोनां सखीनां च वर्धसे |||
verses.transliteration: ā no mitra sudītibhir varuṇaś ca sadhastha ā sve kṣaye maghonāṃ sakhīnāṃ ca vṛdhase

translations.griffith: With your fair splendours, Varuṇa and Mitra, to our gathering come,  That in their homes the wealthy chiefs and they who are your friends may thrive.

verses.sanskrit: युवं नो येषु वरुण कषत्रम बर्हच च बिभ्र्थः उरु णो वाजसातये कर्तं राये सवस्तये |||
verses.transliteration: yuvaṃ no yeṣu varuṇa kṣatram bṛhac ca bibhṛthaḥ uru ṇo vājasātaye kṛtaṃ rāye svastaye

translations.griffith: With those, moreover, among whom ye hold your high supremacy,  Vouchsafe us room that we may win strength for prosperity and wealth.

verses.sanskrit: उछन्त्याम मे यजता देवक्षत्रे रुशद्गवि सुतं सोमं न हस्तिभिर आ पड्भिर धावतं नरा बिभ्रताव अर्चनानसम |||
verses.transliteration: uchantyām me yajatā devakṣatre ruśadghavi sutaṃ somaṃ na hastibhir ā paḍbhir dhāvataṃ narā bibhratāv arcanānasam

translations.griffith: When morning flushes, Holy Ones! in the Gods’ realm where white Cows shine,  Supporting Arcananas, speed, ye Heroes, with your active feet hither to my pressed Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: यश चिकेत स सुक्रतुर देवत्रा स बरवीतु नः वरुणो यस्य दर्शतो मित्रो वा वनते गिरः |||
verses.transliteration: yaś ciketa sa sukratur devatrā sa bravītu naḥ varuṇo yasya darśato mitro vā vanate ghiraḥ

translations.griffith: FULL wise is he who hath discerned: let him speak to us of the Gods,—  The man whose praise-songs Varuṇa the beautiful, or Mitra, loves.

verses.sanskrit: ता हि शरेष्ठवर्चसा राजाना दीर्घश्रुत्तमा ता सत्पती रताव्र्ध रतावाना जने-जने |||
verses.transliteration: tā hi śreṣṭhavarcasā rājānā dīrghaśruttamā tā satpatī ṛtāvṛdha ṛtāvānā jane-jane

translations.griffith: For they are Kings of noblest might, of glorious fame most widely spread;  Lords of the brave, who strengthen Law, the Holy Ones with every race.

verses.sanskrit: ता वाम इयानो ऽवसे पूर्वा उप बरुवे सचा सवश्वासः सु चेतुना वाजां अभि पर दावने |||
verses.transliteration: tā vām iyāno 'vase pūrvā upa bruve sacā svaśvāsaḥ su cetunā vājāṃ abhi pra dāvane

translations.griffith: Approaching you with prayer for aid, together I address you first  We who have good steeds call on you, Most Sage, to give us strength besides.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रो अंहोश चिद आद उरु कषयाय गातुं वनते मित्रस्य हि परतूर्वतः सुमतिर अस्ति विधतः |||
verses.transliteration: mitro aṃhoś cid ād uru kṣayāya ghātuṃ vanate mitrasya hi pratūrvataḥ sumatir asti vidhataḥ

translations.griffith: E’en out of misery Mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case,  For he who worships hath the grace of Mitra, fighter in the van. '

verses.sanskrit: वयम मित्रस्यावसि सयाम सप्रथस्तमे अनेहसस तवोतयः सत्रा वरुणशेषसः |||
verses.transliteration: vayam mitrasyāvasi syāma saprathastame anehasas tvotayaḥ satrā varuṇaśeṣasaḥ

translations.griffith: In Mitra's shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell,  Unmenaced, guarded by the care, ever as sons of Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit: युवम मित्रेमं जनं यतथः सं च नयथः मा मघोनः परि खयतम मो अस्माकम रषीणां गोपीथे न उरुष्यतम |||
verses.transliteration: yuvam mitremaṃ janaṃ yatathaḥ saṃ ca nayathaḥ mā maghonaḥ pari khyatam mo asmākam ṛṣīṇāṃ ghopīthe na uruṣyatam

translations.griffith: Ye, Mitra, urge this people on, and to one end direct their ways.  Neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs, neglect not us the Ṛṣis: be our guardians when ye quaff the milk.

verses.sanskrit: आ चिकितान सुक्रतू देवौ मर्त रिशादसा वरुणाय रतपेशसे दधीत परयसे महे |||
verses.transliteration: ā cikitāna sukratū devau marta riśādasā varuṇāya ṛtapeśase dadhīta prayase mahe

translations.griffith: O SAPIENT man, call the Two Gods, the very wise, who slay the foe.  For Varuṇa, whose form is Law, place offerings for his great delight.

verses.sanskrit: ता हि कषत्रम अविह्रुतं सम्यग असुर्यम आशाते अध वरतेव मानुषं सवर ण धायि दर्शतम |||
verses.transliteration: tā hi kṣatram avihrutaṃ samyagh asuryam āśāte adha vrateva mānuṣaṃ svar ṇa dhāyi darśatam

translations.griffith: For they have won unbroken sway in full perfection, power divine.  And, like high laws, the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.

verses.sanskrit: ता वाम एषे रथानाम उर्वीं गव्यूतिम एषाम रातहव्यस्य सुष्टुतिं दध्र्क सतोमैर मनामहे |||
verses.transliteration: tā vām eṣe rathānām urvīṃ ghavyūtim eṣām rātahavyasya suṣṭutiṃ dadhṛk stomair manāmahe

translations.griffith: Therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours-  You who accept the eulogy of Ratahavya with his hymns.

verses.sanskrit: अधा हि काव्या युवं दक्षस्य पूर्भिर अद्भुता नि केतुना जनानां चिकेथे पूतदक्षसा |||
verses.transliteration: adhā hi kāvyā yuvaṃ dakṣasya pūrbhir adbhutā ni ketunā janānāṃ cikethe pūtadakṣasā

translations.griffith: And ye show wMom, Wondrous Gods with fulness of intellIgence.  By men's discernment are Ve marked, O ye whose might is purified.

verses.sanskrit: तद रतम पर्थिवि बर्हच छरवेष रषीणाम जरयसानाव अरम पर्थ्व अति कषरन्ति यामभिः |||
verses.transliteration: tad ṛtam pṛthivi bṛhac chravaeṣa ṛṣīṇām jrayasānāv aram pṛthv ati kṣaranti yāmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: This is the Law sublime, O Earth: to aid the Ṛṣis’ toil for fame  The Two, wide-spreading, are prepared. They come with ample overflow.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद वाम ईयचक्षसा मित्र वयं च सूरयः वयचिष्ठे बहुपाय्ये यतेमहि सवराज्ये |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad vām īyacakṣasā mitra vayaṃ ca sūrayaḥ vyaciṣṭhe bahupāyye yatemahi svarājye

translations.griffith: Mitra, ye Gods with wandering eyes, would that the worshippers and we  Might strive to reach the realm ye rule, most spacious and protected well,

verses.sanskrit: बळ इत्था देव निष्क्र्तम आदित्या यजतम बर्हत वरुण मित्रार्यमन वर्षिष्ठं कषत्रम आशाथे |||
verses.transliteration: baḷ itthā deva niṣkṛtam ādityā yajatam bṛhat varuṇa mitrāryaman varṣiṣṭhaṃ kṣatram āśāthe

translations.griffith: YE Gods, Ādityas, Varuṇa, Aryaman, Mitra, verily  Have here obtained supremest sway, high, holy, set apart for you.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद योनिं हिरण्ययं वरुण मित्र सदथः धर्तारा चर्षणीनां यन्तं सुम्नं रिशादसा |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad yoniṃ hiraṇyayaṃ varuṇa mitra sadathaḥ dhartārā carṣaṇīnāṃ yantaṃ sumnaṃ riśādasā

translations.griffith: When, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye sit in your golden dwelling-place,  Ye Twain, supporters of mankind, foeslayers, give felicity.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वे हि विश्ववेदसो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा वरता पदेव सश्चिरे पान्ति मर्त्यं रिषः |||
verses.transliteration: viśve hi viśvavedaso varuṇo mitro aryamā vratā padeva saścire pānti martyaṃ riṣaḥ

translations.griffith: All these, possessors of all wealth, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman,  Follow their ways, as if with feet, and guard from injury mortal man.

verses.sanskrit: ते हि सत्या रतस्प्र्श रतावानो जने-जने सुनीथासः सुदानवो ऽंहोश चिद उरुचक्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: te hi satyā ṛtaspṛśa ṛtāvāno jane-jane sunīthāsaḥ sudānavo 'ṃhoś cid urucakrayaḥ

translations.griffith: For they are true, they cleave to Law, held holy among every race,  Good leaders, bounteous in their gifts, deliverers even from distress.

verses.sanskrit: को नु वाम मित्रास्तुतो वरुणो वा तनूनाम तत सु वाम एषते मतिर अत्रिभ्य एषते मतिः |||
verses.transliteration: ko nu vām mitrāstuto varuṇo vā tanūnām tat su vām eṣate matir atribhya eṣate matiḥ

translations.griffith: Which of your persons, Varuṇa or Mitra, merits not our praise?  Therefore our thought is turned to you, the Atris' thought is turned to you.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो मित्राय गायत वरुणाय विपा गिरा महिक्षत्राव रतम बर्हत |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo mitrāya ghāyata varuṇāya vipā ghirā mahikṣatrāv ṛtam bṛhat

translations.griffith: SING forth unto your Varuṇa and Mitra with a song inspired.  They, Mighty Lords, are lofty Law

verses.sanskrit: सम्राजा या घर्तयोनी मित्रश चोभा वरुणश च देवा देवेषु परशस्ता |||
verses.transliteration: samrājā yā ghṛtayonī mitraś cobhā varuṇaś ca devā deveṣu praśastā

translations.griffith: Full springs of fatness, Sovran Kings, Mitra. and Varuṇa, the Twain,  Gods glorified among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: ता नः शक्तम पार्थिवस्य महो रायो दिव्यस्य महि वां कषत्रं देवेषु |||
verses.transliteration: tā naḥ śaktam pārthivasya maho rāyo divyasya mahi vāṃ kṣatraṃ deveṣu

translations.griffith: So help ye us to riches, great terrestrial and celestial wealth:  Vast is your sway among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit: रतम रतेन सपन्तेषिरं दक्षम आशाते अद्रुहा देवौ वर्धेते |||
verses.transliteration: ṛtam ṛtena sapanteṣiraṃ dakṣam āśāte adruhā devau vardhete

translations.griffith: Carefully tending Law with Law they have attained their vigorous might.  The two Gods wax devoid of guile.

verses.sanskrit: वर्ष्टिद्यावा रीत्य्र्पेषस पती दानुमत्याः बर्हन्तं गर्तम आशाते |||
verses.transliteration: vṛṣṭidyāvā rītyṛpeṣas patī dānumatyāḥ bṛhantaṃ ghartam āśāte

translations.griffith: With rainy skies and streaming floods, Lords of the strength that bringeth gifts,  A lofty seat have they attained.

verses.sanskrit: तरी रोचना वरुण तरींर उत दयून तरीणि मित्र धारयथो रजांसि वाव्र्धानाव अमतिं कषत्रियस्यानु वरतं रक्षमाणाव अजुर्यम |||
verses.transliteration: trī rocanā varuṇa trīṃr uta dyūn trīṇi mitra dhārayatho rajāṃsi vāvṛdhānāv amatiṃ kṣatriyasyānu vrataṃ rakṣamāṇāv ajuryam

translations.griffith: THREE spheres of light, O Varuṇa, three heavens, three firmaments ye comprehend, O Mitra:  Waxed strong, ye keep the splendour of dominion, guarding the Ordinance that lasts for ever.

verses.sanskrit: इरावतीर वरुण धेनवो वाम मधुमद वां सिन्धवो मित्र दुह्रे तरयस तस्थुर वर्षभासस तिस्र्णां धिषणानां रेतोधा वि दयुमन्तः |||
verses.transliteration: irāvatīr varuṇa dhenavo vām madhumad vāṃ sindhavo mitra duhre trayas tasthur vṛṣabhāsas tisṛṇāṃ dhiṣaṇānāṃ retodhā vi dyumantaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye, Varuṇa, have kine who yield refreshment; Mitra, your floods pour water full of sweetness.  There stand the Three Steers, splendid in their brightness, who fill the three world-bowls with genial moisture.

verses.sanskrit: परातर देवीम अदितिं जोहवीमि मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य राये मित्रावरुणा सर्वतातेळे तोकाय तनयाय शं योः |||
verses.transliteration: prātar devīm aditiṃ johavīmi madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya rāye mitrāvaruṇā sarvatāteḷe tokāya tanayāya śaṃ yoḥ

translations.griffith: I call at dawn on Aditi the Goddess, I call at noon and when the Sun is setting.  I pray, O Mitra-Varuṇa, for safety, for wealth and progeny, in rest and trouble.

verses.sanskrit: या धर्तारा रजसो रोचनस्योतादित्या दिव्या पार्थिवस्य न वां देवा अम्र्ता आ मिनन्ति वरतानि मित्रावरुणा धरुवाणि |||
verses.transliteration: yā dhartārā rajaso rocanasyotādityā divyā pārthivasya na vāṃ devā amṛtā ā minanti vratāni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvāṇi

translations.griffith: Ye who uphold the region, sphere of brightness, ye who support earth's realm Divine Ādityas,  The Immortal Gods, O Varuṇa and Mitra, never impair your everlasting statutes.

verses.sanskrit: पुरूरुणा चिद धय अस्त्य अवो नूनं वां वरुण मित्र वंसि वां सुमतिम |||
verses.transliteration: purūruṇā cid dhy asty avo nūnaṃ vāṃ varuṇa mitra vaṃsi vāṃ sumatim

translations.griffith: EVEN far and wide, O Varuṇa and Mitra, doth your grace extend.  May I obtain your kind good-will.

verses.sanskrit: ता वां सम्यग अद्रुह्वाणेषम अश्याम धायसे वयं ते रुद्रा सयाम |||
verses.transliteration: tā vāṃ samyagh adruhvāṇeṣam aśyāma dhāyase vayaṃ te rudrā syāma

translations.griffith: From you, benignant Gods, may we gain fully food for sustenance.  Such, O ye Rudras, my we be.

verses.sanskrit: पातं नो रुद्रा पायुभिर उत तरायेथां सुत्रात्रा तुर्याम दस्यून तनूभिः |||
verses.transliteration: pātaṃ no rudrā pāyubhir uta trāyethāṃ sutrātrā turyāma dasyūn tanūbhiḥ

translations.griffith: Guard us, O Rudras. with your guar4 save us, ye skilled to save, my we  Subdue the Dasyus, we ourselves,

verses.sanskrit: मा कस्याद्भुतक्रतू यक्षम भुजेमा तनूभिः मा शेषसा मा तनसा |||
verses.transliteration: mā kasyādbhutakratū yakṣam bhujemā tanūbhiḥ mā śeṣasā mā tanasā

translations.griffith: Or ne’er may we, O Wondrous Strong, enjoy another's solemn feast,  Ourselves, our sons, or progeny.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो गन्तं रिशादसा वरुण मित्र बर्हणा उपेमं चारुम अध्वरम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ghantaṃ riśādasā varuṇa mitra barhaṇā upemaṃ cārum adhvaram

translations.griffith: O Varuṇa and Mitra, ye who slay the foemen, come with might  To this our goodly sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वस्य हि परचेतसा वरुण मित्र राजथः ईशाना पिप्यतं धियः |||
verses.transliteration: viśvasya hi pracetasā varuṇa mitra rājathaḥ īśānā pipyataṃ dhiyaḥ

translations.griffith: For, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye Sages are Rulers over all. Fill full our songs, for this ye can.

verses.sanskrit: उप नः सुतम आ गतं वरुण मित्र दाशुषः अस्य सोमस्य पीतये |||
verses.transliteration: upa naḥ sutam ā ghataṃ varuṇa mitra dāśuṣaḥ asya somasya pītaye

translations.griffith: Come to the juice that we have pressed. Varuṇa, Mitra, come to drink  This Soma of the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit: आ मित्रे वरुणे वयं गीर्भिर जुहुमो अत्रिवत नि बर्हिषि सदतं सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: ā mitre varuṇe vayaṃ ghīrbhir juhumo atrivat ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye

translations.griffith: To Varuṇa and Mitra we offer with songs, as Atri did. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: वरतेन सथो धरुवक्षेमा धर्मणा यातयज्जना नि बर्हिषि सदतं सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: vratena stho dhruvakṣemā dharmaṇā yātayajjanā ni barhiṣi sadataṃ somapītaye

translations.griffith: By Ordinance and Law ye dwell in peace secure, bestirring men.  Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: मित्रश च नो वरुणश च जुषेतां यज्ञम इष्टये नि बर्हिषि सदतां सोमपीतये |||
verses.transliteration: mitraś ca no varuṇaś ca juṣetāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye ni barhiṣi sadatāṃ somapītaye

translations.griffith: May Varuṇa and Mitra, for our help, accept the sacrifice.  Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit: यद अद्य सथः परावति यद अर्वावत्य अश्विना यद वा पुरू पुरुभुजा यद अन्तरिक्ष आ गतम |||
verses.transliteration: yad adya sthaḥ parāvati yad arvāvaty aśvinā yad vā purū purubhujā yad antarikṣa ā ghatam

translations.griffith: WHETHER, O Aśvins, ye this day be far remote or near at hand,  In many spots or in mid-air, come hither, Lords of ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit: इह तया पुरुभूतमा पुरू दंसांसि बिभ्रता वरस्या याम्य अध्रिगू हुवे तुविष्टमा भुजे |||
verses.transliteration: iha tyā purubhūtamā purū daṃsāṃsi bibhratā varasyā yāmy adhrighū huve tuviṣṭamā bhuje

translations.griffith: These here, who show o’er widest space, bringing full many a wondrous act,  Resistless, lovingly I seek, I call the Mightiest to enjoy.

verses.sanskrit: ईर्मान्यद वपुषे वपुश चक्रं रथस्य येमथुः पर्य अन्या नाहुषा युगा मह्ना रजांसि दीयथः |||
verses.transliteration: īrmānyad vapuṣe vapuś cakraṃ rathasya yemathuḥ pary anyā nāhuṣā yughā mahnā rajāṃsi dīyathaḥ

translations.griffith: Another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car.  With others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.

verses.sanskrit: तद ऊ षु वाम एना कर्तं विश्वा यद वाम अनु षटवे नाना जाताव अरेपसा सम अस्मे बन्धुम एयथुः |||
verses.transliteration: tad ū ṣu vām enā kṛtaṃ viśvā yad vām anu ṣṭave nānā jātāv arepasā sam asme bandhum eyathuḥ

translations.griffith: That deed of yours that is extolled, Visvas! hath all been done with this.  Born otherwise, and spotless, ye have entered kinship's bonds with us.

verses.sanskrit: आ यद वां सूर्या रथं तिष्ठद रघुष्यदं सदा परि वाम अरुषा वयो घर्णा वरन्त आतपः |||
verses.transliteration: ā yad vāṃ sūryā rathaṃ tiṣṭhad raghuṣyadaṃ sadā pari vām aruṣā vayo ghṛṇā varanta ātapaḥ

translations.griffith: When Sūrya mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly,  Birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.

verses.sanskrit: युवोर अत्रिश चिकेतति नरा सुम्नेन चेतसा घर्मं यद वाम अरेपसं नासत्यास्ना भुरण्यति |||
verses.transliteration: yuvor atriś ciketati narā sumnena cetasā gharmaṃ yad vām arepasaṃ nāsatyāsnā bhuraṇyati

translations.griffith: Atri bethinks himself of you, O Heroes, with a friendly mind,  What time, Nāsatyas, with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.

verses.sanskrit: उग्रो वां ककुहो ययिः शर्ण्वे यामेषु संतनिः यद वां दंसोभिर अश्विनात्रिर नराववर्तति |||
verses.transliteration: ughro vāṃ kakuho yayiḥ śṛṇve yāmeṣu saṃtaniḥ yad vāṃ daṃsobhir aśvinātrir narāvavartati

translations.griffith: Strong is your swiftly moving steed, famed his exertion in the course  When by your great deeds, Aśvins, Chiefs, Atri is brought to us again.

verses.sanskrit: मध्व ऊ षु मधूयुवा रुद्रा सिषक्ति पिप्युषी यत समुद्राति पर्षथः पक्वाः पर्क्षो भरन्त वाम |||
verses.transliteration: madhva ū ṣu madhūyuvā rudrā siṣakti pipyuṣī yat samudrāti parṣathaḥ pakvāḥ pṛkṣo bharanta vām

translations.griffith: Lovers of sweetness, Rudras, she who streams with sweetness waits on you.  When ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of well-dressed food.

verses.sanskrit: सत्यम इद वा उ अश्विना युवाम आहुर मयोभुवा ता यामन यामहूतमा यामन्न आ मर्ळयत्तमा |||
verses.transliteration: satyam id vā u aśvinā yuvām āhur mayobhuvā tā yāman yāmahūtamā yāmann ā mṛḷayattamā

translations.griffith: Aśvins, with truth they call you Twain bestowers of felicity;  At sacrifice most prompt to hear, most gracious ye at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit: इमा बरह्माणि वर्धनाश्विभ्यां सन्तु शंतमा या तक्षाम रथां इवावोचाम बर्हन नमः |||
verses.transliteration: imā brahmāṇi vardhanāśvibhyāṃ santu śaṃtamā yā takṣāma rathāṃ ivāvocāma bṛhan namaḥ

translations.griffith: Most pleasing to the Aśvins be these prayers which magnify their might,  Which we have fashioned, even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.

verses.sanskrit: कूष्ठो देवाव अश्विनाद्या दिवो मनावसू तच छरवथो वर्षण्वसू अत्रिर वाम आ विवासति |||
verses.transliteration: kūṣṭho devāv aśvinādyā divo manāvasū tac chravatho vṛṣaṇvasū atrir vām ā vivāsati

translations.griffith: WHERE in the heavens are ye to-day, Gods, Aśvins, rich in constancy?  Hear this, ye excellent as Steers: Atri inviteth you to come.

verses.sanskrit: कुह तया कुह नु शरुता दिवि देवा नासत्या कस्मिन्न आ यतथो जने को वां नदीनां सचा |||
verses.transliteration: kuha tyā kuha nu śrutā divi devā nāsatyā kasminn ā yatatho jane ko vāṃ nadīnāṃ sacā

translations.griffith: Where are they now? Where are the Twain, the famed Nāsatyas, Gods in heaven?  Who is the man ye strive to reach? Who of your suppliants is with you?

verses.sanskrit: कं याथः कं ह गछथः कम अछा युञ्जाथे रथम कस्य बरह्माणि रण्यथो वयं वाम उश्मसीष्टये |||
verses.transliteration: kaṃ yāthaḥ kaṃ ha ghachathaḥ kam achā yuñjāthe ratham kasya brahmāṇi raṇyatho vayaṃ vām uśmasīṣṭaye

translations.griffith: Whom do ye visit, whom approach? to whom direct your harnessed car?  With whose devotions are ye pleased? We long for you to further us.

verses.sanskrit: पौरं चिद धय उदप्रुतम पौर पौराय जिन्वथः यद ईं गर्भीततातये सिंहम इव दरुहस पदे |||
verses.transliteration: pauraṃ cid dhy udaprutam paura paurāya jinvathaḥ yad īṃ ghṛbhītatātaye siṃham iva druhas pade

translations.griffith: Ye, Strengtheners, for Paura stir the filler swimming in the flood,  Advancing to be captured like a lion to the ambuscade.

verses.sanskrit: पर चयवानाज जुजुरुषो वव्रिम अत्कं न मुञ्चथः युवा यदी कर्थः पुनर आ कामम रण्वे वध्वः |||
verses.transliteration: pra cyavānāj jujuruṣo vavrim atkaṃ na muñcathaḥ yuvā yadī kṛthaḥ punar ā kāmam ṛṇve vadhvaḥ

translations.griffith: Ye from cyavana worn with age removed his skin as ’twere a robe.  So, when ye made him young again, he stirred the longing of a dame.

verses.sanskrit: अस्ति हि वाम इह सतोता समसि वां संद्र्शि शरिये नू शरुतम म आ गतम अवोभिर वाजिनीवसू |||
verses.transliteration: asti hi vām iha stotā smasi vāṃ saṃdṛśi śriye nū śrutam ma ā ghatam avobhir vājinīvasū

translations.griffith: Here is the man who lauds you both: to see your glory are we here.  Now bear me, come with saving help, ye who are rich in store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit: को वाम अद्य पुरूणाम आ वव्ने मर्त्यानाम को विप्रो विप्रवाहसा को यज्ञैर वाजिनीवसू |||
verses.transliteration: ko vām adya purūṇām ā vavne martyānām ko vipro vipravāhasā ko yajñair vājinīvasū

translations.griffith: Who among many mortal men this day hath won you to himself?  What bard, accepters of the bard? Who, rich in wealth! with sacrifice?

verses.sanskrit: आ वां रथो रथानां येष्ठो यात्व अश्विना पुरू चिद अस्मयुस तिर आङगूषो मर्त्येष्व आ |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ ratho rathānāṃ yeṣṭho yātv aśvinā purū cid asmayus tira āṅghūṣo martyeṣv ā

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, may your car approach, most excellent of cars for speed.  Through many regions may our praise pass onward among mortal men.

verses.sanskrit: शम ऊ षु वाम मधूयुवास्माकम अस्तु चर्क्र्तिः अर्वाचीना विचेतसा विभिः शयेनेव दीयतम |||
verses.transliteration: śam ū ṣu vām madhūyuvāsmākam astu carkṛtiḥ arvācīnā vicetasā vibhiḥ śyeneva dīyatam

translations.griffith: May our laudation of you Twain, lovers of meath! be sweet to you.  Fly hitherward, ye wise of heart, like falcons with your winged steeds.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना यद ध कर्हि चिच छुश्रूयातम इमं हवम वस्वीर ऊ षु वाम भुजः पर्ञ्चन्ति सु वाम पर्चः |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā yad dha karhi cic chuśrūyātam imaṃ havam vasvīr ū ṣu vām bhujaḥ pṛñcanti su vām pṛcaḥ

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, when at any time ye listen to this call of mine,  For you is dainty food prepared: they mix refreshing food for you.

verses.sanskrit: परति परियतमं रथं वर्षणं वसुवाहनम सतोता वाम अश्विनाव रषि सतोमेन परति भूषति माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: prati priyatamaṃ rathaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vasuvāhanam stotā vām aśvināv ṛṣi stomena prati bhūṣati mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: To meet your treasure-bringing car, the mighty car most dear to us,  Aśvins, the Ṛṣi is prepared, your raiser, with his song of praise. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: अत्यायातम अश्विना तिरो विश्वा अहं सना दस्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी सुषुम्ना सिन्धुवाहसा माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: atyāyātam aśvinā tiro viśvā ahaṃ sanā dasrā hiraṇyavartanī suṣumnā sindhuvāhasā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: Pass, O ye Aśvins, pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men,  Wonderful, with your golden paths, most gracious, bringers of the flood. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: आ नो रत्नानि बिभ्रताव अश्विना गछतं युवम रुद्रा हिरण्यवर्तनी जुषाणा वाजिनीवसू माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ā no ratnāni bibhratāv aśvinā ghachataṃ yuvam rudrā hiraṇyavartanī juṣāṇā vājinīvasū mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: Come to us, O ye Aśvin Pair, bringing your precious treasures, come  Ye Rudras, on your paths of gold, rejoicing, rich in store of wealth. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: सुष्टुभो वां वर्षण्वसू रथे वाणीच्य आहिता उत वां ककुहो मर्गः पर्क्षः कर्णोति वापुषो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: suṣṭubho vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū rathe vāṇīcy āhitā uta vāṃ kakuho mṛghaḥ pṛkṣaḥ kṛṇoti vāpuṣo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: O strong and Good, the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car.  And that great beast, your chariot-steed, fair, wonderful, makes dainty food. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: बोधिन्मनसा रथ्येषिरा हवनश्रुता विभिश चयवानम अश्विना नि याथो अद्वयाविनम माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: bodhinmanasā rathyeṣirā havanaśrutā vibhiś cyavānam aśvinā ni yātho advayāvinam mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: Watchful in spirit, born on cars, impetuous, listing to his cry,  Aśvins, with winged steeds ye speed down to cyavana void of guile. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: आ वां नरा मनोयुजो ऽशवासः परुषितप्सवः वयो वहन्तु पीतये सह सुम्नेभिर अश्विना माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: ā vāṃ narā manoyujo 'śvāsaḥ pruṣitapsavaḥ vayo vahantu pītaye saha sumnebhir aśvinā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: Hither, O Heroes, let your steeds, of dappled hue, yoked at the thought,  Your flying steeds, O Aśvins, bring you hitherward, with bliss, to drink. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विनाव एह गछतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम तिरश चिद अर्यया परि वर्तिर यातम अदाभ्या माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: aśvināv eha ghachataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam tiraś cid aryayā pari vartir yātam adābhyā mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, hither come to us; Nāsatyas, be not disinclined.  Through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

verses.sanskrit: अस्मिन यज्ञे अदाभ्या जरितारं शुभस पती अवस्युम अश्विना युवं गर्णन्तम उप भूषथो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: asmin yajñe adābhyā jaritāraṃ śubhas patī avasyum aśvinā yuvaṃ ghṛṇantam upa bhūṣatho mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: Ye Lords of Splendour, free from guile, come, stand at this our sacrifice.  Beside the singer, Aśvins, who longs for your grace and lauds you both. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit: अभूद उषा रुशत्पशुर आग्निर अधाय्य रत्वियः अयोजि वां वर्षण्वसू रथो दस्राव अमर्त्यो माध्वी मम शरुतं हवम |||
verses.transliteration: abhūd uṣā ruśatpaśur āghnir adhāyy ṛtviyaḥ ayoji vāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū ratho dasrāv amartyo mādhvī mama śrutaṃ havam

translations.griffith: Dawn with her white herd hath appeared, and in due time hath fire been placed.  Harnessed is your immortal car, O WonderWorkers, strong and kind. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

verses.sanskrit: आ भात्य अग्निर उषसाम अनीकम उद विप्राणां देवया वाचो अस्थुः अर्वाञ्चा नूनं रथ्येह यातम पीपिवांसम अश्विना घर्मम अछ |||
verses.transliteration: ā bhāty aghnir uṣasām anīkam ud viprāṇāṃ devayā vāco asthuḥ arvāñcā nūnaṃ rathyeha yātam pīpivāṃsam aśvinā gharmam acha

translations.griffith: AGNI, the bright face of the Dawns, is shining; the singers' pious voices have ascended.  Borne on your chariot, Aśvins, turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.

verses.sanskrit: न संस्क्र्तम पर मिमीतो गमिष्ठान्ति नूनम अश्विनोपस्तुतेह दिवाभिपित्वे ऽवसागमिष्ठा परत्य अवर्तिं दाशुषे शम्भविष्ठा |||
verses.transliteration: na saṃskṛtam pra mimīto ghamiṣṭhānti nūnam aśvinopastuteha divābhipitve 'vasāghamiṣṭhā praty avartiṃ dāśuṣe śambhaviṣṭhā

translations.griffith: Most frequent guests, they scorn not what is ready: even now the lauded Aśvins are beside us.  With promptest aid they come at morn and evening, the worshipper's most blessed guards from trouble.

verses.sanskrit: उता यातं संगवे परातर अह्नो मध्यंदिन उदिता सूर्यस्य दिवा नक्तम अवसा शंतमेन नेदानीम पीतिर अश्विना ततान |||
verses.transliteration: utā yātaṃ saṃghave prātar ahno madhyaṃdina uditā sūryasya divā naktam avasā śaṃtamena nedānīm pītir aśvinā tatāna

translations.griffith: Yea, come at milking-time, at early morning, at noon of day and when the Sun is setting,  By day, by night, with favour most auspicious. Not only now the draught hath drawn the Aśvins.

verses.sanskrit: इदं हि वाम परदिवि सथानम ओक इमे गर्हा अश्विनेदं दुरोणम आ नो दिवो बर्हतः पर्वताद आद्भ्यो यातम इषम ऊर्जं वहन्ता |||
verses.transliteration: idaṃ hi vām pradivi sthānam oka ime ghṛhā aśvinedaṃ duroṇam ā no divo bṛhataḥ parvatād ādbhyo yātam iṣam ūrjaṃ vahantā

translations.griffith: For this place, Aśvins, was of old your dwelling, these were your houses, this your habitation.  Come to us from high heaven and from the mountain. Come from the waters bringing food and vigour.

verses.sanskrit: सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि |||
verses.transliteration: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni

translations.griffith: May we obtain the Aśvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.  Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

verses.sanskrit: परातर्यावाणा परथमा यजध्वम पुरा गर्ध्राद अररुषः पिबातः परातर हि यज्ञम अश्विना दधाते पर शंसन्ति कवयः पूर्वभाजः |||
verses.transliteration: prātaryāvāṇā prathamā yajadhvam purā ghṛdhrād araruṣaḥ pibātaḥ prātar hi yajñam aśvinā dadhāte pra śaṃsanti kavayaḥ pūrvabhājaḥ

translations.griffith: FIRST worship those who come at early morning: let the Twain drink before the giftless niggard.  The Aśvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak: the sages yielding the first share extol them.

verses.sanskrit: परातर यजध्वम अश्विना हिनोत न सायम अस्ति देवया अजुष्टम उतान्यो अस्मद यजते वि चावः पूर्वः-पूर्वो यजमानो वनीयान |||
verses.transliteration: prātar yajadhvam aśvinā hinota na sāyam asti devayā ajuṣṭam utānyo asmad yajate vi cāvaḥ pūrvaḥ-pūrvo yajamāno vanīyān

translations.griffith: Worship at dawn and instigate the Aśvins: nor is the worshipper at eve rejected.  Besides ourselves another craves and worships: each first in worship is most highly favoured.

verses.sanskrit: हिरण्यत्वङ मधुवर्णो घर्तस्नुः पर्क्षो वहन्न आ रथो वर्तते वाम मनोजवा अश्विना वातरंहा येनातियाथो दुरितानि विश्वा |||
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyatvaṅ madhuvarṇo ghṛtasnuḥ pṛkṣo vahann ā ratho vartate vām manojavā aśvinā vātaraṃhā yenātiyātho duritāni viśvā

translations.griffith: Covered with gold, meath-tinted, dropping fatness, your chariot with its freight of food comes hither,  Swift as thought, Aśvins, rapid as the tempest, wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.

verses.sanskrit: यो भूयिष्ठं नासत्याभ्यां विवेष चनिष्ठम पित्वो ररते विभागे स तोकम अस्य पीपरच छमीभिर अनूर्ध्वभासः सदम इत तुतुर्यात |||
verses.transliteration: yo bhūyiṣṭhaṃ nāsatyābhyāṃ viveṣa caniṣṭham pitvo rarate vibhāghe sa tokam asya pīparac chamībhir anūrdhvabhāsaḥ sadam it tuturyāt

translations.griffith: He who hath served most often the Nāsatyas, and gives the sweetest food at distribution,  Furthers with his own holy works his offspring, and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.

verses.sanskrit: सम अश्विनोर अवसा नूतनेन मयोभुवा सुप्रणीती गमेम आ नो रयिं वहतम ओत वीरान आ विश्वान्य अम्र्ता सौभगानि |||
verses.transliteration: sam aśvinor avasā nūtanena mayobhuvā supraṇītī ghamema ā no rayiṃ vahatam ota vīrān ā viśvāny amṛtā saubhaghāni

translations.griffith: May we obtain the Aśvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance.  Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

verses.sanskrit: अश्विनाव एह गछतं नासत्या मा वि वेनतम हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप |||
verses.transliteration: aśvināv eha ghachataṃ nāsatyā mā vi venatam haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa

translations.griffith: YE Aśvins, hither come to us: Nāsatyas, be not disinclined.  Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना हरिणाव इव गौराव इवानु यवसम हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā hariṇāv iva ghaurāv ivānu yavasam haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa

translations.griffith: O Aśvins, like a pair of deer, like two wild cattle to the mead:  Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

verses.sanskrit: अश्विना वाजिनीवसू जुषेथां यज्ञम इष्टये हंसाव इव पततम आ सुतां उप |||
verses.transliteration: aśvinā vājinīvasū juṣethāṃ yajñam iṣṭaye haṃsāv iva patatam ā sutāṃ upa

translations.griffith: O Aśvins rich in gifts, accept our sacrifice to prosper it:  Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

verses.sanskrit: अत्रिर यद वाम अवरोहन्न रबीसम अजोहवीन नाधमानेव योषा शयेनस्य चिज जवसा नूतनेनागछतम अश्विना शंतमेन |||
verses.transliteration: atrir yad vām avarohann ṛbīsam ajohavīn nādhamāneva yoṣā śyenasya cij javasā nūtanenāghachatam aśvinā śaṃtamena

translations.griffith: As Atri when descending to the cavern called on you loudly like a wailing woman.  Ye came to him, O Aśvins, with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.

verses.sanskrit: वि जिहीष्व वनस्पते योनिः सूष्यन्त्या इव शरुतम मे अश्विना हवं सप्तवध्रिं च मुञ्चतम |||
verses.transliteration: vi jihīṣva vanaspate yoniḥ sūṣyantyā iva śrutam me aśvinā havaṃ saptavadhriṃ ca muñcatam

translations.griffith: Tree, part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child.  Ye Aśvins, listen to my call: loose Saptavadhri from his bonds.

verses.sanskrit: भीताय नाधमानाय रषये सप्तवध्रये मायाभिर अश्विना युवं वर्क्षं सं च वि चाचथः |||
verses.transliteration: bhītāya nādhamānāya ṛṣaye saptavadhraye māyābhir aśvinā yuvaṃ vṛkṣaṃ saṃ ca vi cācathaḥ

translations.griffith: For Saptavadhri, for the seer affrighted when he wept and wailed,  Ye, Aśvins, with your magic powers rent up the tree and shattered it.

verses.sanskrit: यथा वातः पुष्करिणीं समिङगयति सर्वतः एवा ते गर्भ एजतु निरैतु दशमास्यः |||
verses.transliteration: yathā vātaḥ puṣkariṇīṃ samiṅghayati sarvataḥ evā te gharbha ejatu niraitu daśamāsyaḥ

translations.griffith: Like as the wind on every side ruffles a pool of lotuses,  So stir in thee the babe unborn, so may the ten-month babe descend.

verses.sanskrit: यथा वातो यथा वनं यथा समुद्र एजति एवा तवं दशमास्य सहावेहि जरायुणा |||
verses.transliteration: yathā vāto yathā vanaṃ yathā samudra ejati evā tvaṃ daśamāsya sahāvehi jarāyuṇā

translations.griffith: Like as the wind, like as the wood, like as the sea is set astir,  So also, ten-month babe, descend together with the after-birth.

verses.sanskrit: दश मासाञ छशयानः कुमारो अधि मातरि निरैतु जीवो अक्षतो जीवो जीवन्त्या अधि |||
verses.transliteration: daśa māsāñ chaśayānaḥ kumāro adhi mātari niraitu jīvo akṣato jīvo jīvantyā adhi

translations.griffith: The child who hath for ten months' time been lying in his mother's side,—  May he come forth alive, unharmed, yea, living from the living dame.

verses.sanskrit: महे नो अद्य बोधयोषो राये दिवित्मती यथा चिन नो अबोधयः सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: mahe no adya bodhayoṣo rāye divitmatī yathā cin no abodhayaḥ satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: O HEAVENLY Dawn, awaken us to ample opulence to-day  Even as thou hast wakened us with Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: या सुनीथे शौचद्रथे वय औछो दुहितर दिवः सा वय उछ सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: yā sunīthe śaucadrathe vy aucho duhitar divaḥ sā vy ucha sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: Daughter of Heaven, thou dawnedst on Sunitha Sucadratha's son,  So dawn thou on one mightier still, on Satyasravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: सा नो अद्याभरद्वसुर वय उछा दुहितर दिवः यो वय औछः सहीयसि सत्यश्रवसि वाय्ये सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: sā no adyābharadvasur vy uchā duhitar divaḥ yo vy auchaḥ sahīyasi satyaśravasi vāyye sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: So, bringing treasure, dawn to-day on us thou Daughter of the Sky,  As thou, O mightier yet. didst shine for Satyatravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: अभि ये तवा विभावरि सतोमैर गर्णन्ति वह्नयः मघैर मघोनि सुश्रियो दामन्वन्तः सुरातयः सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: abhi ye tvā vibhāvari stomair ghṛṇanti vahnayaḥ maghair maghoni suśriyo dāmanvantaḥ surātayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: Here round about thee are the priests who laud thee, Bright One, with their hymns,  And men with gifts, O Bounteous Dame, splendid with wealth and offering much, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: यच चिद धि ते गणा इमे छदयन्ति मघत्तये परि चिद वष्टयो दधुर ददतो राधो अह्रयं सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: yac cid dhi te ghaṇā ime chadayanti maghattaye pari cid vaṣṭayo dadhur dadato rādho ahrayaṃ sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: Whatever these thy bands perform to please thee or to win them wealth,  E’en fain they gird us round and give rich gifts which ne’er are reft away, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: ऐषु धा वीरवद यश उषो मघोनि सूरिषु ये नो राधांस्य अह्रया मघवानो अरासत सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśa uṣo maghoni sūriṣu ye no rādhāṃsy ahrayā maghavāno arāsata sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: Give to these wealthy patrons fame, O affluent Dawn, with hero sons,  To these our princes who have brought rich gifts ne’er to be reft away, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: तेभ्यो दयुम्नम बर्हद यश उषो मघोन्य आ वह ये नो राधांस्य अश्व्या गव्या भजन्त सूरयः सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: tebhyo dyumnam bṛhad yaśa uṣo maghony ā vaha ye no rādhāṃsy aśvyā ghavyā bhajanta sūrayaḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: Bring lofty and resplendent fame, O thou munificent Dawn, to these  Our wealthy patrons who bestow rich gifts on us of steeds and kine, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: उत नो गोमतीर इष आ वहा दुहितर दिवः साकं सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः शुक्रैः शोचद्भिर अर्चिभिः सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: uta no ghomatīr iṣa ā vahā duhitar divaḥ sākaṃ sūryasya raśmibhiḥ śukraiḥ śocadbhir arcibhiḥ sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: Bring us, O Daughter of the Sky, subsistence in our herds of kine,  Together with the sunbeams, with the shine of pure refulgent flames, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: वय उछा दुहितर दिवो मा चिरं तनुथा अपः नेत तवा सतेनं यथा रिपुं तपाति सूरो अर्चिषा सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: vy uchā duhitar divo mā ciraṃ tanuthā apaḥ net tvā stenaṃ yathā ripuṃ tapāti sūro arciṣā sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: O Daughter of the Sky, shine forth; delay not to perform thy task.  Let not the Sun with fervent heat consume thee like a robber foe, high-born! delightful with the steeds!

verses.sanskrit: एतावद वेद उषस तवम भूयो वा दातुम अर्हसि या सतोत्र्भ्यो विभावर्य उछन्ती न परमीयसे सुजाते अश्वसून्र्ते |||
verses.transliteration: etāvad ved uṣas tvam bhūyo vā dātum arhasi yā stotṛbhyo vibhāvary uchantī na pramīyase sujāte aśvasūnṛte

translations.griffith: So much, and more exceedingly, O Dawn, it suits thee to bestow,  Thou Radiant One who ceasest not to shine for those who sing thy praise, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit: दयुतद्यामानम बर्हतीम रतेन रतावरीम अरुणप्सुं विभातीम देवीम उषसं सवर आवहन्तीम परति विप्रासो मतिभिर जरन्ते |||
verses.transliteration: dyutadyāmānam bṛhatīm ṛtena ṛtāvarīm aruṇapsuṃ vibhātīm devīm uṣasaṃ svar āvahantīm prati viprāso matibhir jarante

translations.griffith: THE singers welcome with their hymns and praises the Goddess Dawn who bringeth in the sunlight,  Sublime, by Law true to eternal Order, bright on her path, red-tinted, far-refulgent.

verses.sanskrit: एषा जनं दर्शता बोधयन्ती सुगान पथः कर्ण्वती यात्य अग्रे बर्हद्रथा बर्हती विश्वमिन्वोषा जयोतिर यछत्य अग्रे अह्नाम |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā janaṃ darśatā bodhayantī sughān pathaḥ kṛṇvatī yāty aghre bṛhadrathā bṛhatī viśvaminvoṣā jyotir yachaty aghre ahnām

translations.griffith: She comes in front, fair, rousing up the people, making the pathways easy to be travelled.  High, on her lofty chariot, all-impelling, Dawn gives her splendour at the days' beginning.

verses.sanskrit: एषा गोभिर अरुणेभिर युजानास्रेधन्ती रयिम अप्रायु चक्रे पथो रदन्ती सुविताय देवी पुरुष्टुता विश्ववारा वि भाति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā ghobhir aruṇebhir yujānāsredhantī rayim aprāyu cakre patho radantī suvitāya devī puruṣṭutā viśvavārā vi bhāti

translations.griffith: She, harnessing her car with purple oxen. injuring none, hath brought perpetual riches.  Opening paths to happiness, the Goddess shines, praised by all, giver of every blessing.

verses.sanskrit: एषा वयेनी भवति दविबर्हा आविष्क्र्ण्वाना तन्वम पुरस्तात रतस्य पन्थाम अन्व एति साधु परजानतीव न दिशो मिनाति |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā vyenī bhavati dvibarhā āviṣkṛṇvānā tanvam purastāt ṛtasya panthām anv eti sādhu prajānatīva na diśo mināti

translations.griffith: With changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body.  She travels perfectly the path of Order, nor fails to reach, as one who knows, the quarters.

verses.sanskrit: एषा शुभ्रा न तन्वो विदानोर्ध्वेव सनाती दर्शये नो अस्थात अप दवेषो बाधमाना तमांस्य उषा दिवो दुहिता जयोतिषागात |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā śubhrā na tanvo vidānordhveva snātī dṛśaye no asthāt apa dveṣo bādhamānā tamāṃsy uṣā divo duhitā jyotiṣāghāt

translations.griffith: As conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing, she stands, as ’twere, erect that we may see her.  Driving away malignity and darkness, Dawn, Child of Heaven, hath come to us with lustre.

verses.sanskrit: एषा परतीची दुहिता दिवो नॄन योषेव भद्रा नि रिणीते अप्सः वयूर्ण्वती दाशुषे वार्याणि पुनर जयोतिर युवतिः पूर्वथाकः |||
verses.transliteration: eṣā pratīcī duhitā divo nṝn yoṣeva bhadrā ni riṇīte apsaḥ vyūrṇvatī dāśuṣe vāryāṇi punar jyotir yuvatiḥ pūrvathākaḥ

translations.griffith: The Daughter of the Sky, like some chaste woman, bends, opposite to men, her forehead downward.  The Maid, disclosing boons to him who worships, hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.

verses.sanskrit: युञ्जते मन उत युञ्जते धियो विप्रा विप्रस्य बर्हतो विपश्चितः वि होत्रा दधे वयुनाविद एक इन मही देवस्य सवितुः परिष्टुतिः |||
verses.transliteration: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ

translations.griffith: THE priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy thoughts.  He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वा रूपाणि परति मुञ्चते कविः परासावीद भद्रं दविपदे चतुष्पदे वि नाकम अख्यत सविता वरेण्यो ऽनु परयाणम उषसो वि राजति |||
verses.transliteration: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpade vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati

translations.griffith: The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good.  Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault, and shineth after the outgoing of the Dawn.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य परयाणम अन्व अन्य इद ययुर देवा देवस्य महिमानम ओजसा यः पार्थिवानि विममे स एतशो रजांसि देवः सविता महित्वना |||
verses.transliteration: yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajāṃsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā

translations.griffith: Even he, the God whose going-forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might,  He who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar.

verses.sanskrit: उत यासि सवितस तरीणि रोचनोत सूर्यस्य रश्मिभिः सम उच्यसि उत रात्रीम उभयतः परीयस उत मित्रो भवसि देव धर्मभिः |||
verses.transliteration: uta yāsi savitas trīṇi rocanota sūryasya raśmibhiḥ sam ucyasi uta rātrīm ubhayataḥ parīyasa uta mitro bhavasi deva dharmabhiḥ

translations.griffith: To the three spheres of light thou goest, Savitar, and with the rays of Sidrya thou combinest thee.  Around, on both sides thou encompassest the night: yea, thou, O God, art Mitra through thy righteous laws.

verses.sanskrit: उतेशिषे परसवस्य तवम एक इद उत पूषा भवसि देव यामभिः उतेदं विश्वम भुवनं वि राजसि शयावाश्वस ते सवित सतोमम आनशे |||
verses.transliteration: uteśiṣe prasavasya tvam eka id uta pūṣā bhavasi deva yāmabhiḥ utedaṃ viśvam bhuvanaṃ vi rājasi śyāvāśvas te savita stomam ānaśe

translations.griffith: Over all generation thou art Lord alone: Pūṣan art thou, O God, in all thy goings-forth.  Yea, thou hast domination over all this world. Śyāvāśva hath brought praise to thee, O Savitar,

verses.sanskrit: तत सवितुर वर्णीमहे वयं देवस्य भोजनम शरेष्ठं सर्वधातमं तुरम भगस्य धीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: tat savitur vṛṇīmahe vayaṃ devasya bhojanam śreṣṭhaṃ sarvadhātamaṃ turam bhaghasya dhīmahi

translations.griffith: WE crave of Savitar the God this treasure much to be enjoyed.  The best, all-yielding, conquering gift of Bhaga we would gladly win.

verses.sanskrit: अस्य हि सवयशस्तरं सवितुः कच चन परियम न मिनन्ति सवराज्यम |||
verses.transliteration: asya hi svayaśastaraṃ savituḥ kac cana priyam na minanti svarājyam

translations.griffith: Savitar's own supremacy, most glorious and beloved of all,  No one diminisheth in aught.

verses.sanskrit: स हि रत्नानि दाशुषे सुवाति सविता भगः तम भागं चित्रम ईमहे |||
verses.transliteration: sa hi ratnāni dāśuṣe suvāti savitā bhaghaḥ tam bhāghaṃ citram īmahe

translations.griffith: For Savitar who is Bhaga shall send riches to his worshipper.  That wondrous portion we implore.

verses.sanskrit: अद्या नो देव सवितः परजावत सावीः सौभगम परा दुष्वप्न्यं सुव |||
verses.transliteration: adyā no deva savitaḥ prajāvat sāvīḥ saubhagham parā duṣvapnyaṃ suva

translations.griffith: Send us this day, God Savitar, prosperity with progeny.  Drive thou the evil dream away.

verses.sanskrit: विश्वानि देव सवितर दुरितानि परा सुव यद भद्रं तन न आ सुव |||
verses.transliteration: viśvāni deva savitar duritāni parā suva yad bhadraṃ tan na ā suva

translations.griffith: Savitar, God, send far away all sorrows and calamities,  And send us only what is good.

verses.sanskrit: अनागसो अदितये देवस्य सवितुः सवे विश्वा वामानि धीमहि |||
verses.transliteration: anāghaso aditaye devasya savituḥ save viśvā vāmāni dhīmahi

translations.griffith: Sinless in sight of Aditi through the God Savitar's influence,  May we obtain all lovely things.

verses.sanskrit: आ विश्वदेवं सत्पतिं सूक्तैर अद्या वर्णीमहे सत्यसवं सवितारम |||
verses.transliteration: ā viśvadevaṃ satpatiṃ sūktair adyā vṛṇīmahe satyasavaṃ savitāram

translations.griffith: We with our hymns this day elect the general God, Lord of the good,  Savitar whose decrees are true.

verses.sanskrit: य इमे उभे अहनी पुर एत्य अप्रयुछन सवाधीर देवः सविता |||
verses.transliteration: ya ime ubhe ahanī pura ety aprayuchan svādhīr devaḥ savitā

translations.griffith: He who for ever vigilant precedes these Twain, the Day and Night,  Is Savitar the thoughtful God.

verses.sanskrit: य इमा विश्वा जातान्य आश्रावयति शलोकेन पर च सुवाति सविता |||
verses.transliteration: ya imā viśvā jātāny āśrāvayati ślokena pra ca suvāti savitā

translations.griffith: He who gives glory unto all these living creatures with the song,  And brings them forth, is Savitar.

verses.sanskrit: अछा वद तवसं गीर्भिर आभि सतुहि पर्जन्यं नमसा विवास कनिक्रदद वर्षभो जीरदानू रेतो दधात्य ओषधीषु गर्भम |||
verses.transliteration: achā vada tavasaṃ ghīrbhir ābhi stuhi parjanyaṃ namasā vivāsa kanikradad vṛṣabho jīradānū reto dadhāty oṣadhīṣu gharbham

translations.griffith: SING with these songs thy welcome to the Mighty, with adoration praise and call Parjanya.  The Bull, loud roaring, swift to send his bounty, lays in the plants the seed. for germination.

verses.sanskrit: वि वर्क्षान हन्त्य उत हन्ति रक्षसो विश्वम बिभाय भुवनम महावधात उतानागा ईषते वर्ष्ण्यावतो यत पर्जन्य सतनयन हन्ति दुष्क्र्तः |||
verses.transliteration: vi vṛkṣān hanty uta hanti rakṣaso viśvam bibhāya bhuvanam mahāvadhāt utānāghā īṣate vṛṣṇyāvato yat parjanya stanayan hanti duṣkṛtaḥ

translations.griffith: He smites the trees apart, he slays the demons: all life fears him who wields the mighty weapon.  From him exceeding strong fices e’en the guiltless, when thundering Parjanya smites the wicked.

verses.sanskrit: रथीव कशयाश्वां अभिक्षिपन्न आविर दूतान कर्णुते वर्ष्य्रं अह दूरात सिंहस्य सतनथा उद ईरते यत पर्जन्यः कर्णुते वर्ष्यं नभः |||
verses.transliteration: rathīva kaśayāśvāṃ abhikṣipann āvir dūtān kṛṇute varṣyṛṃ aha dūrāt siṃhasya stanathā ud īrate yat parjanyaḥ kṛṇute varṣyaṃ nabhaḥ

translations.griffith: Like a car-driver whipping on his horses, he makes the messengers of rain spring forward.  Far off resounds the roaring of the lion, what time Parjanya fills the sky with rain-cloud.

verses.sanskrit: पर वाता वान्ति पतयन्ति विद्युत उद ओषधीर जिहते पिन्वते सवः इरा विश्वस्मै भुवनाय जायते यत पर्जन्यः पर्थिवीं रेतसावति |||
verses.transliteration: pra vātā vānti patayanti vidyuta ud oṣadhīr jihate pinvate svaḥ irā viśvasmai bhuvanāya jāyate yat parjanyaḥ pṛthivīṃ retasāvati

translations.griffith: Forth burst the winds, down come the lightning-flashes: the plants shoot up, the realm of light is streaming.  Food springs abundant for all living creatures, what time Parjanya quickens earth with moisture.

verses.sanskrit: यस्य वरते पर्थिवी नन्नमीति यस्य वरते शफवज जर्भुरीति यस्य वरत ओषधीर विश्वरूपाः स नः पर्जन्य महि शर्म यछ |||
verses.transliteration: yasya vrate pṛthivī nannamīti yasya vrate śaphavaj jarbhurīti yasya vrata oṣadhīr viśvarūpāḥ sa naḥ parjanya mahi śarma yacha

translations.griffith: Thou at whose bidding earth bows low before thee, at whose command hoofed cattle fly in terror,  At whose behest the plants assume all colours, even thou Parjanya, yield us great protection.

verses.sanskrit: दिवो नो वर्ष्टिम मरुतो ररीध्वम पर पिन्वत वर्ष्णो अश्वस्य धाराः अर्वाङ एतेन सतनयित्नुनेह्य अपो निषिञ्चन्न असुरः पिता नः |||
verses.transliteration: divo no vṛṣṭim maruto rarīdhvam pra pinvata vṛṣṇo aśvasya dhārāḥ arvāṅ etena stanayitnunehy apo niṣiñcann asuraḥ pitā naḥ

translations.griffith: Send down for us the rain of heaven, ye Maruts, and let the Stallion's flood descend in torrents.  Come hither with this thunder while thou pourest the waters down, our heavenly Lord and Father.

verses.sanskrit: अभि करन्द सतनय गर्भम आ धा उदन्वता परि दीया रथेन दर्तिं सु कर्ष विषितं नयञ्चं समा भवन्तूद्वतो निपादाः |||
verses.transliteration: abhi kranda stanaya gharbham ā dhā udanvatā pari dīyā rathena dṛtiṃ su karṣa viṣitaṃ nyañcaṃ samā bhavantūdvato nipādāḥ

translations.griffith: Thunder and roar: the germ of life deposit. Fly round us on thy chariot waterladen.  Thine opened water-skin draw with thee downward, and let the hollows and the heights be level.

verses.sanskrit: महान्तं कोशम उद अचा नि षिञ्च सयन्दन्तां कुल्या विषिताः पुरस्तात घर्तेन दयावाप्र्थिवी वय उन्धि सुप्रपाणम भवत्व अघ्न्याभ्यः |||
verses.transliteration: mahāntaṃ kośam ud acā ni ṣiñca syandantāṃ kulyā viṣitāḥ purastāt ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī vy undhi suprapāṇam bhavatv aghnyābhyaḥ

translations.griffith: Lift up the mighty vessel, pour down water, and let the liberated streams rush forward.  Saturate both the earth and heaven with fatness, and for the cows let there be drink abundant.

verses.sanskrit: यत पर्जन्य कनिक्रदत सतनयन हंसि दुष्क्र्तः परतीदं विश्वम मोदते यत किं च पर्थिव्याम अधि |||
verses.transliteration: yat parjanya kanikradat stanayan haṃsi duṣkṛtaḥ pratīdaṃ viśvam modate yat kiṃ ca pṛthivyām adhi

translations.griffith: When thou, with thunder and with roar, Parjanya, smitest sinners down,  This universe exults thereat, yea, all that is upon the earth.

verses.sanskrit: अवर्षीर वर्षम उद उ षू गर्भायाकर धन्वान्य अत्येतवा उ अजीजन ओषधीर भोजनाय कम उत परजाभ्यो ऽविदो मनीषाम |||
verses.transliteration: avarṣīr varṣam ud u ṣū ghṛbhāyākar dhanvāny atyetavā u ajījana oṣadhīr bhojanāya kam uta prajābhyo 'vido manīṣām

translations.griffith: Thou hast poured down the rain-flood now withhold it. Thou hast made desert places fit for travel.  Thou hast made herbs to grow for our enjoyment: yea, thou hast won thee praise from living creatures.

verses.sanskrit: बळ इत्था पर्वतानां खिद्रम बिभर्षि पर्थिवि पर या भूमिम परवत्वति मह्ना जिनोषि महिनि |||
verses.transliteration: baḷ itthā parvatānāṃ khidram bibharṣi pṛthivi pra yā bhūmim pravatvati mahnā jinoṣi mahini

translations.griffith: THOU, of a truth,O Prthivi, bearest the tool that rends the hills:  Thou rich in torrents, who with might quickenest earth, O Mighty One.

verses.sanskrit: सतोमासस तवा विचारिणि परति षटोभन्त्य अक्तुभिः पर या वाजं न हेषन्तम पेरुम अस्यस्य अर्जुनि |||
verses.transliteration: stomāsas tvā vicāriṇi prati ṣṭobhanty aktubhiḥ pra yā vājaṃ na heṣantam perum asyasy arjuni

translations.griffith: To thee, O wanderer at will, ring out the lauds with beams of day,  Who drivest, like a neighing steed, the swelling cloud, O bright of hue.

verses.sanskrit: दर्ळ्हा चिद या वनस्पतीन कष्मया दर्धर्ष्य ओजसा यत ते अभ्रस्य विद्युतो दिवो वर्षन्ति वर्ष्टयः |||
verses.transliteration: dṛḷhā cid yā vanaspatīn kṣmayā dardharṣy ojasā yat te abhrasya vidyuto divo varṣanti vṛṣṭayaḥ

translations.griffith: Who graspest with thy might on earth. e’en the strong sovrans of the wood,  When from the lightning of thy cloud the rain-floods of the heaven descend.

verses.sanskrit: पर सम्राजे बर्हद अर्चा गभीरम बरह्म परियं वरुणाय शरुताय वि यो जघान शमितेव चर्मोपस्तिरे पर्थिवीं सूर्याय |||
verses.transliteration: pra samrāje bṛhad arcā ghabhīram brahma priyaṃ varuṇāya śrutāya vi yo jaghāna śamiteva carmopastire pṛthivīṃ sūryāya

translations.griffith: SING forth a hymn sublime and solemn, grateful to glorious. Varuṇa, imperial Ruler,  Who hath struck out, like one who slays the victim, earth as a skin to spread in front of Sūrya.

verses.sanskrit: वनेषु वय अन्तरिक्षं ततान वाजम अर्वत्सु पय उस्रियासु हर्त्सु करतुं वरुणो अप्स्व अग्निं दिवि सूर्यम अदधात सोमम अद्रौ |||
verses.transliteration: vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṃ tatāna vājam arvatsu paya usriyāsu hṛtsu kratuṃ varuṇo apsv aghniṃ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau

translations.griffith: In the tree-tops the air he hath extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses,  Set intellect in hearts, fire in the waters, Siurya in heaven and Soma on the mountain.

verses.sanskrit: नीचीनबारं वरुणः कवन्धम पर ससर्ज रोदसी अन्तरिक्षम तेन विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा यवं न वर्ष्टिर वय उनत्ति भूम |||
verses.transliteration: nīcīnabāraṃ varuṇaḥ kavandham pra sasarja rodasī antarikṣam tena viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā yavaṃ na vṛṣṭir vy unatti bhūma

translations.griffith: Varuṇa lets the big cask, opening downward, flow through the heaven and earth and air's mid-region.  Therewith the universe's Sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.

verses.sanskrit: उनत्ति भूमिम पर्थिवीम उत दयां यदा दुग्धं वरुणो वष्ट्य आद इत सम अभ्रेण वसत पर्वतासस तविषीयन्तः शरथयन्त वीराः |||
verses.transliteration: unatti bhūmim pṛthivīm uta dyāṃ yadā dughdhaṃ varuṇo vaṣṭy ād it sam abhreṇa vasata parvatāsas taviṣīyantaḥ śrathayanta vīrāḥ

translations.griffith: When Varuṇa is fain for milk he moistens the sky, the land, and earth to her foundation.  Then straight the mountains clothe them in the rain-cloud: the Heroes, putting forth their vigour, loose them.

verses.sanskrit: इमाम ऊ षव रसुरस्य शरुतस्य महीम मायां वरुणस्य पर वोचम मानेनेव तस्थिवां अन्तरिक्षे वि यो ममे पर्थिवीं सूर्येण |||
verses.transliteration: imām ū ṣv ṛsurasya śrutasya mahīm māyāṃ varuṇasya pra vocam māneneva tasthivāṃ antarikṣe vi yo mame pṛthivīṃ sūryeṇa

translations.griffith: I will declare this mighty deed of magic, of glorious Varuṇa the Lord Immortal,  Who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the Sun as with a measure.

verses.sanskrit: इमाम ऊ नु कवितमस्य मायाम महीं देवस्य नकिर आ दधर्ष एकं यद उद्ना न पर्णन्त्य एनीर आसिञ्चन्तीर अवनयः समुद्रम |||
verses.transliteration: imām ū nu kavitamasya māyām mahīṃ devasya nakir ā dadharṣa ekaṃ yad udnā na pṛṇanty enīr āsiñcantīr avanayaḥ samudram

translations.griffith: None, verily, hath ever let or hindered this the most wise God's mighty deed of magic,  Whereby with all their flood, the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.

verses.sanskrit: अर्यम्यं वरुण मित्र्यं वा सखायं वा सदम इद भरातरं वा वेशं वा नित्यं वरुणारणं वा यत सीम आगश चक्र्मा शिश्रथस तत |||
verses.transliteration: aryamyaṃ varuṇa mitryaṃ vā sakhāyaṃ vā sadam id bhrātaraṃ vā veśaṃ vā nityaṃ varuṇāraṇaṃ vā yat sīm āghaś cakṛmā śiśrathas tat

translations.griffith: If we have sinned against the man who loves us, have ever wronged a brother, friend, or comrade,  The neighbour ever with us, or a stranger, O Varuṇa, remove from us the trespass.

verses.sanskrit: कितवासो यद रिरिपुर न दीवि यद वा घा सत्यम उत यन न विद्म सर्वा ता वि षय शिथिरेव देवाधा ते सयाम वरुण परियासः |||
verses.transliteration: kitavāso yad riripur na dīvi yad vā ghā satyam uta yan na vidma sarvā tā vi ṣya śithireva devādhā te syāma varuṇa priyāsaḥ

translations.griffith: If we, as gamesters cheat at play, have cheated, done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose,  Cast all these sins away like loosened fetters, and, Varuṇa let us be thine own beloved.

verses.sanskrit: इन्द्राग्नी यम अवथ उभा वाजेषु मर्त्यम दर्ळ्हा चित स पर भेदति दयुम्ना वाणीर इव तरितः |||
verses.transliteration: indrāghnī yam avatha ubhā vājeṣu martyam dṛḷhā cit sa pra bhedati dyumnā vāṇīr iva tritaḥ

translations.griffith: THE mortal man whom ye, the Twain, Indra and Agni, help in fight,  Breaks through e’en strongly-guarded wealth as Tṛta burst his way through reeds.

verses.sanskrit: या पर्तनासु दुष्टरा या वाजेषु शरवाय्या या पञ्च चर्षणीर अभॄन्द्राग्नी ता हवामहे |||
verses.transliteration: yā pṛtanāsu duṣṭarā yā vājeṣu śravāyyā yā pañca carṣaṇīr abhṝndrāghnī tā havāmahe

translations.griffith: The Twain invincible in war, worthy to be renowned in frays,  Lords of the Fivefold. People, these, Indra and Agni, we invoke.

verses.sanskrit: तयोर इद अमवच छवस तिग्मा दिद्युन मघोनोः परति दरुणा गभस्त्योर गवां वर्त्रघ्न एषते |||
verses.transliteration: tayor id amavac chavas tighmā didyun maghonoḥ prati druṇā ghabhastyor ghavāṃ vṛtraghna eṣate

translations.griffith: Impetuous is their strength, and keen the lightning of the mighty Pair,  Which from their arms speeds with the car to Vṛtra's slayer for the kine.

verses.sanskrit: ता वाम एषे रथानाम इन्द्राग्नी हवामहे पती तुरस्य राधसो विद्वांसा गिर्वणस्तमा |||
verses.transliteration: tā vām eṣe rathānām indrāghnī havāmahe patī turasya rādhaso vidvāṃsā ghirvaṇastamā

translations.griffith: Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, as such, to send your cars:  Lords of quick-coming bounty, ye who know, chief lovers of the song.

verses.sanskrit: ता वर्धन्ताव अनु दयून मर्ताय देवाव अदभा अर्हन्ता चित पुरो दधे ऽंशेव देवाव अर्वते |||
verses.transliteration: tā vṛdhantāv anu dyūn martāya devāv adabhā arhantā cit puro dadhe 'ṃśeva devāv arvate

translations.griffith: These who give increase day by day, Gods without guile for mortal man,  Worthy themselves, I honour most, Two Gods as partners, for my horse.

verses.sanskrit: एवेन्द्राग्निभ्याम अहावि हव्यं शूष्यं घर्तं न पूतम अद्रिभिः ता सूरिषु शरवो बर्हद रयिं गर्णत्सु दिध्र्तम इषं गर्णत्सु दिध्र्तम |||
verses.transliteration: evendrāghnibhyām ahāvi havyaṃ śūṣyaṃ ghṛtaṃ na pūtam adribhiḥ tā sūriṣu śravo bṛhad rayiṃ ghṛṇatsu didhṛtam iṣaṃ ghṛṇatsu didhṛtam

translations.griffith: The strength-bestowing offering thus to Indra-Agni hath been paid, as butter, purified by stones.  Deal to our princes high renown, deal wealth to those who sing your praise, deal food to those who sing your praise.

verses.sanskrit: पर वो महे मतयो यन्तु विष्णवे मरुत्वते गिरिजा एवयामरुत पर शर्धाय परयज्यवे सुखादये तवसे भन्ददिष्टये धुनिव्रताय शवसे |||
verses.transliteration: pra vo mahe matayo yantu viṣṇave marutvate ghirijā evayāmarut pra śardhāya prayajyave sukhādaye tavase bhandadiṣṭaye dhunivratāya śavase

translations.griffith: To Viṣṇu, to the Mighty whom the Maruts follow let your hymns born in song go forth, Evayamarut;  To the impetuous, strong band, adorned with bracelets, that rushes on in joy and ever roars for vigour.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये जाता महिना ये च नु सवयम पर विद्मना बरुवत एवयामरुत करत्वा तद वो मरुतो नाध्र्षे शवो दाना मह्ना तद एषाम अध्र्ष्टासो नाद्रयः |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye jātā mahinā ye ca nu svayam pra vidmanā bruvata evayāmarut kratvā tad vo maruto nādhṛṣe śavo dānā mahnā tad eṣām adhṛṣṭāso nādrayaḥ

translations.griffith: They who with might were manifest, and who willingly by their own knowledge told it forth, Evayamarut.  Maruts, this strength of yours no wisdom comprehendeth: through their gifts' greatness they are moveless as the mountains.

verses.sanskrit: पर ये दिवो बर्हतः शर्ण्विरे गिरा सुशुक्वानः सुभ्व एवयामरुत न येषाम इरी सधस्थ ईष्ट आं अग्नयो न सवविद्युतः पर सयन्द्रासो धुनीनाम |||
verses.transliteration: pra ye divo bṛhataḥ śṛṇvire ghirā suśukvānaḥ subhva evayāmarut na yeṣām irī sadhastha īṣṭa āṃ aghnayo na svavidyutaḥ pra syandrāso dhunīnām

translations.griffith: Who by the psalm they sing are heard, from lofty heaven, the strong, the brightly shining Ones, Evayamarut;  In whose abode there is no mightier one to move them, whose lightnings are as fires, who urge the roaring rivers.

verses.sanskrit: स चक्रमे महतो निर उरुक्रमः समानस्मात सदस एवयामरुत यदायुक्त तमना सवाद अधि षणुभिर विष्पर्धसो विमहसो जिगाति शेव्र्धो नर्भिः |||
verses.transliteration: sa cakrame mahato nir urukramaḥ samānasmāt sadasa evayāmarut yadāyukta tmanā svād adhi ṣṇubhir viṣpardhaso vimahaso jighāti śevṛdho nṛbhiḥ

translations.griffith: He of the Mighty Stride forth strode, Evayamarut, out of the spacious dwelling-place, their home in common.  When he, himself, hath yoked his emulous strong horses on heights, he cometh forth, joy-giving, with the Heroes.

verses.sanskrit: सवनो न वो ऽमवान रेजयद वर्षा तवेषो ययिस तविष एवयामरुत येना सहन्त रञ्जत सवरोचिष सथारश्मानो हिरण्ययाः सवायुधास इष्मिणः |||
verses.transliteration: svano na vo 'mavān rejayad vṛṣā tveṣo yayis taviṣa evayāmarut yenā sahanta ṛñjata svarociṣa sthāraśmāno hiraṇyayāḥ svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ

translations.griffith: Like your tremendous roar, the rainer with light flashing, strong, speeding, hath made all tremble, Evayamarut,  Wherewith victorious ye, self-luminous, press onward, with strong reins, decked with gold, impetuous and well-weaponed.

verses.sanskrit: अपारो वो महिमा वर्द्धशवसस तवेषं शवो ऽवत्व एवयामरुत सथातारो हि परसितौ संद्र्शि सथन ते न उरुष्यता निदः शुशुक्वांसो नाग्नयः |||
verses.transliteration: apāro vo mahimā vṛddhaśavasas tveṣaṃ śavo 'vatv evayāmarut sthātāro hi prasitau saṃdṛśi sthana te na uruṣyatā nidaḥ śuśukvāṃso nāghnayaḥ

translations.griffith: Unbounded is your greatness, ye of mighty power: may your bright vigour be our aid, Evayamarut;  For ye are visible helpers in the time of trouble: like fires, aglow with light, save us from shame and insult.

verses.sanskrit: ते रुद्रासः सुमखा अग्नयो यथा तुविद्युम्ना अवन्त्व एवयामरुत दीर्घम पर्थु पप्रथे सद्म पार्थिवं येषाम अज्मेष्व आ महः शर्धांस्य अद्भुतैनसाम |||
verses.transliteration: te rudrāsaḥ sumakhā aghnayo yathā tuvidyumnā avantv evayāmarut dīrgham pṛthu paprathe sadma pārthivaṃ yeṣām ajmeṣv ā mahaḥ śardhāṃsy adbhutainasām

translations.griffith: So may the Rudras, mighty warriors, Evayamarut, with splendid brilliancy, like fires, be our protectors;  They whose terrestrial dwelling-place is wide-extended, whom none suspect of sin, whose bands have lofty courage.

verses.sanskrit: अद्वेषो नो मरुतो गातुम एतन शरोता हवं जरितुर एवयामरुत विष्णोर महः समन्यवो युयोतन समद रथ्यो न दंसनाप दवेषांसि सनुतः |||
verses.transliteration: adveṣo no maruto ghātum etana śrotā havaṃ jaritur evayāmarut viṣṇor mahaḥ samanyavo yuyotana smad rathyo na daṃsanāpa dveṣāṃsi sanutaḥ

translations.griffith: Come in a friendly spirit, come to us, O Maruts, and hear his call who praises you, Evayamarut.  Like car-borne men, one-minded with the mighty Viṣṇu, keep enmity far from us with your deeds of wonder.

verses.sanskrit: गन्ता नो यज्ञं यज्ञियाः सुशमि शरोता हवम अरक्ष एवयामरुत जयेष्ठासो न पर्वतासो वयोमनि यूयं तस्य परचेतसः सयात दुर्धर्तवो निदः |||
verses.transliteration: ghantā no yajñaṃ yajñiyāḥ suśami śrotā havam arakṣa evayāmarut jyeṣṭhāso na parvatāso vyomani yūyaṃ tasya pracetasaḥ syāta durdhartavo nidaḥ

translations.griffith: Come to our sacrifice, ye Hnly Ones, to bless it, and, free from demons, hear our call, Evayamarut.
